I loved and enjoyed my experience here so much that I decided to bring my family here to give it a try. We came on a Friday evening and were given a table in less than 5 minutes (without a reservation). The staff were extremely nice (as expected) and very, very polite. 

The kids were handed a kids menu (priced reasonably)
and ordered cheeseburgers with fries, which were mouth watering. 
We ordered 2 clam chowders ( 1 in a bread bowl and 1 is a regular bowl), the swordfish, chicken pasta, and fish n chips. 

We left over-the-top happy and satisfied with the service and our meal. 

This is a must-try restaurant if you come to SF.

author: Sorayah T.
stars: We had reservations for lunch & the location was very convenient! We got the sliders & calamari for starters, as they were both mouth watering. The place was very elegant and service was outstanding!

author: Erika N.
stars:
Of course being my first time in SF I was in need of some good calm chowder and this place certainly did not disappoint. After exploring some of fisherman's wharf and pier 39 my boyfriend and I decided to stop here for lunch. The overall service was exceptional. Our waitress was super friendly and very helpful with making recommendations for us. 

Food wise I decided to go with the soup and salad combo while my bae picked the fish and chips. Before the meal we were also provided with complimentary sour dough bread and butter. It came out very fresh, hot & delicious. Once my meal arrived I surprisingly fall in love with the Caesar salad more then the chowder. The dressing was perfect and the romaine hearts were very crisp and tasty. I did enjoy my chowder as well, but would have liked to see more clams. For the fish and chips I managed to sneak in a few bites in and man oh man, it was spectacular. It almost made me regret my ordering decision. 

You simply can't pass up this place while at the pier. The food, service and views are all outstanding!

author: Jenn S.
stars: Was looking for a restaurant open on Christmas Eve to meet a friend for holiday dinner, drinks and girl talk. I stumbled across Fog Harbor on yelp and decided to give it a try. The ambiance is fabulous and great for pictures. My girlfriend and I both ordered the Lipstick cocktail and it was delicious. We were seated at our booth nearby and were greeted by our server, Shakura. She was very polite, professional and engaging and made recommendations of appetizers and drinks. We started with the crab cakes that were very good. We ordered our entrees and while I enjoyed my penne pasta with a substitute of shrimp my friend didn't enjoy her choice. Shakura was very understanding and made other suggestions which were ordered and prepared swiftly and to perfection. Our server was patient and kind which we really appreciated and made our experience even that much more enjoyable. Overall the food, service, and ambience were outstanding and I'll have to come back for date night with my husband.

author: Sharay D.
stars:
Well I want to give 5 stars to the staff working behind the bar on Sunday. This was my second time coming here.They were excellent.so nice and friendly. Ordered garlic crab whole. What I didn't like was the butter wasn't salted. It was tender though. That came with veggies. And for dessert has the chocolate chip bread pudding with vanilla ice cream. 
I will come back again.

author: Gabriella H.
stars: So yummy and amazing service! We had the poke' and calamari and fish and Chips ! Jim was our server and he was so awesome!

author: Hailey O.
stars: This was our first time visiting San Francisco and Fisherman's Wharf. We heard good things about Fog Harbor Fish House and it lived up to expectations. The food was very fresh and tasty while the service from Michael was quite pleasant. Michael gave wonderful recommendations for us both and made sure we loved what we ate. Our food was delightful we started with the bleu cheese garlic bread and the Clam chowder and both were amazing! Not too much cheese and not too much garlic, it was wonderful. For entrees we ordered the flat iron steak and the cioppino. The steak was cooked to perfection and the whiskey sauce was wonderful. The seafood in the cioppino was very flavorful and fresh. On our next trip back out here, we will be returning!

author: Alyssa A.
stars:
My rule: 1 star for atmosphere, 1 star for service, 1 star for price, 2 stars for food=5 stars. 

Atmosphere: The atmosphere was great. Very nice and very clean. And the window seats are great. 
1/1 star

Service: The staff were very friendly with giving us a window seat when we asked for it. Though there was no one to sit us to our table at first but all was good. They always kept asking if we were good and even put a bib on my Abuela. 
1/1 star

Price: Here's were the streak ends. For a group of 4 with 5 things order it was $126. And they asked for a $20 tip. The food was great but the price was a bit of a bummer. 
0/1 star

Food: My parents ordered there famous chowder bread bowl and I tried it and it was delicious. I got seafood pasta and it was also delicious. The sauce on the pasta had incredible flavor. 
2/2 stars

All in all, 4/5 stars.

author: Matt M.
stars:
Great service and great food. Had fish and chips - very good. 3 pieces of fish. 
Also had apple walnut crisp for dessert. 

Only negative is they don't serve Coca Cola. It is a Pepsi place.

author: Christy C.
stars: I thought this was decent food, but I wasn't as impressed as I thought I'd be. I ordered the clam chowder, billed as "award winning." I found it tasty, but certainly not the best I've ever had. We also ordered blue cheese bread, which was tasty, but very salty. For my main dish I had the scallops and crab risotto. I thought the scallops were the best part--they melted in my mouth. The risotto was good, but not as creamy as I wanted it to be. My drink (something Alcatraz) was decent, but VERY sweet. I'm glad we tried this location, but I'd skip it if we return to the area.

author: Katelynn A.
stars: Really great little restaurant right on the harbor in Pier 39. I was really hoping for some clam chowder and a local beer and this place hit the spot. One of the best clam chowder bread bowls I've ever had!

author: Eric T.
stars: The view here was great, sitting right next to the pier. The server this time around was a little inexperienced but he was very friendly. The food had some which were expensive and some which were not but overall, the flavor of everything was great! There was a bold flavor from the clam chowder and you could taste the sea from the oysters and mussels. This place is a great casual place for some good seafood!

author: The Sun '.
stars:
This restaurant is located on Pier 39 and a hidden gem for locals like me!

Mostly filled with tourists on the 2nd level near the main entrance, it's easily missed or overlooked.

Been here several times and the crab salad hasn't disappointed! Refreshing salad that can be shared by two with very generous amounts of crab. 

Our group also ordered a seafood pasta, crab salad and halibut. All was delish but nothing beats the crab salad!

Service was attentive and our waiters each visit was nice and friendly. 

To top it off, the view of the waters was a plus and the restaurant validates up to 2 hrs of you park in the adjacent garage.

author: Joseph O.
stars: Clam chowder is worth going. Dungeness season should not be missed. The seared tuna is amazing.

author: Jen M.
stars:
After a great (but pricey) breakfast at Taylor Street Coffee Shop, a quick visit to the Golden Gate Bridge, and a leisurely stroll up and down Lombard street, we decided to walk to Fisherman's Wharf for a few hours before we head to Alcatraz.

After a couple hours of shopping, picture-taking, and people-watching, we decided to find a spot for drinks and snacks. I already had Fog Harbor in mind since the JW Marriott concierge highly recommended it when we had arrived, although I almost changed my mind when i saw how many people were waiting for a table! Took me almost 5 minutes just to get to the hostess to put my name in, and was told it would be at least a 45 minute wait. We decided to grab some drinks from the bar while we waited and luckily, a couple of spots opened up right at the bar!

The bartenders were all very professional and friendly. I started with a glass of prosecco then switched to syrah; hubby started and ended with syrah. We ended up ordering way too many drinks and only the crab cake app to share (delish!), but it came with some warm sourdough bread and butter - perfect for soaking up all that wine we consumed!

Great vibe overall, and we were definitely impressed with the efficient and friendly service, especially since we sat next to an older, much drunker and rowdier couple, and the bartenders were able to handle them extremely well without any sign of irritation. Sad that we weren't able to try more of their food - will have to go back the next time we're in SF!

author: Tabetha S.
stars:
It was my first time eating at the Fog Harbor Fish House and everything was amazing! From start to end, everything was great, not to mention the view.

I ordered the clam chowder and the Pacific Cod, both of which were delicious. The service was also really good. My waitress constantly checked on us to make sure that our drinks were filled and that we were had everything we needed. Although it is a little pricey, it was worth it!

author: June C.
stars: Walked in at 730pm on a Friday night with a party of 8 and they were able to seat us right away at a great round table in a quieter corner in the bar area with spectacular views of the water.     Five stars right there!     Amazingly attentive Waite staff and very quick with bringing out drinks and appetizers and dinner orders.     We ordered the seafood tower which was good but seemed a bit small for all of us.   The Crispi calamari was very crisp and maybe a bit heavy on the batter, but very good.   Several ordered the fish stew and said it was great.  Several others ordered the scallops risotto.   The scallops looked a bit small to me although everyone really enjoyed their food.   I ordered a house salad which was huge so share it if you order and a bucket of clams.    All very good and we left very satisfied.

author: Shannon B.
stars: I was dinning alone so sat at the bar. Service was fine, nothing special. Food was okay until I found a hair in my mash potatoes. I got the mixed grill and the salmon was under done, still slimy in the middle. Best part of my dinner was the hot fresh bread and the Strawberry-Basil Nojito. I wouldn't go back. Many other places to choose from.

author: Amanda L.
stars: Really delicious food and great atmosphere. Drinks are bomb and all seafood is amazing/fresh. We always come here for special occasions :)

author: Ryan Y.
stars:
I must admit when I first walked up to Fog Harbor I was extremely skeptical.  Like seriously, a seafood restaurant in Pier 39?  Being a native of the Bay Area I always associated Pier 39 with overpriced parking and totally tourist trap restaurants.  Value, flavor, and good service in this area historically was very hard to come by.  

But alas, my wife was craving seafood and we were already on location so I said - why not?!   So my wife and I shared a shellfish platter for 2 and my kids shared the sliders appetizer.  The dinner also came with delicious warm sourdough - which was absolutely delicious - and went along perfectly with the shellfish platter's garlic/butter sauce - like a delicious slice of warm garlic bread MMMMMMMMmmmm...

The shellfish platter portion size was very generous, and the crab meat was tender and sweet.  I am a big fan of shellfish - and I felt the mussels and clams were absolutely wonderful!  Shrimp were on the smaller size - but still nice nonetheless.

The star of the show however was our waiter - Jose.  He was amazing in his attentiveness - he even brought out a live "condemned" lobster to cheer my crying daughter up.  He totally went the extra mile to make our experience incredibly memorable.   Kudos to Jose!

author: Xiaofan C.
stars: Food is heavy. Bread is sour. Couldn't understand it's on top restaurant list of SF

author: Daniel H.
stars: Great food, good service and a nice location.  Took the family for a nice evening out and was pleasantly surprised at how professional the staff was. They took out order quickly, they were kind and truly seemed to care about their job which doesn't happen too often. We got the food pretty quickly but not fast enough to where it seemed to be waiting for us, which is reassuring lol, and the food was great. 10/10 will come back to this fine establishment

author: Ervin T.
stars:
Very busy, place, but the food was delivered hot and ready to eat.  Enjoyed a nice dinner with family, and the food was great.  The Calamari appetizer was like a full meal, so servings are plentiful. The variety of food offered well fits the traveling eater.

2nd time we have dined there over the last few years.  Considering when you come off the tours, everything is closed.

author: Kathryn P.
stars:
I came here for a celebratory lunch on a weekend with family. I had heard and read stellar reviews of the restaurant so I was really looking forward to it. I think 3 stars is right on, as I wasn't necessarily disappointed with my experience, but it's wasn't anything to write home about either.

The best parts about the restaurant are the wait staff and the views of the bay. The staff is extremely friendly and accommodating, and the large windows in the dining room ensure most tables have a great view of the bay and golden gate bridge. This is a great addition to the touristy area of Pier39, and I would say probably the best restaurant in the area. However, even for a "tourist trap" area, I was still surprised at some of the prices for the entrees, especially for A) the portion size and B) the quality. I wound up ordering the muscles and fries off the appetizer menu as an entrée, and have definitely had better in the city, even at non-seafood restaurants. I sampled the crab cakes and seafood sampler from others in our party and they were just a-OK. All in all, a great place for apps/drinks and to take in a view when you're in the neighborhood, but nothing I would make a cross-town, weeks in advance reservation for.

author: Vee V.
stars:
The hostesses could use some customer service lessons. Smiling to start would be amazing. 

I strolled in at 5:30pm on a Monday and asked to be by the window so I could have a nice view. The host took me to the furthest seat from the window. I was practically next to the host stand at the front of the restaurant. Umm...no thanks. I asked to wait to be seated at a window instead. A guy, I assume a manager, although friendly, asked if I absolutely needed to be at a window. Umm...yes. 

25 minutes later I'm back, and I'm at a window seat. The view was worth the wait, and especially being a solo diner. 

I ordered an old fashion, half a dozen raw oysters, and the clam chowder in a sour dough bowl with a side salad. My old fashion came in a glass that was only half filled and full of pulp. Three of my six oysters were gritty as hell, and a couple had bits of broken shell. Not impressed. 

The clam chowder was decent, but not something I'd come back for. 

The server was nice, and the view was spectacular, but the prices and food were not worth it. I recommend maybe a drink and app, but go elsewhere for entrees.

author: M. B.
stars: I was pleasantly surprised by this place which I have had numerous chances to try over the years but never did. As a Bay Area local I rarely dine at restaurants in this part of the city because the few I have tried were pretty disappointing, which is no huge surprise considering the area is a tourist magnet and always super busy. I was at the pier with  my kids over the weekend Pokemon hunting, and they were starving so we ventured into this place. The ambience was actually very nice, and though we had to wait, the outside patio had comfortable seating (and some outlets) so all was good. I glanced at the menu and the food selections seemed good with plenty of variety. Everything we ordered tasted great (the salad, chowder, salmon and cioppino were delicious). They have a nice bar with lots of options and draft beer. The best thing about this place, though, was our amazing server, Giha. She is the best! I  can sometimes be complicated when it comes to making decisions/finalizing orders/making special requests, and and Giha was completely sweet and accommodating the entire time. She made us feel totally comfortable and went out of her way to make sure everything was perfect. Best part - she was super nice to my kids. I will definitely be coming back to this place. Wish I had tried it sooner!

author: Jennifer S.
stars: Beautiful setting, delicious meal, attentive server. Jane took very good care of us.  She was gracious and kind.  She made a memorable part of our vacation more special.  We'll talk about this experience as we recall our trip.

author: Steph B.
stars: This place is one of my favorites the atmosphere is relaxing and you have a beautiful view of the bay. I love there salads and fish plates, there baked oysters are my absolute favorite any time we have family or friends here from out of town we make sure to bring them here. There garlic crab could use some help it's kinda on the dry side, maybe if they put more butter, garlic and cooked it a little less it would be better. This is still one of my favorite places to eat at Pier 39.

author: Will H.
stars: I've seen a lot of great items being served but my rating is based on what I ate.  Which I feel should be a general standard for a so called "fish house" I ordered a basic fish and chips and couldn't even finish it.  Probably the worst fish I've ever had.  I think I'd rather have nasty tilapia over whatever it was they served.  McDonald's fries over theirs and how do you f$@" up a Cesar salad.  Don't waste your money.

author: Rachel G.
stars: Excellent food and service! Mike was our waiter and explained to me how to eat crab legs because I was a little intimidated, haha. The crab legs and crab cakes were delicious! I definitely recommend.

author: Sarah S.
stars: This place was absolutely amazing! I took my boyfriend here for his birthday and it was perfect. We were seated by the window which was lovely. The food was amazing. The oysters were so fresh and delicious! We both ordered the Cioppino and it was the best I have ever had. It was sooooo good. Our waitress was great as well! The service was wonderful. I recommend making a reservation! We did and it worked out great. The only reason we didn't give this 5 stars was due to the hostess. I can't remember her name -- she had black curly hair. She wasn't very nice to us and she was very rude to this other man. She's your restaurants first impression! I would fix that! Other than that, everything was amazing.

author: Kristen A.
stars: We went here for happy hour and sat at the bar. Mark sold us on the best clam chowder in SF and he wasn't lying. It was amazing. We also had their garlic fries and fried calamari - both were delicious! Glad we stopped here. Give it a try.

author: Laura O.
stars:
Great food, service could be better, but ambiance and food were fenomenal!
Our server seemed rushed and tired, the blue cheese on the filet mignon was a little overwhelming... other than that we had a good experiences and would recommended to others.

author: Harshini R.
stars: Loved absolutely everything here! The service was great. The food was amazing and the dessert was pretty good too. We got the baked oysters and the garlic roasted crab and topped it off with the strawberry shortcake. Every one of those dishes were delicious and it's all thanks to our wonderful waitress who helped with recommendations.

author: Heraldo L.
stars: I have been here 2 times already and I can say that they have some of the best food & service I have had up to date. The salmon, with a tomato relish was sooo good, with a healthy hint of spice. Fresh sourdough bread with butter was fantasic. Always a pleasure, always leaving happy. Views from the dining area are killer, to the left you see Golden Gate, to the right Alcatraz. Definitely recommend.

author: Joanne Y.
stars:
I came here on a Sunday after paying a visit to the SF MOMA nearby. The whole pier was pretty busy, so I was expecting a wait. The wait for a table was 30-40 minutes. It's convenient here because they'll send you a text once your table is ready. So put your number down and feel free to explore the pier a bit!

We ordered a bowl of clam chowder, the red chili garlic shrimp, the cioppino (A MUST GET), and the mixed grill. The clam chowder was delicious! I definitely can't finish a whole serving by myself as it's super hearty and creamy. The red chili garlic shrimp was pretty good - spicy and tangy. The cioppino was sooooo delicious. For $33; they definitely don't skip on the mussels, clams, fish, shrimp, crab, and scallops. This dish is served with what seems to be a piece of garlic bread but I bypassed eating that. The mixed grill consists of grilled salmon, swordfish, shrimp, veggies, and mashed potatoes. I didn't really try much of the mixed grill, but my friend really enjoyed it! 

The service here was pretty good too albeit it being bustling with patrons. I'll definitely be back to try different items on the menu! They do validate up to 1 hour for parking if you park in the garage nearby.

P.S. Ask for a picture menu to make your selection process a little easier :)

author: Cynthia X.
stars:
Hmmm about this place. It's ok, if you are a tourist and want to eat at the pier by the water, but then again, there are other options, and I'd prefer Scoma at Fishermans Wharf for the parking situation.

Fog Harbor Fish House - the food is very standard and mediocre, over priced of course, but that is expected. Knock off half a star.

It's hard to make reservations and the lines are always so long because of tourists. They'll validate you for the garage, but only for 1 hour, which is ridiculous because the wait itself would take up a lot of that time. The garage is then $9 and hour after that. Knock off half a star.

All the above can be forgiven because the view, BUT knocking off 2 stars because the service. Service was not great at all. We had reservations but was constantly reminded that the entire party had to be there, and that they would only hold our table for 15min. Our waitress was not the most attentive and served our entree and appetizers all at once (oh and the clam chowder in bread bowl last). Granted we were sharing everything among 9 people, but at least you could separate the appetizers / salads / soups and serve them first. 

Our table was so crowded, we didn't know where to start eating, and as we ate the appetizers, salads and soups, our entrees sat at the table getting cold.

author: Hoyan L.
stars: Came back again for Fleet Week and this place is still as amazing as I remembered. The mussel fries were still ah-freakin-mazing(!) and the clam chowder was really good. It was my boyfriend's first time and he was in heaven. They sat us next to the windows where the Blue Angels were putting on a spectacular show. Everything was perfect and it was a lunch to remember. Thank you Fog Harbor!

author: Priscilla V.
stars: My boyfriend brought me here for my birthday one year and I fell in love! The restaurant is beautiful the view was beautiful the servers were amazing and the food was to die for. If your a seafood lover you have to come to Fog Harbor, you won't be disappointed!

author: Giovanna B.
stars: Great experience. Friendly place and excellent seefood quality. The salmon is something that you should try. our server Micheal was pleasant and attentive. He gave us suggestions about yhe menu and he was right on everything.

author: Angela H.
stars:
Really nice late lunch, and we got to catch the Fleet Week air show with the Blue Angels from our table. That alone should be worthy of five stars, but I need to deduct a star for my food. I ordered the ahi tuna, which was supposed to be seared rare, but it was cooked maybe medium/medium-rare... the wasabi aioli was really nice, though, and the rice it came with was super tasty. I also had the hibiscus margarita, and that was bomb! apparently it's voted the best margarita in the city by SF Weekly, and it was easy to see why. I also enjoyed the bleu cheese garlic bread that we got for a starter, especially dipped in a little bit of the lemon aioli that came with the calamari starter.

So. Two starters, two drinks each, and two entrees came out to $135 pre-tax. We spent about two hours there (or just over), and had a good meal and good entertainment with the air show. expensive, but worthwhile. Had the tuna been actually rare, I'd have given this visit five stars.

author: Ash S.
stars:
Fog Fish Harbor House has a spectacular view of the water and is located in the heart of touristy fisherman's wharf. It is located on the second floor if you are searching for it.

I had the Mixed Grill, which included shrimp, salmon, and mahi mahi. I was also able to try the clam chowder bread bowl as well. I really enjoyed the sourdough bread along with the clam chowder. The salmon was the best item I had here. It was flavorful and juicy with a slight char that was not overpowering. The mahi mahi was a little dry and overcooked. The grilled shrimp had a nice charcoal to it like the salmon.

author: Surf City M.
stars: The crab roll was legit!  Full of crab, celery and a light sauce on toasted sourdough.  I also tried the award winning clam chowder which was really good.  My family and I were seated in a nice spot with view of Alcatraz and enjoyed some nice cocktails.

author: Adriana D.
stars: Delicious food and service!!! My husband throughly enjoyed the seafood! The steak was cooked to perfection! They were very careful with my shellfish allergy and even put an allergy sign in my steak. Will be back!!

author: Colt R.
stars: This is an excellent place to grab lunch or dinner and enjoy an incredible view of the harbor. They have plenty of good starters and their entrees are very filling. I recommend having a Bloody Mary to start off your meal if you really want to set the mood.

author: Miguel G.
stars: Always good food and great service. Anytime I'm asked about seafood in sf I always recommend Fog Harbor first.

author: Stephanie L.
stars: The clam chowder and the linguini and clams are amazing! The service is very nice, and the food is delicious and priced rather okay in my opinion. The clam chowder with the sourdough bowl was 11$, and the linguini with clams was 20$. This is a perfect spot for good seafood and to overlook the bay. I would highly recommend this place as a date night location for dinner as well. :)

author: Megan W.
stars: If you like Salmon this is by far the best I've ever had. Came here when on vacation and had a great time. Their margaritas are excellent too. Always very a reservation, especially on weekends.

author: Aaron P.
stars:
I would give them a four or five stars, but 3 out of the 50 servers actually wanted to be there. Hardly any of them had a good attitude or were pleasant. The food was excellent, but they made you feel like you were imposing on their time at their restaurant.

Thank you for your response. Im not sure how to leave a comment on a comment, so hopefully you get this. I'm not going to say the name of my server because as I looked around, I only found one server... shorter Hispanic older gentleman... that seamed to be personable and desired to work. I was there on Friday night, March 30th.

author: Zoe F.
stars:
Came here because of the insane amount of reviews and rating. I was no disappointed!

First off, the view really makes this restaurant. If it wasn't for the view, I do not think it would be as popular as it is based off the food alone. The food was good, but in teams of seafood, there are much better places to eat.

We sat at the bar and loved every second of it. The bartenders working were both awesome. Two older guys who had huge personality and top notch service. We tried a few different things off the menu, but the clam chowder was the best hands down. Even though it's not the best I've had in the city, it did a pretty damn good job. The fish I had was tasty but everything else they threw on the plate really took away from the protein itself. My roommate had lobster, which he said was incredible. The drinks we ordered were are very sweet but tasty nonetheless. 

The line is insane. Make sure you are prepared to wait because you will and for a while. We were really lucky to find a seat at that bar almost immediately! If not, we would have waited at least 45 minutes for 2 people.

author: Anum S.
stars: I'm giving this a 3 star only because I felt our server was not very welcoming. It was my husband and my birthday and we chose this restaurant over many others after seeing the great views. The food was good!

author: Kathleen W.
stars: Came here to celebrate our anniversary on our only night in San Fran. It was amazing! We put our name on the list and requested a window view. They were very accommodating and it was nice to walk around the pier while we waited; the seals at the end of the pier were very entertaining. Curtiss was our waiter and took the time to ask where we were in town from and for what occasion. He made food and drink recommendations - we had the crab and scallop risotto and the panko crusted halibut, both seriously amazing. Curtiss also had a waiter in training assisting and he was very kind. Then, they gave us a dessert on the house for our anniversary! Excellent food and service.

author: Carrie C.
stars:
Walking around Pier 39 being the tourist I was, I decided to have a nice lunch with a nice view. I wanted clam chowder, crab and oysters. I didn't know I was in for a treat. The hostess was very accommodating and quoted us a reasonable waiting time. My party was seated partially (great, because I was starving!) I skimmed through the menu and told myself to try not to order everything on the menu. 

Views of the Alcatraz, Sf Bay, Golden Gate Bridge, so request a table by the window. 

Clam chowder with a side of their fresh house-made sourdough bread. I was delighted when I found out they were serving my favorite oysters that day, Miyagi's from British Columbia (plump, briny, deep cup, meaty, perfection!) an immediate dozen to begin please. Clams linguine with a generous portion of fresh clams. Garlic herb roasted dungeness crab comes pre-cracked with a side of veggies and potatoes. The fried platter came with a delicious lemon aioli sauce but the fried seafood was a miss though. Our server and the wait staff was awesome, attentive and nice. For desserts, there's no menu. They will bring you a whole tray of "display" desserts for you to select from. Love this idea. I went with the dessert duo of house-made vanilla bean creme brulee and warm chocolate fudge cake. 

Take your receipt with you for 30% off Biscoff downstairs

5 stars for great food quality and great service!

author: Salil K.
stars:
We were lucky enough to get a seat at a table that had a beautiful view of Alcatraz and the bay. Can't complain there! Fisherman's wharf is super touristy so I didn't have high expectations for this place. I'd say it was what I expected. I ordered the crab roll which was MASSIVE. The crab to bread ratio is kind of off but it really fills you up. Fries come with it so it was hard for me to finish everything. Pricey but it's seafood in a touristy area so what do you expect. 

This place seemed to be higher rated than most in the area so I'm glad I went here. One and done for me though.  Definitely ask for a table with a view it makes a difference!

author: Janette B.
stars: Great Food- Crab was so fresh and Sole was Amazing! Great Service and Terrific Views of the Waterfront!

author: Racheal D.
stars:
I am so happy I picked this place as our to go restaurant when my friend and I visited Pier 39.  Even though the wait was an hour long, it was well worth it!  Service here is impeccable and food here is amazing.

They start you off with complimentary sourdough bread and you might think complimentary bread won't be that special but let me tell you... this bread was SOOOOO GOOD.  It came wrapped in a towel to preserve the warmness.  The bread tears apart so effortlessly and it goes PERFECTLY with the butter they supply you with.

My friend and I ordered non-alcoholic drinks first.  We both got the Strawberry-Basil Nojito ($7.00).  This was made with fresh mint, basil and strawberries muddled with fresh lime juice, and soda water.  I could not stop drinking this - it was super fresh and rejuvenating.  I highly recommend!

For our entrees, we ordered the following:

Bowl of Clam Chowder ($8.00) - award winning clam chowder.  This was thick and creamy - very very tasty... paired with the sourdough bread - my god, HEAVEN!

Ahi Tuna Poke ($17.00) - marinated raw tuna, avocado, mango, sesame-soy sauce and wasabi aioli.  My first time having poke in the west coast and I was not disappointed.  They give you these sesame chips to go with the poke and it just blends so well with each other.

1/2 dozen of Oysters ($15.00) - pretty standard oysters... but definitely very fresh!

Mixed Grilled ($26.00) - grilled salmon, swordfish and shrimp, citrus beurre blanc, sautéed vegetables and garlic mashed potatoes.  Our server was nice enough to split this into two plates for my friend and I!  The swordfish was really soft and easy to eat, salmon was fresh as well.

Overall - I really enjoyed my experience here and will definitely come back when I visit SanFran again!

author: Jeff E.
stars: Had a stop in after our tour of Alcatraz Island. Got seated right away, both of us ordered cocktails and they were pretty good! Something hibiscus was my favorite. I really liked my fish and the fish and chips were good too. Not bad, a little over priced but hey it's the location.

author: Len M.
stars:
This is my second visit to Fog Harbor.  Both times we've had delicious meals served by a highly efficient, friendly wait staff. 

Because it is on Pier 39, which is the tourist epi-center of the entire city of San Francisco (literally filled with mediocre restaurants and shops selling souvenirs) I initially thought this restaurant would be mediocre too.  I was wrong.

The restaurant is located right at the front of Pier 39 on the second story, west side.  Most tourists just keep going past the entrance to the pier and head deeper.  When we arrived at lunchtime, there was a big crowd waiting to get in.  the Hostess is at the front in a  refined, but crowded waiting area.  With people lined up to give their names and get on the list, I anticipated not being able to get in or make any sort of request for desired seating style.  the hostess was personable and informed us that we would have a fifteen or twenty minute wait (which was surprising considering how many people were there waiting).

They had a few nice chairs and couches to wait on, or you could lounge outside on the second deck and people watch or sit on a comfortable couch/lounge chair while waiting for your turn.  We were called and seated in a booth (as requested) in less time than anticipated - less than five minutes.

Our waiter was very friendly and highly efficient.  

My wife ordered a fried seafood combo plate - Shrimp, fish and calamari served with cole slaw and fries.  She raved about the taste.  I had a dish of clam chowder (exceptional even by frisco standards) and fried Scallops served with a garlic/jalapeno Aoli.  

All dishes were exceptionally well prepared, flavorful, large enough in quantity to either require a take home bag or leaving some on the plate uneaten.  The hot sour dough bread that arrived before our meal was fragrant and crusty - so delicious.

Each time I've been a guest here, I have been impressed with how this restaurant handles the high volume of customers without making them feel as though they're in a production line.  Everyone is seated quickly and service is comprehensive and thoughtful. It leaves you with a feeling of a fine dining experience with great food and service.

author: Brett C.
stars: Nice view, good service, fresh clam chowder. The clam chowder is good as is expected. It was a good thickness and actually the bread bowl was a good portion, not a crazy quantity like I though it would be. Not too chunky on the potatoes and a decent amount of clams. I also got the ginger lemonade to try something different and it is light and refreshing. Highly recommend I'd you like ginger drinks.

author: Wes L.
stars: Can't think of a single thing that wasn't perfect about this place! The sourdough bread and fried calamari with aioli was my favorite part of the meal. Their Fog Harbor Lager was also delicious and a fantastic price. My girlfriend and I will be back again, and again!

author: Darren R.
stars:
We didn't expect too much from a pricey, waterfront location and we pretty much got what we expected. Ceviche was "ok", seafood stew was pretty good, burger was mediocre, etc. Beautiful location though and the waitstaff was good. In the end, I really wish we tried Scomas, it looked promising when we poked our head in later that day.
Bob, thank you for taking the time to read my review. We were in first going on Saturday at 10:45, just as you were opening. I should also add that the dinner rolls were ridiculously good!

author: WhereToTravelNext. C.
stars: Best clam chowder ever! Baked oysters and white wine definitely in "need to try" list. Plus location is brilliant. Make sure you call for reservations

author: Nat J.
stars: I use to come here whenever my friends came into town to visit, because it has a gorgeous view of the water at the pier. The first few times were great, but it worsen after those times. The time after the first few visits, the hostess had an unnecessary attitude with me. The time after that I ordered one of my favs on the menu: mussel fries, as an appetizer. However the mussels weren't cooked at all. I told the waiter that they weren't cooked, he seemed annoyed. Didn't really offer to recook them or anything, when he finally did offer...we told him that we didn't want them anymore since our main courses was about to come out. He was so pushy about about having the mussels again, so I said sure. But fyi, If theres raw mussels in my mouth...that kinda kills my appetite for mussels! However, the clam chowder bread bowl is kinda amazing, so ill give them credit where credit is due. Needless to say, my relationship with this restaurant is tumultuous.

author: V R.
stars: Do yourself a favor and never ask the bartenders if they use fresh lemon juice or limeade when they serve lemonade!  They seem to be mixologist that use everything fresh. But nothing on yelp saying they make perfect cocktails. Go figure. Must be the managers training or bad staff member.

author: A G.
stars: Great service, view, location. I was there celebrating my mans birthday and it went smooth. Food came fast however one entree was made incorrectly. I would recommend but make sure they repeat your order to make sure and changes are done correctly.

author: Tina B.
stars: My husband ordered lobster tails and he got food poisoning and was throwing up the whole night. It ruined our 3 night trip to SF!

author: Ivy L.
stars:
Decided to come here based on yelp reviews for lunch while visiting Pier 39 and the Wharf! The hostess was a little snooty because she was not happy to seat an extra person.. I believe I said 6 and then corrected myself with 7 and she must not have heard but the attitude was definitely not called for.  Oh well.. our server was nice for the large party we had.  I feel like we sat there for a long time though for just a meal and didn't end up having enough time to explore the Wharf.  

The food.. I had the mussels and they were a bit sandy and salty.  My friend said her linguine and clams were also a bit salty.  The fresh oysters were delicious though - can't go wrong with freshly shucked oysters with marinara, vinegar and horseradish!  The tuna poke was also very good and had good flavor.  They also give you fresh sour dough bread - I'm not a fan of sour dough but everyone was killing it! The calamari was decent as well, nothing special but not bad either.  Ok place on the Wharf - definitely caters to tourists.

author: Rod C.
stars: Mixed grilled plate was food but the portions will leave you hungry. I feel like or was a quarter of what you would get elsewhere. Service is great. Just don't expect to be filled up. Unless you do what I did and eat the whole loaf of bread just to feel like you ate.

author: Angie R.
stars: Quite the place for sum yummy chowder that's forsure. Nick our waiter was definitely on par for god service and speediness. It's less than 5 stars for the sole purpose of cleanliness. As you walk around to get to your table and leave there was so much dirty tables and stuff on the floor-not the best first impression. The hostesses were very nice and the wait area is quite cozy

author: Bill P.
stars: Best restaurant on the pier, food service and ambience.  five stars I'm a local and This is one of my favorite restaurants. Unfortunately if you don't have a reservation you normally have a long wait, but it's worth it.

author: Claudia S.
stars: Clan chowder soup was good.   Salmon and Sole just ok.  If you're a foodie you'll be disappointed.

author: Dave F.
stars:
Would definitely recommend Fog Harbor for a great meal. We went the first time after reading the reviews here on Yelp. We went back the next day because of the meal and service we received the night before. 
 Our waitress Susan was amazing! The chowder was one of the best we've had .. and having lived on the central coast (Splash Cafe) , we are very critical of clam chowder. 
  My wife had the fish and chips and I had the fried seafood combo. Both meals were fresh and crunchy and sauces were a nice compliment to the food. The slaw had a good tang with a hint of horseradish or wasabi ?
 The staff was very attentive and manager Juan came by to see how our experience was .. nice touch!
  See you next time we are in town! 
 Go Dodgers !!!!!

author: Adam S.
stars:
Fog Harbor is definitely in a tourist hot spot, but that didn't stop me from kicking back and enjoying the view and going all in on a seafood feast.

We waited about an hour to get in, and while we were starving we were rewarded for our patience. Clam chowder, swordfish, crab cocktail -- all things that are infinitely better in San Francisco than my hometown and I enjoyed everything here thoroughly, despite the hefty price tag. 

Our service was fine, and I get that if you're a SF native you're probably not spending a lot of time around Pier 39 but this spot came through in the clutch and I'd recommend it.

author: Glorimar A.
stars: How much I love this place! Food was fantastic. Make sure to reserve a table. Don't skip the dessert tray, you won't regrea

author: Anjelica N.
stars:
The food was pretty good. Baked oysters were room temperature, but tasty. Clam chowder was nice and hot, a good amount of clams. Swordfish was moist and delicious, however some of the potatoes were undercooked. The Perfect Hibiscus Margarita was actually PERFECT. I'm sure you're wondering why 3 stars..well the service was nonexistent. We were not checked upon by our waiter. Not once did he ask if everything was okay. After our dinner was finished, 30 minutes went past and I had to grab the waiter's attention for the check.

Side Note: I made the waiter aware that I was there celebrating my birthday. I guess they don't celebrate birthdays here and give a dessert as other places do, because nothing came after dinner.

author: Akeya H.
stars: The view is great! The service was excellent. The food was awesome. Some of the best lobster I've ever had. Service was quick and all of the staff was nice. Great atmosphere, I felt like I was on vacation.

author: José F.
stars: I am being in SFC for a week and this has been the best place for eating. The seafood was fresh and rapidly serve. The deserts excellent! Our waiter very efficient  and  kind.

author: Alex S.
stars:
Great happy hour. My wife really loved her cocktail ($7) and my Anchor Steam beer ($5) was great. We got the calamari ($7) and it was good. 

No complaints at all. Atmosphere was great. Wish we could of stayed for a meal.

author: Cristine C.
stars: This has become our favorite after-theater dinner spot!  The service and views are top notch, and the food is always amazing.  My Mom and I split the Cioppino and it was enough for both of us, though if I'm being honest I could also polish it off myself if I didn't fill up on bread.  But their warm sourdough rolls are so delicious that that's hard not to do!  Their creme brulee is on point too.  Honestly, we haven't had anything there that hasn't been fantastic.

author: Vicky C.
stars: They were very busy here so service was a little slow but overall the food was great and they serve sourdough bread rolls which are delicious!! We ordered the clam chowder bowl, linguini clam pasta, and the mixed grill dish which comes with salmon, cod, and shrimp. Overall we were happy with the food. The standout for me was the cod, the clam pasta had a very generous amount of clams and was deliciously garlicky. The clam chowder was perfect, creamy, and not overly salted with a good amount of clams. The prices are high but that is because it is a nicer sit down restaurant in the heart of Fisherman's Warf so I wouldn't expect anything less.

author: danielle a.
stars:
This is one of our favorite local spots. It's great for a sit down dinner with friends but they also have bar seating that's first come first serve. I will say the service is MUCH better if you sit at a table. Great views & for as touristy as it is the food is killer!

One of my favorite dishes is the mixed plate- comes with shrimp, sea bass and salmon. There's so much flavor & mashed potatoes & asparagus to 
Accompany the seafood. Their mussel fries are a MUST DO, so much deliciousness in a bowl & make sure to get extra bread to dip in the broth afterwards. We basically lick our plates clean. Other great options are the : shellfish platter, crab roll, clam chowder bread bowl & ahi.

The fog house lager is really good! Try their beers

author: Mingyi M.
stars: great view, great service and delicious food! Remember to make a reservation if you don't want to wait for a while.

author: Yasi F.
stars: Excellent seafood, soup, wine and beer selection. This place looks very nice, provides a great atmosphere and service, and has a very nice view.

author: Samantha M.
stars: This is the best spot on the wharf! I've been to almost all of the seafood restaurants in the area, and their clam chowder is hands down the best! The oysters rockefeller had so much flavor, and their staff was super friendly and accommodating even without reservations. I recommend this place to all of my friends from out of town.

author: Kelsey R.
stars:
We loved this place. Came to
Celebrate my Moms Birthday and the food and service did not disappoint ! Really good clam chowder if you're looking for a chowder spot. One of the best I had all weekend !

author: Leeyen R.
stars:
Beautiful view, and you won't have to wait if you come at lunchtime. It's by pier39 so is in the thick of tourist central, which makes it a great place to take your parents or anyone who is visiting San Francisco. You should call ahead to reserve a table by a window. 

Delicious bread (which is probably from nearby Bourdain) to start, and excellent seafood options from crab to cioppino to lobster to fish n chips to chowder. 

It's not a usual spot for locals to go, but is worth it for the view and the seafood.

author: Brian J.
stars:
My fiancée and I were looking for a good seafood place to eat lunch after walking around the fishermans wharf all morning. When we came across this place on yelp we were impressed with what they had so we gave it a a go.

First thing is that if you're coming for lunch on a Friday or weekend for that matter, expect to wait a while. I think we waited close to 45 min to be seated. No big deal as we just sat at the bar and killed time there. The only thing I regret is forgetting to request a window table to enjoy the view of the water. However looking back we probably would have waited longer and we were too hungry lol.

I had the garlic dungeoness crab... even though I ordered the half size, the waiter must have misheard me and got me the full order ($45). Fiancée had the mixed seafood which included grilled shrimp, grilled salmon, grilled swordfish. The crab was actually amazing! Well seasoned deep into the meat! And the crab was actually pretty meaty despite the size of it! The mixed seafood dish was really good especially the swordfish! We also shared a sourdough bread bowl with clam chowder, but nothing really too crazy about it IMO. 

Service was great, Despite the miscommunication about the crab. I didn't make a big deal about it because honestly I didn't feel like I had to. The food was great regardless.

Overall this place was really good and we would definitely be back! I would still have had the half crab because it was too much food for the full crab, but if you're going with a few people it probably would be good to share one whole crab.

author: John Christopher P.
stars:
this place is OKAY. 
prices are not cheap at all ,but reasonable due to its location. 


the steak is not that impressive, i prefer texas roadhouse for steak. 

their bread/biscuit is Okay i prefer the free bread at Lucilles BBq or cheesecake factory. 

in totality, my experience is OKAY 6/10 

its not the restaurant that i would love to go back and crave for their dish. 

its a restaurant that you would choose to meet your friends since this restaurant has the most reviews and easy to pick.

author: Stacy L.
stars: I'd give this place 5 stars but the host was not attentive at all. We ended up waiting for about two hours because the host accidentally cancelled our reservation when we checked in with her. Other than that, the seafood platter was really good, a tad bit salty,but the crab had soo much meat in it! I'd recommend that and the fish and chips. Great combo to share with someone!

author: Nile R.
stars:
This is an above average seafood restaurant, that has a fairly high price point. Very good food, but I do believe there is ample room for other seafood restaurants in the area to surpass it. I ordered the seared pacific cod, which was served in a chorizo butter sauce. Very delicious, as the fish was very flaky and had a perfect crisp to the crust. However, the white beans that were served alongside left much to be desired. Fingerling potatoes would have completed this dish in a much more satisfactory manner.

Our waiter, Jeremy, was great. The service was impeccable, as our waters were always filled, and the bread basket was quickly replaced. He was a very helpful waiter without feeling overbearing. 

I would suggest this place if you have time to stop at many other restaurants, but if you only have time/money for one, try somewhere else.

author: Vicky Z.
stars: Amazing. Totally worth it. Capino(not sure how to spell it) is highly recommended. The crab is also great.

author: Raymond G.
stars: Raphael just set the standard for how every waiter should treat their guest. Hands down! Service was great and food was fantastic!!

author: Celia Rose M.
stars: Wonderful food and service! We made a reservation the night before and got in with little wait. The food was amazing as was the service. Our waiter Mel did a fantastic job. The crab ceviche was the best I have ever had! The food and experience was fantastic!!

author: Kerri B.
stars: Delicious! Chose this based on Yelp reviews and it was delicious with great views! All the food was amazing but we really enjoyed the Ahi, Crab Cakes and Linguini with clams. Would highly recommend!

author: Maria M.
stars: I visited this place a few weeks back and boy it was GOOD! The atmosphere was great, the staff was super nice and very attentive. We actually made a reservation and that was pretty easy to do. Parking was not a problem as we parked in the Pier parking structure which is close by. Will definitly visit again when in San Francisco. I would highly recommend this place due to their food but also its a nice place to visit while in San Francisco.

author: Connie V.
stars: Delicious Caesar salad with crab and avocado. Seafood sampler was a must have also. Both were refreshing and tasty. Great service and great view of Pier 39

author: Derek F.
stars:
tl;dr surprisingly nice place for a (potential) tourist trap, platter was great, crab (cake) delicious.

I am always incredibly skeptical when going to a restaurant in the middle of a tourist trap like the Pier. But sometimes people, or restaurants, surprise you, and for that I am grateful.

We ordered the crab cake for appetizer, and that was too tasty and too quickly we had annihilated the plate. The seafood platter was incredible, not just simply boiled but with plenty of herbs, garlic, lemon to give it the perfect flavor which let the seafood speak for itself mostly, fresh as they are. The Dungeness crab that came with the platter was delectable.

Service for such a busy place was at some point a little spotty but that's really the best you can expect, and the view was a very nice bonus to a great meal. Would come back again, though I'd skip the whole Pier part.

author: Melissa D.
stars: The food was delicious and served quickly. The fish is fresh and the calamari is a must. Definitely worth a stop if you're in San Francisco.

author: Leetal L.
stars: Every dish and drink: BEAUTIFULLY EXECUTED!  Rafael was the best and most attentive waiter!  He is a gem and an asset to Fog Harbor!

author: Juanita I.
stars:
We ate a late lunch at Fog Harbor after arriving in San Francisco, jet lagged and hungry. It was around 2:30 and we were seated right away at a window overlooking the pier. The place was pleasantly busy. 

Our server was kind and pleasant. 

We started off with the calamari appetizer with lemon aioli and it was perfection. We asked for more aioli and it was brought with a smile. 

I ordered the Seafood Penne and again, it was perfection. Perfect pasta, creamy tomato sauce, shrimp, mussels, and clams. It truly satisfied.

My husband ordered the Fried Combo which is fried fish, calamari, and shrimp and while it was good it was nothing special. It came with fries.

For dessert we had the Blondie Sundae because hubby is a lover of all things Biscoff. Chocolate chip style brownie square with walnuts, topped with vanilla ice cream, biscoff cookie crumbles and a biscoff sweet spread drizzle. It was delicious! 

We also each had a yummy raspberry lemonade cocktail which I can't remember the name of. It was quite good. 

Very impressed with Fog Harbor and would eat here again!

author: Chu Jun H.
stars: Came here for their oysters, which were freshly shucked. Busy spot, and reasonably so with great food! Service was alright. Nothing too memorable or special, but prompt and professional. Wouldn't mind stopping by again for lunch.

author: Angela C.
stars:
Very nice place with good clam chowder. A good clam chowder served in the sour dough bread with crab meat is very satisfying. Nothing says more than welcome to San Francisco more than a good chowder. 

We were seated by the window with nice ocean view.

author: Miguel C.
stars: I hope my review can give this place and our amazing Server Shakura justice. Let's start off by saying we were extremely fortunate to be paired with Shakura for our dinner service. She was absolutely incredible with her hospitality, menu knowldege, recommendations, and patience (we had a large party with 3 children ages 3,5,6). She absolutely NAILED every dish she suggested. We had high expectations based on Yelp reviews and images but this place delivered every step of the way. Calamari was subtly seasoned with a perfect dipping sauce, Dungeness crab cakes incredible with a hint of spice, clam chowder topped with crab was amazing! Lobster sandwich had a dream toasted bread surrounding all the lobster goodness and the lazy cioppino capped it all off with 5 stars. Extremely happy with the dinner we had but again I can't emphasize enough how much better the experience was because of Shakura! Shes an absolute personable and lovely person. And the restaurant kitchen delivers on all aspects. This place will be permanently bookmarked for S.F. eats.

author: Virginia M.
stars: Delicious!  The dungeous crab special salad was HUGE and amazing!  Love their bread!!

author: Dina K.
stars: Beautiful view of the harbor. The food was on point. Delicious and fresh. The service is great too. They even brought me a phone charger.

author: Tonia F.
stars: Enjoyed the food and drinks michael was are waiter he was the best. We cant wait to come back. See you soon fog house

author: Katrina Y.
stars:
Out of all the restaurants they offer on pier 39, I am so happy I chose Fog Harbor Fish House on my recent trip to SF! Number one of course was the spectacular view on that perfect sunny Saturday. It was just perfect! Service was also phenomenal!


We ordered the mussel fries as a starter and clam chower bowls with crab meat. I am not a fan of mussels usually because I feel they are more on the dry side as oppose to clams, but THESE mussels were so moist and tender I've never had mussels like these before. The aioli sauce drizzled over the french fries were absolutely delicious! Sounds like a weird combo, but trust me, it is soooo good! The clam chowder I felt was a bit too thick, but it was still nonetheless delicious especially with the crab meat!

Main entrees we had the half garlic roasted crab, and penne seafood pasta. The roasted garlic crab came out perfect. Everything just broke apart perfectly, no need for any utensils to open up the crab legs. It was almost like a soft shell crab in a way. The tomato cream sauce in the Penne seafood pasta was perfect! I am not really a fan of tomato sauce pasta, and cream only sauce is a bit too heavy for me, so this was a perfect combo for it was not too tangy nor heavy. 

Our drinks were filled constantly and our waitress checked on us very often to make sure everything was good.

PLEASE give this place a try! WILL BE BACK!

author: Joanne S.
stars:
Every time my mom comes to SF I take her to get seafood at Fog Harbor Fish House. Great view of the bay and Alcatraz, located at Pier 39 so lots of touristy things to do within walking distance. Of course, with the tourist location comes tourist prices but it's not that bad. In terms of food, their award winning clam chowder is quite good (particularly with the added crab) 4/5. We usually come for the lobster (5/5 very fresh) and Dungeness crab (5/5 the garlic is seriously good! This is their best dish!); we have had some other dishes here and there that were reliably good but nothing that springs to mind 1-2 years later. Service is usually quite good and you can get seated usually within an hour even if there is a wait - no problem there's lots to do while you wait!

This time around we got the clam chowder again as well as the seared pacific cod and the mussel fries. The mussel fries were fabulous (5/5); being a seafood house you might not expect their fries to be top notch but they are, and the cream sauce was delicious. The Pacific Cod, which was the dish recommended by our waiter, was honestly our least favorite dish that we have tried here. I generally prefer for my cod to have that juicy, oily mouthfeel and the cod was a little dry, maybe due to the thickness of the fish (don't know if you can tell from the picture but it was about 1/4 inch thick when it arrived on the table). However our waiter was fabulous at everything else, including getting our check to us early as we had lost track of time and had an upcoming appointment.

My brother usually comes with us and always gets the burger because he doesn't like seafood. It's alright, but really why come to a seafood house for a burger? It does comes with those delicious fries.

Tl;dr: great views, great service, great area, generally great food. Get the clam chowder, lobster, mussel fries, and 100% get the Dungeness crab. Don't expect too much from the non-seafood options. Expect tourist prices given it's a tourist location; to me it's worth a few extra bucks a dish if we are going to be hanging out at the piers for the day anyway. We will be coming back!

author: Ricardo L.
stars: Wow!! This place was delicious. The food was great. The drinks were great. The service was great (Nev I believe was our waiters name) I highly recommend this place. I can't wait to come back to San Francisco, Fisherman's Wharf. I'm coming back.

author: Christal C.
stars:
Wow! Amazing delicious food! Loved every bit of it. The place, the staff, the food, the view, all of it. Came here for the ratings and I was not let down.  My boyfriend and I wanted to taste a little bit of everything without spending a lot, so we decided to share. We shared a "cup" size chowder and "Jumbo Shrimp Cocktail". For myself I ordered the  "Garlic Whole Dungeness Crab" and he got the "Shellfish Platter". Overall we spent $130 not including tip. Quite an expensive meal but definitely worth it. 

CHOWDER: 10/10 cup size was perfect to share. Get a little taste without getting full. 
SHRIMP COCKTAIL: 10/10 very refreshing 
GARLIC WHOLE DUNGENESS CRAB: 10/10 very garlic flavored potatoes and broccoli. The garlic on the crab was just right, not overpowering. Enough to satisfy you and still have room for dessert. 
SHELLFISH PLATTER: 8/10 boyfriend thought some of the crab pieces were dry. He liked the meaty mussels though. 
CREME BRÛLÉE: 10/10 perfect sweetness

author: Denny M.
stars: 11/27/18- Food was good. Oysters were good but a couple looked like they got run over in the parking lot. Wedge salad filled me up so little room left for Mixed Seafood trio.  Salmon, Cod and shrimp were good but mashed potatoes were lukewarm at best. Server was friendly and hostess and bartender went the extra mile to accommodate us. Will try again and hope for a 4 star experience.

author: Thiago F.
stars: Long wait, I found the food to be very expensive and pretty unimpressive. Nice view if you get to sit by the window.

author: Tracy N.
stars:
I came here for the first time earlier on my birthday with my boyfriend. It was packed but we were seated right away by the window, we got a nice view of the ocean and the pier which was pretty sweet. 

Our server was Sara, she was very optimistic and outgoing. She got everything we needed right away and did not hesitate to do so. We both ordered pasta, I got the chicken penne and he got the linguini & clams. My chicken penne was extremely bland. I had to pour so much black peppers and salt to get some sort of flavor in my dish. My boyfriends entree was really good though. 

It was my birthday dinner and I told my server that. She went out of her way and brought every different dessert they had in the back and let me pick what I wanted, which was very nice of her. The bill came out to be about $42, including my birthday discount. And the free complimentary birthday dessert. 

When I come back next time, I'm definitely going to try their steak instead!

author: Christian S.
stars:
Best fish n chips at pier 39. So delicious and savory. My wife and I came here like 10 times when we lived in the bay area. 

She always gets some kind of exotic food and I know she never complained about anything she ever got from here.

As for me I loved the fish n chips i always get 2 more pieces of fish and a couple of Anchor Steams real bay area.

Suckas Hella Jealous....

author: Allie V.
stars: Woohooo! This place was so amazing. We were just walking aimlessly & stumbled across this place. Moderately priced and great experience overall.

author: Sarah C.
stars: Excellent and friendly service. Clam Chowder was AMAZING! Food was decent. Not the best seafood platter we've ever had - but the customer service and view is so great that it's worth the experience.

author: Kathy N.
stars:
Disclaimer: Despite the fact that this restaurant has $$$, high stars and looks nice, you can totally get away with dressing casually!! 

The pricing of the dishes here were definitely a bit steep. 

We had gotten a dozen of the raw oysters which was served with some type of vinaigrette and also cocktail sauce w/ horseradish. It was basically your typical raw oysters - it wasnt specified what type of oysters they were. $34 for 12 oysters. 

Ahi Tuna Poke $18 - Loved the flavors in this! It was very fresh tuna served with some chopped mangoes. I thought the mangoes were a nice touch to balance out the flavors. Great appetizer to start out our meal with.

Clam Chowder w/ Crab - got the cup size to try ($7), to add crab was an additional $7, but well worth it! Had to really get that seafood experience, right? The chowder was good on its own, but the crab added an extra umph and texture. I enjoyed it. Their chowder was also rewarded best in SF! 

Seafood Penne $23 - The sauce for this was really favorable, but it didnt exactly "wow" me. The overall portion of the dish looked to be large, but once you get into it there was not a lot of penne within the actual dish. However, there was definitely a decent amount of seafood to compensate! For a small girl, i found that this dish was just enough for me. 

Alaskan Halibut $34 - This was part of their seafood menu. A bit of a disappointment. Although the fish was very soft and fresh, it lacked flavor. We are more so people who enjoy more flavor in our dishes. Had to use sauce from the pasta so the fish wouldnt be so bland. 

Apple Crisp $8.50 - We came here for our anniversary, so they gave us a complimentary dessert. So nice of them! At the end of your meal, the server will come out with a tray of desserts to choose from - you select the one you want and they will prepare you a new one from the back. I was silly and was about to grab it right off the tray. The Apple Crisp was delicious. Not too sweet and served with vanilla ice cream. Unfortunately, i was too full from the dinner that i couldnt finish the dessert - which never happens.

For being a high rating restaurant with steep prices, I would have taken this place to be a more upscale restaurant, but its a great spot to come for any occasion at any time of the day.

author: Allison S.
stars: When I came here for the first time it was my grandparents anniversary. I ordered salmon, it wasn't very good for the price. I came here again later on and ordered salmon again. It was delicious!!!

author: Shantel T.
stars: We sat at the bar and ordered drinks why we waited for our table. The bartenders were on top of things and made some delicious drinks. I had 2 of the Escape Alcatraz drinks and had a good buzz. This place is nice and we had a beautiful view of Alcatraz from our table. We ordered the garlic cheese bread for an appetizer it was by far the best I've ever had. My New York steak was so juicy and full of flavor. Also, the mashed potatoes and veggies that came with it were really good i could have licked my plate clean im definitely going to come back.

author: Khaye S.
stars: Came here with a bunch of friends and food was great, my only complaint was that we all had to go 3x back and forth about the validation for our parking. NONE worked. we had to pay $80 worth of parking on top of our $500 food bill. Needless to say, we are not coming back.

author: Karren L.
stars: I can't believe I've never written a review for this place. I absolutely love Fog Harbor. The cioppino was so amazing! It's the only thing I order when I go there. The fried calamari is also delicious! Service is always on point and so is the food.

author: Debra R.
stars: Amazing administration, tasty sustenance, worth each penny encounter! Would exceptionally prescribe reserving a spot. There were bunches of individuals in line. We strolled up, gave our name and were reclaimed quickly! Had the most AMAZING perspective of Alcatraz! Will make this an absolute necessity stop on each trek back to San Francisco! Much thanks to you Fog Harbor staff for making our visit there such a life-changing one!

author: Dannah S.
stars:
I took my family down here today and we were all very pleased with the service, food, and atmosphere. Our waitress, didn't catch her name, was polite, courteous, and friendly, she never neglected the table. She always came back every 10 minutes or so, despite the restaurant being fairly busy, to check and make sure everything was okay and refill our drinks. 
The food was pretty good too, we all ordered something different, the seared cod that I had was great, but what blew me away was the tomato and sauce that was on it, so flavorful! We also shared some fried calamari with jalapeño as an appetizer which we gobbled like it was our last meal. Keep in mind though, the food is a bit on the pricey side, so it's not ideal for large families on a tight budget. 
The view and pictures can't be beat either, right by the water with a view of the bay, Alcatraz, ships, and the city. 
The only criticism I would have is there was a bit of a foul smell throughout the place, but given it is a seafood restaurant it's understandable and you get over it quickly. 
Otherwise, I recommend this place to anyone! We loved our experience here, and it's worth a try!

author: Lucas G.
stars: Amazing food and great atmosphere. I enjoyed my meal with my family. I would recommend this place to people who like having having a great meal!

author: Stanley J.
stars: My spouse liked the chowder on our first visit here so we returned at thanksgiving a few years ago. I started with the scampi cocktail which contained almost still frozen farm raised scampi presented in a way that was quite obviously prepared days in advance. I didn't finish. The spouse had the chowder which wasn't rated as highly as before, whole crab which was rated marginal. I ordered the salmon, not expecting a farm raised toxic tasting anemic looking filet I couldn't finish. The sides were regular Denny's quality, nothing special. The deserts were uninspired previously frozen items one would find at Costco. All of this would be fine if this place didn't tout itself as world class seafood. Our server was only seen once, for the remainder of the meal we seemed to have been taken over by food runners and bus staff.  The bill was of course close to $200. I deleted a previous review generalizing our experience after received a reply from management requesting details because it "wasn't the sort of review they were accustomed to" so here you are. I should have checked with my employees or any long term SanFran resident, in advance; it's common knowledge this is a visitor/ tourist/view restaurant only. Our food looked nothing like the photos offered by the business owners on this site. The generic cut/paste review below by Bob was for my previously deleted review which apparently doesn't go away when reviews are revised.

author: Tatiana V.
stars: A MUST visit for the seasfood lover! If you are looking for fresh and delicious seafood dishes, then this is your spot! Moderately priced but great quality seafood. The portions are good, the seafood is actually large. You won't have to fish for it in your Cioppino (no pun intended), which by the way is phenomenal. Beautiful waterfront views of Fisherman's wharf, casual dressy atmosphere, and they will validate your parking for an hour. Use the parking garage across the street and walk across the catwalk to Pier 39.

author: Jessica B.
stars: What a great experience! The food was delish, the view spectacular and the service was "top shelf"! Our server (Michael) is an absolute superstar - very patient, relaxed, helpful, knowledgeable and funny as heck! Capped off a perfect "date day" with hubby! Highly recommend.

author: Marie P.
stars: I found this place on yelp and it was very satisfying,  service was really good, and the food was really good. Nice location right off the water in Pier 39. FOr a tourist location I was very happy.

author: Allan R.
stars: If you find yourself here during crab season, try the scallop and crab risotto. The lobster roll is also phenomenal. All around good food, service, and atmosphere!

author: Leslie N.
stars: Great seafood restaurant. I had the Cesar salad with Salmon and chowder soup. My husband had the crab risotto with scallops. The food was delicious and the service was attentive. It has a beautiful view of the water. I highly recommend this restaurant!

author: Frasier J.
stars: Delicious clam chowder soup. Great service. Fresh oysters. However, the food left us underwhelmed. I had the filet mignon topped with crab with sautéed spinach and "mashed potatoes" the potatoes had more lumps than mash and were not cooked well. The crab was topped a very thick sauce that tasted like the smokiness you get when you bite into a Burger King burger. Very strange. My friend chose the shrimp and steak chow mein. Her noodles were too rubbery to eat. All in all try their chowder and appetizers.

author: Erika D.
stars: Great food. My friends and I are going again this weekend. The fish was awesome thanks guys

author: Mega Team R.
stars:
I was here at Fog Harbor Fish House with my friends.. the foods were great .. I love sea foods that why i can say that foods are great and its my choice.. 
My favorite foods are the calamari, surf and turf, and Garlic Roasted Dungeness Crab.. love your blueberry press here! 
Me and my friends enjoyed our food because of the nice view.. very refreshing and stress free.. 
The crews/waiters here are friendly and accommodating! thumbs up!

author: Jim C.
stars: The views are to die for, the service is top notch, and the food was excellent! I got the shellfish platter and added a lobster tail. If you don't mind spending $8000 for dinner, this place is awesome! The sourdough bread was delicious. The chowder in a bread bowl was OK, but not as good as new England to be honest. My wife had some beef skewers for an appetizer that were absolutely delicious! Her risotto for dinner was weird... I couldn't tell if it was risotto or Rice-A-Roni! I guess that is the San Francisco treat... Ha ha. Anyway, the rice was not like a typical risotto. It wasn't sticky enough, and it needed I heckuva lot more Parmesan cheese and maybe just a tad more seasoning in general! It was very tasteless. Not a big enough let down to not give this place five stars though. It truly was an amazing place. Oh, and I know this is stupid, but the lemonade was awesome!

author: Minea M.
stars: This had to be the best cioppino that I have ever had! It was full of seafood (including lots of crab) and FLAVOR! I got the lazy version which was well worth it after a long day of riding bikes and touring SF. I come to SF a lot for work and I think this place will be on my itinerary regularly. Delicious!

author: Sophia B.
stars: We had a great dinner today! I had the whole crab (regular) and it was delicious! Though it was a little pricey, it was worth it! We sat by the window and we had a great view. I definitely recommend if you are visiting Fisherman's Wharf.

author: Kim K.
stars: I recommend this place to everybody. The fish is excellent and perfectly cooked. The only thing left to do is to enjoy.

author: Patricia N.
stars:
Definitely one of my favorite meals in San Francisco.  It's consistently busy.  Luckily, I travel alone and can usually find a seat at the bar.  Great service too!

I tried one of their house beers (Fog Harbor Lager) which went perfectly with my plate of Garlic Roasted Dungeness Crab (whole-$42).

author: Matthew G.
stars: my first impressions: 4000+ reviews so must be good.  second impression: its in pier 39 so it must be a tourist trap.  decided to go in anyways.  came in around 8pm on a sunday and still had to wait about 5 minutes.  surprisingly it was pretty busy.  got a chance to look at the menu before we sat down.  sat us down and gave us bread and water.  the sourdough was fresh out of the oven.  sooo good with that butter.  even better with a bowl of clam chowder.  it was creamy and lots of clams.  ordered the shellfish platter with garlic noodle and the fish and chips.  OMG when it came out it was huge.  the plate was the size of me! and that was just for 1 person.  they have an option for 2 people.  i cant imagine how big that would be.  it came with lots of shrimp, mussels, clams, half crab, potatoes, and the whole bottom was full of garlic noodle.  everything was delicious.  the fish n chips had 3 huge fish very plump with a lot of fries.  we were dying trying to finish it all.  but in the end the quantity was too much for us.  had to throw in the towel.  and dessert? forget about it.  couldnt move.  the prices are okay i mean its seafood so its gonna be a little more on the high side.  overall it surpassed my expectations.

author: Evan K.
stars: We ate here late on a Wednesday, and they held our reservation for nearly an hour so we had a table to eat at instead of the bar. I had the Shellfish Stack, which was wonderfully garlicky and messy. They give you a bib, which I grudgingly but wisely wore. The service was attentive and thoughtful. This is a nice spot on Pier 39. I'd say it's a step above most of the touristy spots in that area.

author: Shannon H.
stars:
This place is such a tourist trap and I fell right in.

I am new to the bay area and had some friends visiting san francisco for a wedding. We decided to grab dinner and so after scouting out a few places I landed on Fog Harbor Fish House. The wait wasn't crazy long, maybe 10-15 minutes on a Saturday at 5ish. We also opted for seating by the water or not, whichever was available first.

The food is good but fairly standard and for the prices and the yelp rapport this place has I expected a bit more. The seafood was fresh but, I mean, you're on fisherman's wharf and the seafood is fresh at most places around here. The food is well done (though a little oily imo) but you can get that at a lot of places along the embarcadero. You wouldn't get a bad meal eating here, just not a stellar one. For san francisco and especially for downtown/embarcadero, keep looking.

Ps. Biscoff coffee house is downstairs from this restaurant and their coffee is really yummy (whole bean or brewed for you). If you're a cookie butter fan, it's a must try. :)

author: Ariel A.
stars: SHELLFISH TOWER!!! Everything was cooked nicely, nothing over cooked. The crab ceviche was to kill for.

author: Alondra A.
stars: Me and my hun love trying new restaurants and we recently went to this one and we were impressed by the amount of food they serve and it was delicious. The customer service there was great our waiter Justin H. Was awesome gaved us good recommendation and is a very nice person! This restaurant will be our go too, just make reservations because it was a 1 hour wait for a walk in

author: Robert F.
stars:
Decided to go out on Saturday night down to Pier 39 to feast on some good seafood and this placed was the destination. I thought initially it would be a good idea to make a reservation because I thought it would be busy but when I called the lady on the line indicated that the only times available would be around 10:00 pm and that if I arrived early there would be plenty of seating.
