So, I arrived around 7:00 pm and waited in line briefly before being met by the hostess. When I finally asked about a table to hostess told me it would be about a 30 to 45 minutes wait for a table!!! At this point, I am so disappointed in having to wait because I was initially told that there would be tables available.

I give my name and phone number to be notified when my table will be ready. I then proceed to take my seat and wait. The system that they have here is that the will text you or call you when your table is ready if you are not in the area. One nice thing is that the staff said that the wait may be shorter than the estimated time that they provided which I found to be a bit comforting. As I wait I take a few pictures admire backdrop of the bay and the sights at the Pier. After 45 minutes go by I proceed to the hostess and ask if my table is ready. She then asks for my name and then looks through the names. She then says that she does not see my name. Then she proceeds to ask me who took my name and number and tell her that she took it. Apparently, according to her, she called out the name earlier and someone took my spot. WHAT!!! My next question is did she check the ID? I get a blank stare and no answer, figures! What is the point of taking the name and phone number if you are not going to verify this information, come on man!!!! At this point, she apologizes and says it will be five minutes. At this point, I am just infuriated and disgusted by the madness of trying to get a table. 

Eventually, I am seated and ready to order. My server Adam was the best! He is the sole reason why this rating is so high. He was absolutely phenomenal. His recommendations were helpful and made my meal decision a whole lot easier. His timing to check-in was right on and the dessert tray was incredible. Unfortunately, I did not order dessert because my food was so good and I was stuffed. But, had I ordered a smaller meal I most definitely would have gotten a least one or everything from the dessert tray. 

Overall, the food was great but getting inside was just so much of a hassle and a pain. It is a good thing that servers like Adam work here because he really made the visit here worth it. I cannot say that about anyone else. 

#GoodFoodLongWait

author: Elliott Q.
stars:
There are lots of restaurants can cook crab or lobster, but we don't know which one is excellent. So through yelp , we chose this one.
We ordered 2 whole dungeness crabs, one is original and the other is garlic. We also ordered lobster ETC.
The best is dungeness crab, but they are not alive before cooking, died few hours ago. If they were staying alive before cooking would be perfect.
The situation and service here are also good .

author: Gigi D.
stars: I came across this place by walking around the wharf. We wanted to sit at the bar initially but was accommodated quickly when we changed our mind to sit at a table. Pretty busy for a Thursday afternoon, but worth it for beautiful view. Our waiter was friendly and pleasant. We were in between meals so we ordered, crab cake appetizer, a cup of clam chowder, and a bread bowl chowder with added crab. Everything tasted absolutely delicious! The table next to us had ordered a salad with crab and it looked delicious. I wish I had room to order and eat it myself. This place is definitely worth dining at for any occasion.

author: Susan K.
stars: If you love seafood and you love fresh sourdough bread, this is the place to go. Great service, better food, and the best tiramisu I've ever had. They don't even care what you're wearing even though it seems like a fancier restaurant.

author: Make Em Say U.
stars: It was great until tug boat willy came over to my table and started talking about the different species of fish. Food was great, but tug boat willy is not that great.

author: Biby B.
stars:
I would not go back here. Only thing this place has going for it is the location and view. Seemed like I was on a cruise ship.

Poor quality food and vibe is not typical SF.

The menu was all over the place too.

author: Jeffry B.
stars: Good food, good ambience, good view.  A bit pricey, but worth it if you are travelling!

author: Katie R.
stars:
This place could easily be great - location, ambiance, and food for the most are on point. Unfortunately we had a group of six with a space cadet server. Though the bartender, bread/water service and a check in from the manager seemed alert, the bulk of our dining experience fell short. 
Oysters were a disappointment - small and flavorless. The sourdough bread  is fantastic! Calamari was a Bret variety with delicious jalapeños and onion straws mixed in. Muscle fries were unique and much better than the oysters but I wouldn't get them again. The chowder however was fantastic and worth the visit. Adding crab meat to the salad was clutch and easily enough to top the salad and toss in the soup. 
Overall, could be improved. It's disappointing it wasn't a better experience but they have plenty of redeeming aspects to make it a decent option if you're in the area.

author: J C.
stars: Great view and service by our server Asia today. She was courteous, prompt, and friendly.  Excellent crab and chowder. Delicious food washed down with delicious drinks. A pricey treat! Crime brûlée was perfect too.

author: Destiny C.
stars: The view itself is probably the only reason I would go back. I was honestly disappointed in the food, I was expecting a lot more. The salmon and cod wasn't anything special.

author: kamran a.
stars: Arif was great, he helped is thorough the ordering and everything he said was right. If you want the best experience ask for him.

author: Scott S.
stars: This was my wife and I's first taste of San Francisco seafood.  There are countless options in and around the San Fran area.  We had the baked oysters, clam chowder in a sourdough bowl, and there calamari.  All dishes were excellent.  Would recommend the baked oysters especially.  The views from the restaurant of the bay were great, only knock on this place was price.  But I guess your also paying for the real estate on which you sit.

author: Kailash K.
stars: My family and I were looking to try some seafood and have some steak. We heard about this place and many people referred us to here. They even gave us 15% off to use for our bill. Everything was great, the food, the service, the hospitality by everyone else. Highly recommend, and Jess was a great server!

author: Nilay P.
stars:
Great seafood with a view. A little on the expensive side, as expected for the prime location. The restaurant itself is done up really well, and they have a swanky looking bar. The space is huge; Even with no reservation on a Friday night we got a table for 3 in 10-15 minutes, so not a crazy long wait. Service was quick too, which is not often the case in a big space.

The spicy red chilli shrimp and garlic roasted crab were excellent!

author: Matt J.
stars: Chowder was amazing! Views were awesome and we were sat right away.  My moms potatoes were cold so that's why I took a star away.

author: Nazuki Y.
stars:
Nice view. Pretty romantics
But always long line. Recommend to make a reservation. I visited here twice. This time is on Saturday night around 6:30 without reservations. It took 45 mins to have a table. Taste is ok. The view is really nice. The waiter was nice too. 
Pasta linguine: pretty good. Tasty with clams
fish and chips: big portion!
Fries combo:big portion too! Taste same and a little boring
Tuna poke: good! My friends didn't like mango in it but I liked it

author: M C.
stars: This is a great place to visit on the pier if you're looking for a delicious family dinner or lunch. The view of Alcatraz was breathtaking. The steak with whiskey sauce is very good. Award winning clam chowder is amazing!  Service was quick and convenient.  By far my favorite place on the pier.

author: Shanthi N.
stars: Amazing food - went with a party of 15 and they accommodated us with great hospitality. The food and drinks were great - we tried a lot of dishes and all were great .... would definitely go back there

author: Hemal K.
stars: Great location and good food. Waiting time can kill your appetite. Thanks to Yelp, you can now get in queue without being at the restaurant. Must try the spicy shrimp from the appatizer menu.

author: Maansi D.
stars: I love this place, especially love the oysters here! That paired with a view over the water and it's a great place to relax on a nice day. Bit on the costlier side, to be expected from a touristy street.

author: Jaziglo J.
stars: Excellent service, dinner and dessert fabulous, Love the ambiance!! We will be back. Only complaint is the hostess seating needs a little professional refreshing .

author: Jenoa L.
stars: Excellent service and the food is beyond delicious!! We had a waterfront view which was such a nice touch to celebrate our anniversary. The servers were extremely attentive and friendly. Food was fresh and each dish we ordered was perfect! We will be back soon!

author: Fanny S.
stars: This was the best thing that I had on my San Francisco trip! The food was delicious, and the service was great! We ordered the shellfish platter with a lobster, the seafood penne, which were all delicious, but the show stopper was the scallops and crab risotto. That was so delicious! There are four scallops that are beautifully cooked, and they were seasoned perfectly. The risotto itself was great, but I feel like it could've had a bit more flavor. If you can go, definitely go, and try those things listed above, especially the crab risotto. You can enjoy the view while having a delicious meal!

author: Jatin K.
stars: I had read many reviews before I got here and decided to give it a whirl. This was our first stop when we arrived to fisherman's wharf, we had a party of 9 about 230 pm on a Friday afternoon and were seated right away on the window side. We all sat down ordered a bunch of drinks and appetizers, at first I feel like the waitress was a little annoyed and wanted to rush us out of there but then later she did end her shift while we were still there so I'll give her the benefit of the doubt on that one. This was hands down some of the best seafood I've had. The calamari was delicious and perfectly cooked. The oysters were the most fresh delicious oysters I've ever had. The whole table tried an oyster even the people who aren't oyster lovers. We ordered the sliders which had such a delicious sauce on them which made them absolutely amazing. The blue cheese garlic bread was a nice touch on the menu however the taste doesn't really match the concept of this place. Overall the service was decent, the food was amazing and the view was awesome.

author: Lauren K.
stars:
This is THE place to eat crab. The view is gorgeous, the service impeccable and the best crab cakes I've ever eaten. My mom and I shared: cracked dungeness crab, crab cake, a dozen fresh oysters, and a bread bowl of clam chowder with 2 iced teas with a total of 102 dollars so it's not cheap, but by far one of the most special meals I've ever had. 

I highly recommend this place!

author: Eric P.
stars:
Went here for lunch after reading some of the reviews for this place. It was only moderately busy around noon on a Monday, so I got immediately seated next to a window with a view of the water. 

The server was attentive and suggested I try one of the specials that just started this week... More on that later. 

I had the clam chowder with sourdough on the side to start. I've had a lot of clam chowders in my day, and this by far is one of the best if not best I've ever had. Not too dairy creamy... Tons of clam meat... Not overloaded with potatoes and seasoned just right. The hot sourdough bread was also very tasty... Served piping hot and fresh. 

Now for my main entree I had the king salmon special. What can I say? Pine nuts, avocado, orzo, locally caught king salmon, fennel, and a nice salad... Talk about explosion of flavor. Besides the salad/orzo combination being amazing by itself, the king salmon was cooked to perfection... With a delicate texture, nice seasoned crust and that bright red color... All in all a very good piece of fish. 

The only downside to this place is the cost, but you get what you pay for. I'd highly recommend those of you in the area visiting to give this place a try. I'll definitely be back!

author: Johnny N.
stars: This place is like any other tourist trap destination in the bay, expect to pay high prices for mediocre at best food. If you want to experience what the bay really has to offer go find yourself a local Mom and pop shop to dine at. You would think with so many Dungeness crabs in the bay that they would serve you fresh crabs and not frozen, we guessed wrong!

author: Katelyn C.
stars: I've been to Pier 39 multiple times but I've never eaten here. This is now my favorite place to eat on the pier! Not only was the food delicious, but the atmosphere and view were perfect. Beautiful view of the bay and sunset. On top of that, our server Curtis was so kind, personable, and fun! Highly recommend if you're coming to Pier.

author: Eric A.
stars: The views you get of the bay overlooking Alcatraz are amazing while dining here. With all the options of clam chowder all over pier 39, this one is a few more dollars and slightly smaller but still tasted pretty good. It's a nice place to dine away from all the tourist and birds flying all over the place. The crab roll we ordered was tasty on top of a perfectly toasted bread. We noticed all the other food options available that was being eaten and they all looked good. You definitely can't go wrong with eating seafood here. The wait was about 30 minutes around noon time on a Friday which wasn't too bad at all. Definitely want to try the other items on the menu but the clam chowder is definitely a must while in San Francisco.

author: Tanae C.
stars: I just had the BEST margarita ever.. please ask Quianna to make your next margarita, she has great energy and she's super sweet!! Thank you for awesome service Quianna i will be back to see you!!

author: Harrison D.
stars: Michael's customer service was exquisite. Made my family's first time amazing, he was also helpful with our selection. The shellfish platter was tasty and different from the other restaurants I've been to.

author: Alex D.
stars: Great restaurant with great customer service! Thanks to our server Michael, he made our stay very comfortable and food absolutely satisfying!

author: Mercedes C.
stars:
This is one of the best place to have dinner in San Francisco. The view, the service, the food.... everything was simple perfect!!! 
Don't miss this wonderful restaurant, will be memorable.

author: Maria L.
stars: This restaurant was pretty good. Food was amazing!! The view of the harbor was also very nice. Ordered the scallop risotto and steamed clam appetizer for lunch. The broth was amazing to dip the bread in. Definitely would recommend and would also go back when I'm in the Bay Area.

author: Tanner D.
stars:
Pleasntly surprised.

I usually try my best to avoid restaurants in tourist dense areas. When my wife and friends wanted to go here, I threw on a smile and said ok... Prepared for the worst.

The menu had alot of options, and portions seemed fairly. I ordered the clam chowder and crab roll. 

They were both delicious. I was amazed. I even saved some of the rolls they bring you for the chowder. Boy was I in heaven. 

The place, although nice is packed with tourist, however the restaurant is bright and provides a gorgeous view of the Bay. Usually a wait for lunch however I think that it is actually worth it. If I was a local I wouldn't be horrified to bring my friends here. 

Will it blow you away, no... But will it leave you happy with some change in your pocket? Absolutely

author: Claudia C.
stars:
Came to celebrate Father's Day with kids and husband and the service provided from starting on the waiting for a table great. The restaurant provides phone chargers! First one for me.
The waiter provided an outstanding service .
Food was delicious we all have a very nice time .
I highly recommend this place they also write for any celebration you may have at the table like Happy anniversary of Birthday upon request

author: Mike V.
stars: Excellent location, excellent service, excellent food, best clam chowder I have ever tasted. Can wait to visit again.

author: Sarah S.
stars: No complaints from sitting at the bar and had the bartender from Prescott,AZ. :) highly recommend for a good sampler of fresh seafood

author: Stefanie T.
stars: It was very busy when we came in, we sat at the bar and had a few drinks while we waited. The drinks were good, the clam chowder was amazing and the view is beautiful. You can't go wrong with the place!

author: Sofia S.
stars:
Came out to fisherman's warf today and decided to have lunch at the Fog Harbor. Visiting from Chicago, we don't really get good seafood so this place was such a treat!
Our server, Amy, was very attentive and friendly. If possible, ask to be seated in her section, you won't regret it! We got the scallops and the clam chowder for our starters and they also have complementary boudin sourdough! How awesome is that?! It was hot and fresh! We also got the strawberry lemonade and nojito which were also really good. The view from our table was also nice! As we were devouring the scallops, another server, Martin, offered to refill our jalapeño aioli dip which my boyfriend was eating by the spoonful. Overall, great service, good food, and awesome view! Will definitely come back.

author: Demetrios N.
stars:
We almost made the mistake of eating at an adjacent restaurant. However, we ended up at Fog Harbor and wow, what a treat! Our server was amazing and so was the food. 

We're all very picky, and I can say for sure that this was the best dining experience we had while in California. If I could rate it with 10 stars, I would.

author: Kirby B.
stars: We stopped into Fog Harbor Fish House on a rainy day during a recent trip to SF. Not only was the clam chowder delicious, but the freshly baked bread bowl was also amazing and the customer service was very good. Highly recommend.

author: Eduardo F.
stars: Great experience at the Fog Harbor Fish House. Went there today with my wife and we had a great time. The food was great (we only had fried calamari and a clam chowder, which was amazing), as it was the service, thanks so much, Justin!

author: Tammie W.
stars:
My husband and I were skeptical coming here, since you're gambling with great views vs. great food but we ended up getting a booth facing the water and had a great meal.  Definitely a win win.  

The waitress brought our drinks and a basket of warm sliced sourdough bread with a tray of butter.  It was the best bread during our stay in SF because it was so warm and soft.  

I then ordered the Caesar salad which was dressed nicely, had a nice salty taste from the anchovies in the dressing and had killer garlic croutons that I could've eaten like popcorn.  The salad was plenty big enough to share with my eye candy.  I also ordered the Ahi entree which was a hefty ahi tuna steak encrusted in black and white sesame seeds and cooked to perfection and rare inside.  The was sitting on top of a bed of toasted and seasoned rice and an array of sautéed vegetables including bok choy which was so tasty.  

My husband ordered the sole which was sautéed and served in a caper sauce and atop of vegetables and fingerling potatoes.  

We were both very satisfied and full at the end of the meal.  The bill came with biscoff cookies which were a nice treat as well.  The hostesses were friendly, the manager checked in on the tables and our server was friendly and attentive.

author: Darlene L.
stars:
Delicious Dinner with a View. 
We were greeted at the door by a friendly hostess that escorted us to a table with a wonderful view of the bay and Alcatraz. 
We ordered several items to try. 
Dungeness Crab App - generous portion o   Fish and Chips - standard, nothing to get excited over, but worked for the kid. 
Mixed Grill - a portion of swordfish, salmon and shrimp with mash potatoes and asparagus, fish was flaky and cooked to perfection.

author: Ronald R.
stars: Overall good restaurant. Food tastes good and is of good quality. Servers did ok, nothing special. Food was a little expensive for what u get. In the old days, u would get soup and/or salad included w/ ur entree @ a nice restaurant like this. Now everyone is doing the upscale steak house style and charging u a la cart. The restaurant quality is not high enough 4 this style of menu, but again it is good food. Lastly and not that I usually care and it is CA, but some ppl were so underdressed for a restaurant that apparently wants to up upper scale that it was shameful. If u want to go to a linen table cloth restaurant with $40-$50 plate and wait staff in formal wear, then leave ur tank top, wife beater tee shirt, and other ghetto clothes @ home and @ least put on a tee shirt and jeans.

author: Diann U.
stars: Had an early dinner with friends here last night w/ no reservations. Wait time was about 10 minutes and was seated by the window which was really nice. Our server was quick and very accommodating in serving our table of 5. Entree servings was perfect as well and the complimentary bread was delicious :) When we were headed out there was alot of people waiting to be seated... I suggest go early by 5pm ...

author: Galust K.
stars:
To the best upscale seafood restaurant ive had in my life... thank you. Thank you for the GREATT FOOD you serve. I mean dang!!!!!! You gots to try it. Best clams, mussels, crab meat and lobster tail youve ever had, ive ever had.

I want you to know, it wont dissapoint

author: Jenn S.
stars:
Pretty solid spot in a big tourist area. I am always hesitant to go for pricier restaurants in that sort of area but this one did not disappoint!

The view is really nice of the harbor but I wouldn't say by any means that it is life changing if you can't sit right by the window, but it is worth it to ask. The food was really good. I ordered the tuna appetizer and salads.

author: Kai L.
stars: Packed out on Sunday but fortunately had nice water view seats! You can ask server to borrow portable charger if you need to juice up your phone.  Tried their lobster tails, clams, shrimp ...

author: Gretchen J.
stars: In the heart of touristy fisherman's warf/embarcadero boasting the best sourdough bread bowl of clam chowder and seafood dishes . Great service  good food and quite large portions too. Not a relaxing place but definitely yummy

author: Karen S.
stars:
We were starved and Fog Harbor had the best reviews on Yelp for Pier 39.  It was hard to find the entrance, but once we went up the stairs we were quickly greeted and seated.  

We had Ashley as our server and she was awesome.  We were seated at a table by the window and the view was great.   

After four days in Napa, I was wined out and went with the Cucumber Basil gimlet.  They were delicious.  My husband had one of the local draft beers.   We were given yummy warm sourdough bread and butter.  

Since I'm such a carb hound, I went with the soup and salad combo, which consisted of clam chowder in a bread bowl and a ceasar salad that I added grilled shrimp to.  The chowder was OK. Not great, just OK.  The rest was really good though and once I started dipping pieces of bread in the chowder, I had no complaints.  

My husband had the mixed seafood grill and enjoyed it.   If you are looking for seafood while on Pier 39, I'd recommend it.

author: Jax W.
stars:
By far the best thing I've had since being in San Fran. Got the ahi tuna steak and it made my taste buds jump! It truly just melted in my mouth. 
I can not wait to return one day to have this again. 
The mix drinks were fair. 
The atmosphere seemed like it was trying to be a bit classier but there was a lot more casual feel to it.
Overall service was decent. 
The view if you get seated well is enjoyable.

author: Jake T.
stars:
Going to the Piers and not eating at Fog Harbor is a mistake. This place is great. And if you're a solo traveler like I was, don't let the 2 hour wait scare you off. You can hover the bar and grab a seat to eat at.

I didn't catch her name, but my bartender was so great. She took care of me and I'm sure several others that evening without an issue at all. Food came out fast, the virgin drinks were tasty- especially the nojito, and all at a pretty decent price.

The oysters looked good, the crab sounded good, but for me it's always about the sourdough clam chowder bowl when in San Fran. And this place does it amazing! Definitely a must have in my book. Best place to eat on Pier 39 for me

author: Ellen S.
stars: One of the nicer places to eat at Pier 39 and the wharf. Great service and the clam chowder really is the best!!!

author: Flavio A.
stars: I had an awesome experience. Took my wife for a date and got a window seat with a view toward the bridge witch lit up while we had dinner. Food was on point. Planning another date soon with my wife we loved this place. It has hit my number one on my list on good food, good customer service, and above all good pricing. Can't wait for our next date. Totally recommend.

author: C. K.
stars: My friend and I came for a quick bite. We had the chowder and chocolate banana bread pudding, which was recommended by our server, Nev. Great food and great service. Thanks Nev!

author: Mel R.
stars: Had my anniversary dinner and it was absolutely gorgeous view  even though it was gloomy and the food was delicious. Loved the crab civiche

author: Diana S.
stars:
Our group got here on a busy Monday evening without a reservation and waited for 15-minutes and that wasn't so bad.  

We ordered our meals and waited extremely long for our orders to come, maybe about a half an hour.  But, I was satisfied when my award winning clam chowder was served.  It was piping hot and the clams tasted so fresh and the chowder was rich, creamy, and very flavorful.  I had it with the sour dough bread that was given at our table.  What helped with the long wait was watching the beautiful sunset turning from orange to pink and the sun finally setting.  My group of 5 all stood up to get some pictures.  

We eventually all got our entrees another half an hour later.  My Salmon "Club" Salad was very good.  The portion of salmon was prepared just right.  It was moist and flaky.  The lemon vinaigrette mixed in the salad was nice and tart and the lemon ranch dressing on top of the salmon enhanced the already freshness of the fish.  I enjoyed the onions, cherry tomatoes and bacon bits throughout the dish.  This dish was pricey for a salad, $20, but well worth it.

Next we were waiting for our check to come.  It was a long wait.  Our waitress apologized for our wait and her Manager decided to give us complimentary desserts for our time.  He also came to apologize for our wait.  We all ordered blondies to go.  I actually wanted to get the creme brûlé but that wouldn't be practical to take out.  

So, I gave our experience a 4 since we had great service recovery, and the meal and scenic view was fine.  If you don't mind waiting, this place is very good.

author: Joy A.
stars:
The seafood was the freshest I've ever tasted. Yum!
The wait staff were excellent, very friendly and honored my simple palate and special requests. Excellent view, wonderful experience!

author: Dennise M.
stars: Quick bite at the bar : calamari, YUM! It was lightly crispy to perfection.  Crap out of shell cocktail was nice and refreshing with nice portion.  The oysters were amazing, enough said. Let's not forget the view of Alcatraz you have while enjoying drinks and food.

author: Jennifer D.
stars:
For being in a ridiculously touristy place I was very pleasantly surprised.  They give you some crazy good, fresh baked sourdough bread when you sit down (you can watch them making it from the window outside the restaurant).  My husband ordered some kind of fish stew thing and I had a wedge salad.  Both were excellent.  Drinks were also really well made and they didn't skimp on the alcohol. 
Service was very fast and attentive and it was pretty busy when we sat down for lunch.

author: Helen L.
stars: Whoever knew seafood can be sooooo good? Well, I just found out today. I actually yelp this place and it so many good reviews that I decide to come. I was definitely not disappointed, from the food to the people, everything was well done.instead of giving us a dessert menu, they bring out all the desserts and they show you. I really like this place and I think you guys will too. It's just a bit pricey but if you want good seafood, you should come to this place.

author: Jona R.
stars: The food in this restaurant was surprisingly delicious and well prepared despite its touristy appeal.  I had one of the best linguini with clams, while looking out at the view of Alcatraz. I've recommended this to friends who have out-of-town guests who'd like a piece of the action of Pier 39.

author: Landen T.
stars: Can I give this place higher then a 5 star?! This is our second time coming here on vacation and each time it exceeded our expectations! By far the best chowder we have ever had in the Bay Area and trust me, we tried many places. all the other dishes do not disappoint either. We ordered the scallop risotto and the garlic crab. Best meal of our entire trip! Whenever we are in the Bay Area, we all decided this is always a must have.

author: Jean K.
stars:
Fancy restaurant on the Fisherman's Wharf. It's located on the second floor and they have their own restroom! I came to Fog Harbor for their claim to have the best clam chowder. Yes, it was good but I don't think it lived up to the hype. A local told us a placed called Chowders will have the best clam chowder.

We also got half dozen of oysters and that was delicious! It was also $17 for half dozen... which In my opinion is expensive. The views were lovely. Would I come back to this place? I'm not sure but it was definitely worth a try and to check it off my list. It is mostly a tourist attraction.

author: Julie S.
stars:
This place was great! We stumbled in here after doing some sight seeing, yes it's a huge tourist place, but whatever they still have great food! The place is a lot bigger than I thought it was going to be from the outside, and really had a great ambiance to the place. It was classy but not too fancy where I felt like I should have dressed up. They have a great view of the water, and the wait staff was very helpful.

We got the spicy shrimp appetizer, and it definitely was spicy!! Not overbearing, but if you don't like spicy food definitely stay away. It's not one of those things on the menu that just says spicy and then there's nothing to it. My dad got the fried shrimp - which was your typical fried shrimp, nothing outstanding, but nothing bad to say. I thought they could have been a little less bread like, I hate when places drench their shrimp in batter. I got the chicken, which my dad thought was weird since we're at a seafood place, however it was fantastic! So juicy, great sauce and the mashed potatoes were fabulous. The only complaint that I have is they left the layer of fat on the chicken breast, which I understand is great for flavor, but if you're going to do so make sure you render the fat down more!

Great place to go, a little pricier than some of the restaurants down there, but not outrageous!

author: Kenyun B.
stars: The atmosphere was amazing but the food was even better.  Curtis our server was great and very knowledgeable.  This was a great call for dinner on our visit to the bay!

author: Courtney C.
stars: This was a great find!!! Fabulous views of the Bay and seals. We were seated right away, Had a great server, Justin H. Who helped us choose a great variety rather than just two entrees. Tried and loved; tuna poke, crab cakes, oysters & sautéed veggies! Would totally come back & recommend!

author: Stanley Y.
stars:
This place could've been a 4 star... but why in the world do they serve whole leaf lettuce in their caesar salad? Besides that, their clam chowder is the best I've ever had. The piping hot temperature they serve it at and the fresh clams in there make all the difference. The calamari was great as well. 

As expected of a tourist focused restaurant located on Pier 39, wait times can skyrocket. The servers were all very accommodating and the host even got us a window seat. You should come here for a view during lunch since the sun shines straight in and they put up blinds during dinner. The severs and place itself try too hard to create an 'upscale' dining experience while catering mostly to passing tourists who are dressed in everything from flip flops to dress shoes.

author: Angel D.
stars: The view was great! The service was even better, Eddie rocks! We ordered the clam chowder add crab and the baked oysters as appetizers. Everyone enjoyed their individual entrees (steak, shrimp diablo, garlic crab). Definitely well worth a visit!!!

author: Russ O.
stars: Absolutely hands down a great place to eat. Service was a snap, friendly, fast, and the food was superb. Not worth a big review cause the five stars say it all. Price IS expensive (for two of us, $100 including drinks) but it's part of the experience.

author: Alison T.
stars: This place was awesome! Don't be fooled that its in a tourist part of town the food is amazing. The hibiscus margarita with the foam was delicious! We got the crab and scallop risotto and ahit tuna which were fantastic. For as big of a wait as we had on a Sunday for dinner it was only 20 minutes and the service was super attentive and food came out quickly. Great views of the Bay and Golden Gate don't hurt too!

author: Heidi M.
stars: Beautiful view of atcatraz!  Food cam out fast!  Server Michael was awesome, and his supporting staff kept water glasses filled and took away plates at appropriate times.

author: Cynthia S.
stars:
I owe a big thank you to those Yelpers and Pinners who gave this restaurant rave reviews. I was not only completely blown away by the spectacular window seat view, which we were lucky enough to get, but by the delicious locally caught cuisine.  I come from a city that boasts some of the best fresh local fish so this is a must to me. On top of the flavor the prices were unbelievable. Convinced that traveling in California was going to be expensive I totally over budgeted for food on this trip. 

I cannot close without giving accolades to the wait staff who despite the crowd was attentive.  I recommend it and will be back. Thank you Fog Harbor for an excellent afternoon dining experience!

author: Brian K.
stars:
On pier 39,  long wait but efficient and effective system to let you know when your table is ready.  Comfortable wait area.  Food was very good.  I had the  pacific sole with fingerling potatoes and capers.  Also tried the clam chowder and it was tasty with a little grit from the clams.  Service was excellent.  
Expensive on a national level but reasonable for touristy San Francisco.

author: Payal V.
stars:
We tried coming here for Father's Day, but couldn't get a reservation for our large group. My family and I happened to be in town one Friday and decided to dine here since the menu had looked so good during Father's Day. 

It's a really nice restaurant amongst all of the casual tourist spots in the same area. I got the mixed grill and my husband got the ahi tuna dish.  I was underwhelmed by my dish. The mixed grill consisted of shrimp, swordfish, and salmon. The best fish on my plate was the shrimp. The other fish were dry and overcooked. 

My husband's ahi was good. The flavors came together well to make a good dish.

author: Linda F.
stars: Great seafood and a nice view of the marina! Food came pretty fast and we only waited a few minutes to be seated. Would recommend.

author: Angela M.
stars: This place was delicious! The ambiance was fantastic. It took me to a different world! Was decorated so beautifully! We had the clam chowder with crab! It was Devine! Then we had the lazy cioppino! Absolutely mouthwatering! Highly recommend you check this place out! OH YA! The waits a little extreme but that's why we made a reservation! And the waiters are all so friendly! Would def come back!

author: Phillip H.
stars:
Friendly and knowledgeable wait staff.  Great food and wonderful views of the bay. 

The Dungeness crab was absolutely delicious.  My wife has a dairy allergy and  they were able to sauté it in oil and garlic instead of butter (it made her day). 

The fried shrimp with fries and coleslaw was good as well. The scallop appetizer looked delicious as it kept coming out of the kitchen, but I just wasn't hungry enough to eat both dishes. I'll definitely try it next time though!

author: Gege C.
stars: Came here with my grandpa. My grandpa wanted to try some good seafood in the United States. We ordered a sea food plate, a chicken pasta and a chowder soup.

author: Ali L.
stars: Just had the best dining experience to ring in the New Year! Gia was phenomenal, definitely coming back!

author: Maria C.
stars: Our server, Raphael, turned our family outing into a lovely evening. Wine, clam chowder, and the Shellfish Platter for 4 makes for a happy family! No crabby-patties here!  #bombdotcom

author: Danielle C.
stars:
Food was fresh and tasty. I ordered the crab entree and my friend ordered the lobster- we ended up splitting our meals. 

Only down fall was it was foggy so our window "view seating" had no view. But can't hold that on the restaurant as they have no control :) 

This restaurant is Fisherman Warf area so great place given the busy location. Service was great too.

author: Caden A.
stars: While visiting San Francisco for work, I decided to have dinner at Pier 39. I had the popcorn shrimp as an appetizer and the lobster tail as my meal. My meal was amazing. I only give the restaurant four stars because of the subpar service I received.

author: Liz G.
stars: I just had lunch at fog harbor  fish house,and the food was great,I would highly recommend  this place to anyone for lunch,

author: Nichole H.
stars: Go for the fresh rolls and the Dungeness crab! The fried calamari was amazing. Make sure to finish dinner with the blondie.

author: Laurie W.
stars:
This restaurant was highly recommended to me, so I thought I would celebrate my mom's birthday at this establishment.  We had such poor service - our server was negligent and in need of an attitude adjustment.  Needless to say, we all lost our appetite.  This was an unfortunate and regrettable choice to celebrate my mom's birthday.  Probably would've gotten better service at McDonald's.  And no...I would not step foot or recommend this establishment.


(In response to Bob's comments below:  thank you for your response concerning my feedback.  We were there 12/30/2018. Server: Asia.  In addition, a man with glasses approached us at the table in response to my text regarding the poor service.  I'm assuming he's the floor manager. This individual didn't even bother to identify who he was and was "giggling" during his inquiry.  Therefore, I did not take this individual seriously with his unprofessional approach.)

author: Kim P.
stars:
My family and I were looking for a place to have lunch, and I insisted that we should come here based on yelp reviews and I was right. hip hip! Everything was good except that there was this not so little fly trying to kiss on my cheek!

- strawberry basil nojito(non alcohol) : very sweet and fresh. I forgot to ask for little ice. It was literally full of ice that my drink was gone after two sips....:( 

- res chili garlic shrimp : our server warned us that it is very spicy......are you kidding me!? Not spicy at all! Booo but it was good. The plate itself was small but there were many shrimps and vegetables to share with. This was perfect with blue cheese garlic bread. 

- clam chowder : AWARD WINNING! No wonder! One of the best clam chowder I've ever had. But please order this with a cup or a regular bowl(not the bread bowl) and eat it with blue cheese garlic bread. I mean, unless you want to eat lots of breads...

- blue cheese garlic bread : the BEST dish I had here. I love love cheese and garlic and how can you go wrong when you have them with a bread!? And if you add clam chowder here...? Heavenly! But the bread is really big, big enough to share with 3people.

- lobster tail : chewy and fresh, but mashed potato and broccoli was meh :/ i ended up leaving all of them. It tasted like they didn't add any seasoning. 

- cioppino : I didn't get to try this but looked amazing. My husband said it's good but not amazing. I recommend you to order "lazy" one though...so that you don't need to deal with crab shells haha

Overall, it was great!

author: Caleigh L.
stars: I was pleasantly surprised to find that this place lived up to the yelp reviews.  I was skeptical about falling into a tourist trap but really felt that I had a fine dinner against all odds! We went here on a whim on a Wednesday evening and it was still pretty busy but we were seated immediately. In spite of the touristy location the vibe was not chintzy or oversold and instead of just enjoying the view as a consolation we also enjoyed our meal and the service very much. There is something on the menu for almost any palate. The food was delicious and nicely presented. I had the salmon at our servers recommendation and thoroughly enjoyed it. Fish and chips were good as well as the chicken breast. The service was on point. I have worked in the restaurant industry so I know what makes for good food service and this place has their stuff together. Overall a great dining experience that I would recommend.

author: Jennie H.
stars: My last visit at Fog Harbor was three years ago.  I was really impressed then and have been looking forward to another visit.  This time i was very  disappointed, unfortunately.  We ordered the seafood platter like last time but were not happy at all.  There was not much flavor with all the shellfish in it.  Also, the clams, mussels, and the crab didn't taste fresh.  They tasted like they were long dead before they were cooked.    The award winning clam chowder was mediocre.  I've tasted much better elsewhere.   Don't think I will go back again.

author: Rich K.
stars: Second time at the pier, and my first time at this restaurant. I have to say their chowder is quite delicious. Edgar our server was timely and polite. One thing I will say is that the wait time was deceptively long. When they tell you 20-30 minutes I guess it means more like 45 to an hour. I wholeheartedly reccomend this place.

author: Vanda E.
stars:
Well, this is the Second Best Clam Chowder for me in SF. The place is very nice and more fancy than all the peer in Pier 39. The food is great and seating are comfortable with the nice view. 
Since this store is really in middle of tourist spot, the store is busy most of the time. But the waiting time is not bad considered they are busy. The clam chowder are in bread bowl and taste is good just not the best for me. The non-alcohol drinks are interesting and taste good. The main dish and is the Bomb for me is the seafood platter. Everything in seafood platter are great, the clams, the Mussels, the Shrimp, the crab legs and the Flavored that come with it. You can also add lobster if you'd like and I think it's great to have this option. 

Overall this is a great place if you were to stop by Pier 39!

author: Amanda S.
stars: Took us a while at first to be acknowledged by our server but after that we had a wonderful experience. The food was really good, fresh seafood, can't it get better? We were celebrating birthdays as well and they gave us a free dessert! The view isn't as great as they say it is but it is right on the water so you see that, just not the Golden Gate Bridge like they advertise.

author: Vicki P.
stars: The food and the view were fantastic. I was in San Francisco for the day with two friends. We stopped here for early dinner after seeing reviews on Yelp. It was a great choice.

author: Priscilla M.
stars: Very good restaurant. Fish dishes we tried were very good. Excellent service and great views of the bay. Downside, pretty expensive menu. In the heart of Pier 39, so being a local, not a place I want to go to. Prices probably set high for tourist crowd.

author: Charlotte S.
stars: Amazing start! We were served delicious sourdough rolls and they were hot and fresh! My daughter and I got fresh brewed iced tea that tasted like it was brewed 1 minuet before. We then ordered the calamari appetizer. It was fantastic! Perfectly crispy and not too chewy! 5/5. We followed who's out entrées. I got the tuna, my son got Cioppino, and my daughter got a burger.  I really enjoyed my tuna. It was tender, flavorful and fresh. My son said a word to describe his meal was " superb". My daughter really enjoyed her burger! Not only the food was good, the service was on point! They were constantly coming around making sure everyone was okay, and the minute mine and my daughters ice teas we're halfway full, they refilled them! My daughter ordered rice, and the second she told the waiter she wanted french fries, he brought her out a fresh batch! I will definitely be returning the next time I come to San Francisco!

author: Brandon I.
stars:
Came here while on vacation in San Francisco. My wife and I came here on a Saturday evening around 7:30pm. We had about a 45 minute wait which wasn't too bad considering there's plenty to do at pier 39! About 40 mins later I received a text message saying our table was ready! Huge plus to have that as an option for customers, that way you don't have to stay at the restaurant. 

After being seated it took about 8-10 minutes for our server to finally get our drink order and another 5 minutes to get our drinks. The server seemed to be a little overwhelmed, but we understood because of how busy it was. 

I ordered the surf and turf which had a 10 oz lobster tail and 10 oz NY steak.  My wife had the 10 oz lobster tail. Both dishes were great and full of flavor. 

The seating area we were in had an amazing view of the bay and you could see the Golden Gate Bridge in the distance!!

author: Kevin S.
stars: Again we were seated right away and it was busy with the blue angles air show and Fleet Week. And oh yes the food and service impeccable . Salmon awesome and great view of the bay. And when your shop pier 39 for the rest of the day to ah burn calories after your meal

author: David J.
stars: I have to say, I have had numerous meals while in the Bay Area, and this is about the best one (well actually two, since we went back the next night it was so good).  We've eaten at most all the big restaurants down at the central area at Pier 45, Scioto's, Alioto's, Tarantino's, etc, and I was always left a little disappointed with the atmosphere, service, view, etc.  But Fog Harbor nailed all those and I think the views from there far surpass any other place we've eaten down on the wharf.  Of course the clam chowder is off the hook, probably the best I've ever had anywhere, especially when topped with the crab meat, but it was all really good. And the service and atmosphere were right on point too.  The first night we had Michael and he was really laid back and timely, the second night Jeremy took care of us and he was very open and very informative.  Two completely different styles but both outstanding in their own way.  I could go on and on, but both meals were just amazing, views from every seat, even though we waited both nights for a window seat, and just a great, great time on the wharf.  Thanks Fog Harbor for two great meals!!!!!

author: Maria R.
stars:
We were in San Fran for a few days and a friend recommended we have Clam chowder soup on sourdough bread. So of course I opened my Yelp app and typed in just that. So here we are!

We weren't "too hungry", so the wife and I ended up ordering the clam chowder, a cocktail and wine. We thought that would be it for dinner. Well, the view was good so we stayed long enough and ordered a few more cocktails and a burger. 

Would HIGHLY recommend this place. Our server (Rafael from FL) was friendly and hospitable. Didn't bother us while eating, but made great recommendations and always refilled our drinks/was alert to our needs. EASY 5 STARS. Great spot if you're in fisherman's wharf!

author: Shirley O.
stars: My husband and I stopped into Fog Harbor for lunch after wandering at Pier 39 and I was really happy with the food and service. The menu is varied and I'm confident that you could get anything on it, and the food would be really good. Our server did an awesome job!

author: Abel A.
stars: Located on beautiful pier 39 only a few hundred yards away from the barking seals. Friendly service; food was good, not great.

author: Catherine M.
stars: Boy, this place is super touristy, but the views are great. I recommend coming at night when there are fewer tourists and the nighttime view of the city is gorgeous. It is worth trying to wait for a window seat. If you have a hankering for Dungeoness crab, I recommend that you order that. Otherwise, it is the usual seafood suspects on the menu.  You get bored of waiting, try the cocktails. They are good.Also they validate parking.

author: Pilar S.
stars:
highly recommended


*service was amazing
*staff is very friendly
*food is delicious
 *view is nice and relaxing

author: Leanne B.
stars: In the heart of the Wharf tourist trap you will find Fig Harbor Fish House. Strongly recommend asking for a table near the window and enjoying a chowder bread bowl with crab on top! Unreal. *they use NoWait!

author: Don G.
stars: This place has a great view of the pier. The atmosphere is very classy and the staff gives excellent service. I had the clam chowder, lazy Cioppino (lazy means meat is taken out of shellfish), and blackberry press. The chowder has great consistency and pairs well with their freshly made sourdough bread. The freshness of the seafood really came through on the Cioppini. I almost regret mixing in the tomato sauce and taking away from the seafood, but that's just a matter a preference and I'd still order the dish again.

author: Judy K.
stars: Two of us enjoyed a dinner during the week while in SF, wait staff abundant, food very good, wine  list average, white table covers, full bar...we'll back

author: Georgia P.
stars:
Stopped by as this was on my bucket list trip. Many, including the restaurant, claims to have "the best" clam chowder - huge disappointment. Chewy, rubbery and turned me off. Maybe the cook had a bad day. 

Separately, the Chicago-born bartender, he made my visit amazing!!! Listen to his recommendations and believe me - he's spot on!  Crab and avocado salad is huge and to die for! House chardonnay is phenomenal! 

Great views!

author: Rebecca C.
stars:
This restaurant was such a great choice for fresh seafood and a beautiful view of San Fransisco bay. 
We got the seafood tower for two of us to share and it was more than enough food. 
I really wish we saved room for dessert because the tray they brought around to showcase the desserts looked amazing. 
There will be a "next time" and I will be sure to enjoy dessert

author: Natalie K.
stars:
This restaurant offers nice views overlooking the water, delicious food, and great drinks. 
We came here after taking a tour of Alcatraz, it's literally a 10 min walk from pier 33 or a 4 min cab ride. I live in a city where I have to drive everywhere and come from a city where I walked 80% of the time, so we opted out for a walk. 
The restaurant's decor is rather fancy, though I was dressed pretty casually, I did not feel out of place. Everyone here seems chill, no judgmental stares. 
As far as food, the Huns had NY steak with veggies and mash, I opted for a bread bowl with crab (I was told I MUST have chowder when in San Fran, so I took this as an opportunity to do so). Our waitress asked if we wanted a bread basket while we wait, we did. By the time food came out, the Huns had almost all the bread. I wasn't going for bread since I was going to have plenty in my meal. Even though food took a little while, it was delicious! The streak was spectacular, it had the grilled taste Huns looks for. My bowl was delicious as well, with crab stacked on top. It doesn't originally come with crab but you can add it for $7. A little messy since I tried to rip off pieces of the bread bowl. 
Drinks were great too. I tried the Alcatraz since we were coming from there (corny, I know). It could of been stronger but it was still good. It was also my second drink and I was a little buzzed from the first. I usually don't feel the alcohol in my second drink as much. Especially since my first had tequillaaaaaaa (you have to sing it and shake your shoulders, it's a law). 
I give 4 stars because our waitress was pretty bland. It felt like she had an attitude up until the end, when it came to a tip... then she turned into a Chatty Cathy, asking us about where we are from and telling us she has to pay $1,000 worth of tickets tomorrow... mmhhhhhmmmm, right... I saw her do exactly the same thing to a table next to ours. Oh, and when their drink spilled, she stood on the side allowing other servers clean it up and grinned. It was the first sight of happiness I saw from her. I mean, don't be so obvious!

author: Ruchi S.
stars:
Pier 39 is synonymous to San Francisco. It is full of restaurants and shops. I have very fond memories of pier 39. Having clam chowder and enjoying the endless beauty of sea.. Divine. During my last visit, I got a chance to try out this restaurant. All the seats with sea view were taken, so we were escorted to the dining area in between. The menu had loads of seafood options to choose from. My husband and I settled with red chili garlic shrimp and Cioppino. Cioppino was developed by Italian immigrants in San Fracncisco, so I had to try it. 
Service was good. Red chili garlic shrimps were perfectly cooked. They were not as spicy as I thought they would be. Cioppino tasted really good and had a variety of sea food. 
Both the dishes tasted great. Next time, I will try other items off menu.

author: Mimi M.
stars: This was actually good. Bread bowl of clam chowder tasty. Lobster was sweet. Fried shrimp very good. Our drinks were so-so and so was the wedge salad. But service was attentive. View was nice. Bread rolls were good. Would be back.

author: Blake C.
stars:
I give it three stars because it's just a three-star restaurant. Mainly because everything was mediocre and the price was high. 

It was OK. You have a spare is OK. The food is OK. The service is decent. Nothing spectacular about the restaurant. 

The bread was really good. I can get I can give them high remarks on that.  The wedge salad was also really tasty. 

The steak has an interesting taste.  They use teriyaki sauce or some kind of tangy sauce to spread on the steak.

author: Mirna P.
stars: This is by far the best seafood restaurant on pier 39!! They have amazing views of the bay and the food is absolutely delicious. We were hear to celebrate my daughters birthday and our server Daniel made sure of that and more! He was very attentive and their wasn't a dry glass on our table and his suggestions were spot on thank you so much Daniel C.. for your great service you are a great example of what we look forward to in going to a restaurant and that's why I will be back many more times because of great people like you who enjoy at what they do! The food was excellent and be sure to save room for the dessert it's a must!!

author: Restaurant K.
stars: We had went out to the city and wanted a nice sit down dinner. We site seeing and was at the pier and checked this place out. I had the crab  and she had the lobster. Must say we where both happy with our food of course we shared both between the both of us and it was great no complaints!!!!

author: Sheila E.
stars: Had the seafood penne and the sole. Both were very good. The penne was very flavorful and the sole was refreshing. I would order either of them again, although I would want to try the ahi next. I love that you can put yourself on the waitlist via Yelp so we could wander around. Our friend had their dog from site seeing all day and was glad that the restaurant could still accommodate us.

author: Carl T.
stars:
A delicious and relaxing place. This was my favorite restaurant while in San Francisco. 
This was our first day in San Francisco, we stumbled onto this while walking around Fisherman's Wharf and I am glad we did. We decided to come here for dinner. We had to wait for a table but that was fine by us. Every table has a view of the water. The staff was warm, friendly and helpful, and we were soon digging into delicious freshly baked sourdough bread, enjoying our drinks, and looking forward to our fish. The meal, which was served quickly, was very good, tasty and plentiful!  I had the cioppino, and it was chock full of seafood in a beautifully seasoned broth. My wife had the Dungeness crab in garlic butter, the flavors bounced off the plate.
We loved it so much we went back next day. We enjoyed the beautiful view of the Bay and the sunset along with an outstanding meal. 
I would highly recommend this for a wonderful waterfront seafood experience while in San Francisco.

author: Steve F.
stars: Last weekend my wife and I visited San Francisco again for our 1 year anniversary. We were hungry for some lunch so we decided to come here. Overall I would have to say pretty disappointed with the quality of the food. I was thinking since many of the yelp reviews were good and the pictures looked amazing - this place would be great. I was pretty inaccurate in that assumption as the fish was dry, steak was bland, and steamed broccoli was crunchier then a potato chip. The only thing that was decent were the mashed potatoes. I wish my wife and I had stuck with our original plan to go to Scoma's for lunch - now that place is amazing!!

author: Christiana S.
stars: Yelped a seafood place for dinner and this came up with 4 stars. It was delicious, no wait at about 430pm for dinner. Views are awesome and Lulu our server was so patient and helpful.

author: Linda M.
stars: We attended the Fog Harbor Fish House on Mother's Day. And the service was absolutely lousy. The food came to the table cold, which had to be returned to be reheated. I had mussels and fries and the shelves were empty and mounted on a small bed of french fries I do not know where the muscles were so that had to be sent back. I've had the mussels and Fries in the past and they were mounted beautiful on a hugh bed of french fries with a very delicious sauce ( but I ordered from the bar, I think when you order from the bar you get better food and service). This rendition of mussels and fries was a loser by all standards the muscles were very small after returning them to the manager that is what he brought me out mussels in the shell but the smallest that he could find. The calamari was fried hard and was very salty. That too had to be sent back. My mother ordered  Caesar's crab salad, and the salad had canned crab  on it. Being that the restaurant sits right on the wharf we're fresh crab is serve, Dungeness crab, you would think they wouldn't be so cheap as to serve can crab; they would use fresh Dungeness crab on their salads. But that was not the case with her salad last night. Fog Harbor Fish House is cutting corners  at every angle to save money  which is bad for the dining experience. My sister ordered a lobster for $25 and got about a 2.5-oz lobster tail that had to be sent back. The clam chowder is very thick mother said it tasted like gravy. She did not like it at all. My husband ordered a steak  and it had no seasoning on it whatsoever he had to load it down with salt and pepper. Mashed potatoes  were the worst he had ever eaten in his entire life  they were from a box and Watered-down, horrible mashed potatoes. Everything that came out of the kitchen on Mother's day was awful. I do not  recommend going to The Fog Harbor Fish House for any special occasion or hoilday because they cannot get it right. When addressing the manager for all the issues that we had with our dinner. He told us word-for-word "never come to the Fog Harbor Fish House on Mother's Day because it is the worst day of the year for them." Who knew that, perhaps that is why they did not take it reservation. The Fog Harbor Fish House used to be a great place to go for appetizers and drinks. But they are limited on their drinks as well they only serve one type of vodka and did not serve Ciroc. My mother's Margarita came in a short heavy brandy glass--a Very short Stout heavy glass. She thought to send it back but didn't mention it until after we left the restaurant which was awful. Because that drink would have been sent back to the bar and put it in the appropriate margarita glass come especially for serving a lady. The Fog Harbor Fish House is not what it used to be, and if I'd known the service was going to be this bad I would have never taken my mother there for Mother's Day. Not only was the food awful and prepared badly but the waiter managed to waste water on two of Our Guest backs. He was the worst of them all serving our table and didn't know what to do. I was told by the manager that he had been waiting tables for 20 years. I find it very hard to believe! I had never had him wait on my table before as I have stated I have been to the Fog Harbor Fish House before and my dining experience was okay. I won't say excellent because they had some issues before but they were minor. We will not be coming back.

author: Noel A.
stars: Very good and fresh food. Only reason not receiving 5 stars is because the Poke bowl was average. I came in with 5 others about 20 minutes before close. We were sat immediately and our server "Jess" was excellent. She was very courteous and helpful. She recommended the clam chowder which was excellent. My dish was the seared tuna it was perfectly seared. The stir fry and rice it came with was a great compliment and delicious. Would recommend to anyone.

author: Emie S.
stars:
Just walking by and found this place. Our party of 7 was quickly seated in the back by the window. We had a really good view! 

We shared the calamari and everyone got the clam chowder. I got the soup/ caesar salad combo with added chicken to my salad. Surprisingly, the food came out really quickly, I didn't even get a chance to butter my bread and eat it! 

The calamari was really good and the tartar sauce was creamy and delicious. The caesar could of used more dressing but it was still good. The clam
chowder came in a bread bowl and was really delicious. The sign said it was a SF top 10 restaurant and popular specifically for their clam
chowder. I would have preferred it to be a little chunkier but overall really good.

Good place with great views! Will definitely stop by next time I'm back in SF.

author: Thuy H.
stars: The place has a nice view of the bay with Golden Gate Bridge and Alcatraz island is visible.  The service is good, the food is delicious.  The only negative thing is I found a hair in my chowder, so they comp the chowder and gave us a new bowl but it is still kind of ruin our appetize.

author: Alex A.
stars: Visited this location while in town. Food was really good. A lot of options on the menu. Service was okay...nothing stellar. Would certainly visit again when in town.

author: Jim G.
stars: Great, fresh seafood.  A must visit every time we go to the bay area.  Fun shops along the pier.

author: Bryan W.
stars: Came here for our anniversary and we were very satisfied! Decorated with Xmas lights made the ambiance  that much more appealing. The food was fantastic we came for cioppino which you can order a "full crab" cioppino if desired. Our server was "Mel" who was a pretty cool dude. Located right on Fisherman's Wharf would highly recommend

author: Kathleen L.
stars: Giving this 4 stars only because it was really pricey. Came here on a weekday for lunch after a tour of Alcatraz. The restaurant was busy at the time but we didn't have to wait for a table. Service was great and so was the food! I ordered the shrimp brochette. The shrimp was well seasoned and cooked perfectly. For just the entree, it was $29. I'm not sure if they have a separate dinner menu, but I thought that price was steep for lunch. Definitely worth a stop if you want to splurge though. You won't be disappointed!

author: Kyle B.
stars:
Average sea food restaurant!!!
After reading a few of the rave reviews I was hoping to be the next critic to sing their praises, but in my honest opinion, it was just an average dining experience. Fog Harbor is your typical sea food joint with all the usual cuisine reinforced by sublime views of the bay and Wharf below. 

Upon arrival I was seated fairly quickly (considering it was Mother's Day and very crowded) at the bar, of course, which I'm used to since I typically dine alone. My meal consisted of battered fried cod filets and three, maybe four decent, but certainly not jumbo sized shrimp---as I was expecting, a side of coleslaw and fries. The fish and shrimp tasted fine; nothing spectacular, coleslaw was bland. I prefer mine creamy and sweet. Maybe it's the Floridian in me, lol. On a positive note, the vignette wine soda is definitely worth a try, for non drinkers who want to put on a spin on things. It's like drinking Chardonnay without feeling the buzz. I will say that the staff was friendly and accommodating, although, the guy who was waiting on me did disappear for awhile, but they were super busy, so it's understandable. 

In summation, Fog harbor is a classic sea food joint, safe and reassuring, but nothing outstanding. The local Red Lobster, in my opinion would meet the same expectations for slightly lesser the price.

author: Maya C.
stars: Had a great meal at Fog Harbor Fish House!    Great Scenery  Great Ambiance  Great Food - clam chowder especially!

author: Mary J.
stars: Seafood was very fresh, I had the spicy shrimp appetizer which was spicier than I expected and the Beer battered fish and chips! A little bland but I enjoyed because I got the full flavor.

author: Kristie W.
stars:
A lot of waiting for little payoff.   We visited during our layover from Hawaii to Atlanta, looking forward to some of that famous San Francisco seafood.  This restaurant was my choice and I chose poorly. 

One bright spot- the super nice hostess seated us at a terrific table overlooking the water. There are some gorgeous views to be had here so make sure you get a good table. 

Though not very crowded there was a long wait for everything.  A long wait to order drinks, to get drinks, to order food, to get food, to get check and on and on.  We almost had to go wander around and find our server to even pay our bill. Our server had a habit of stopping for long chats are many tables in her section.

The food was disappointing as well. We ordered a combo that had salmon and cod.  I don't normally care for cod (my husband does and we were splitting) so I was planning to eat the salmon.  It was so bad though!  The cod was perfect, with a very nice sauce.  The salmon was super-fishy and drowning in sauce. 

Not a horrible place but not a place we'd return to when there are so very many options in the area.

author: Laura G.
stars: OMG, We found Nirvana! On a cold frozen night, we stumbled into This restaurant, sat at the bar have some drinks while waiting for our table. Then we realized how wonderful it was sitting at the bar and decided to have dinner at the bar. Our bartender was awesome, accommodating and gave awesome suggestions And individualized attention, I had the hibiscus margarita, ordered steamed clams, blue cheese garlic bread and The jumbo scallops and crab risotto. TO DIE FOR! I would definitely recommend this restaurant and would definitely be a returning customer time and time again! All food was spot on, not over salted or under seasoned, ambience was spot on and so grateful that we chose this restaurant! You will not be disappointed! I just cannot say enough about how wonderful this place is, and no, it's not the 3 hibiscus margarita talking either! LOL - my intuition was correct once again!

author: Paul W.
stars: Came here for some drinks after sailing with some long time friends.  Bar is elegant, service was prompt.  Prices weren't too bad!  If in the area, and needing a drink, this place is recommended.  I didn't try the food, so I can't comment.

author: Nikki B.
stars:
FISH N CHIPS WITH A VIEW~

CUSTOMER SERVICE: 5/5. AJ was our main server but the manager I believe and other servers were helping us out as well. Drinks were never empty and we always got more bread when we asked. Orders were taken at a timely manner and it only took about 15 minutes for all of our food to come out.

FOOD:
SOUP/SALAD COMBO: 5/5. Got the clam chowder bread bowl and Caesar salad. So good! I loved the salad dressing and the lettuce was very fresh and crispy. They leave the lettuce strips uncut so just a heads up. I honestly didn't think too much of it but it could be a little difficult to eat.

FISH N CHIPS: 5/5. So crispy and big. The fish was delicious and the fries were great as well. Coleslaw could've been a bigger portion but not complaining. Came with about 3 big pieces! Definitely would get again.

SEAFOOD PENNE: 5/5. Really creamy and lots of seafood. Portion for this was big and definitely filling. Pasta was cooked well. Nothing wrong with this dish. Highly recommend.

OVERALL: 5/5. With views of the Pier from pretty much wherever you're sitting, great food and how classy the restaurant was, it could easily be a restaurant for a date night or a casual dinner. Can't wait to come back when in SF~

author: Cori W.
stars: I had the claim chowder. It was delicious! I want to say it's the best on the pier but to be honest, I didn't try any others. I'm sure you won't be disappointed though. This place also has a great view if you get the right table.

author: Iveta O.
stars: One of our favorite restaurants in San Francisco. We visit every time we are in town. Whether its for dinner or lunch (or something in between), it never disappoints. Highly recommend the clam chowder, lobster, seafood tower.. everything is just great! Service is excellent and although it's always packed, tables are available quickly for walk in guests. You can now sign up on the wait list via Yelp before arriving to save time. Thanks for the great food and service and see you next time!!

author: Brady B.
stars: Brady Bunte - I stopped into Fog Harbor for lunch after wandering at Pier 39.  It truly was an amazing place. The food was delicious and the service was attentive. The baked oysters was such an awesome starter.  Perfect for a nice relaxing lunch on the pier with amazing views.

author: Eugene W.
stars: Great place to eat food was wonderful service was absolutely great atmosphere is top notch

author: Grace H.
stars:
This is probably my favorite seafood restaurant.
I would definitely come back to this restaurant if I visit San Francisco once again. 
The lobsters were nicely cleaned and served.
The food were just so aesthetically pleasing to the eyes and mouth. 
Honestly, once you start eating you'd be pretty damn amazed. 
The lobster was SO juicy, highly recommend!!

author: Kirk Q.
stars:
Okay don't come if you are looking for cheap. Our 2 adults and a child ticket was a cool 100. 
That being said YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR. %100 FANTASTIC!!! Every single thing we ordered was over the top good. Justin our server was super friendly and helpful getting us around the menu. I chose his recommendation of the Cioppino and it was spot on! Thanks Justin and thanks Fog Harbor for an outstanding night.

author: Nora M.
stars: Loved the views and the food was great.  Location worked perfectly for showing family around the bay area.  Will definitely return soon.

author: Pooja C.
stars: Wandered in here for an early dinner on a Friday and thankfully got a seat by the window looking out onto the pier where we got to see a gorgeous sunset. This place is a bit pricey but you do get what you pay for. The seafood is excellent and while it is a slightly more upscale place, there were many people there who were not dressed up so we fit right in. I got an Irish Coffee (it was St. Patrick's Day, after all) and the fish and chips, which I hadn't had in ages. Everything was cooked perfectly, not too oily and just the right amount of crispy. The portion was pretty big so couldn't finish it but it was delicious. Service and atmosphere were great. I probably would only come here on special occasions but highly recommend it, especially if you're a tourist and looking for great seafood with a view.

author: Yang L.
stars: Went there on a Thursday lunch time. Didn't have to wait and we even got a window table with fantastic pier view. We ordered Shellfish Platter for one with a Lobster Tail, a Mixed Grill and Award Winning Chowder in a Fresh Baked Sourdough Bread Bowl. That's more than enough food for my mom and me. The seafood is of course fantastic and fresh, the waitress is also very friendly and helpful. Great experience!

author: Rosalind G.
stars: It is absolutely delicious! Scallop and crab risotto is amazing! The feeling of chewing the large scallop is great, and the taste of tomato perfectly neutralize the cheese. Also blue cheese garlic bread is great (but too much for single. Maybe I should've asked for a half plate)! But definitely expensive. The disadvantage.

author: John C.
stars: One of my favorites in town. Their staff is always professional and the food never disappoints. Get the Cioppino, you'll love it.

author: Ji Eun L.
stars:
Definitely get a seat by the window and make a reservation or go early to get a seat. It gets really busy by lunchtime on Sunday. View is beautiful during mid-day. 

Great drink list and food was above average.

Great staff & bathroom is clean :)

author: Robert M.
stars:
This place is SERIOUS about food. I thought it was in the middle of the touristy part of the Fisherman's Wharf and I would pay for the scenery rather than the food. Boy I was wrong. It had both!

Almost all of the seats had spectacular views of the wharves, piers, boats and bay. Ours was not on the window, but one off the row which was in fact better. The wait service was impeccable. 

We came early which is about the smartest thing you could do if you don't want to wait for a hugely popular place to get a seat. Starters was the best old fashioned I've had. I don't like them "muddled", but the mashed fruit with the maple syrup was quite unique and quite enjoyable.

I started with a cub of clam chowder. It was very, very good. Not the best, but enjoyable. Lots of clams and bacon. Maybe too much bacon, but I will never say such a sacrilege out loud - "too much bacon". Just rip my tongue out before that happens. 

We split an appetizer portion of their scallops. They were fried in almost a Callabash style. No, I can't describe it, so Google it. I worked at a seafood restaurant on the South Carolina coast and this tasted like that. Very well cooked and very tasty. Lots of them almost like lightly battered popcorn shrimp. 

I like sampling things, so I went with the mixed grill. Had a little bit of everything. The asparagus was spot on. I'm not a tomato fan, but they were ok. The mashed potatoes were wonderful. Not mashed enough to be smooth, so it had a great texture and taste. It came with three of the most AWESOME grilled shrimp that I hoped I would come back some day just for the shrimp. It also came with a  fabulous piece of salmon. That too would have made a great meal. Finally a piece very superb swordfish. I started going into mental overload thinking which I would have as a dedicated meal if I ever came back. Too many awesome choices!

author: Celina O.
stars: It was my first time being here, I would definitely recommend this place to my friends! Friendly service and the food was great. I would recommend the surf and turf

author: daniel B.
stars:
First of all our server was beyond belief. He dealt with my two kids as if they were his own. He made them say please and thank you. Which we have been working on with the both of them.

We had a great seat with a great view. The service was great with good drinks and  excellent recommendation for lunch. When the food arrived it was what expected. It was cooked perfectly and delicious. This is our third time here and it is our favorite place to go to when we drive up from San Jose. 

Recommendations are the fist and chips, chowder with crab and the calamari. For drinks the manhattan and bloody Mary's were very tasty 

Great place.

author: Ryan S.
stars: I feel bad we can't remember how to spell his name, but *Khamani was an excellent server! He gave us great trips for the city and the food was awesome! The spicy garlic shrimp was top notch.

author: Christy H.
stars: This is my favorite place for lunch or dinner. If you are heading there try the amazing seafood. Didn't realize how good seafood is until this place. Coming here again when I have time off for sure. Only wish they had more locations

author: Alex L.
stars: Surprisingly great dining experience, given the touristy area. It has received such rave reviews that I figured I had to try it - and I was craving some seafood. I've certainly had better in the city but for the price, it was still great.

author: Kaynat Q.
stars: Each dishes that we tried were really good. Wait time is long but worth it. Price is reasonable considering the place and food quality

author: Kelsey S.
stars:
We were hard-pressed to find a restaurant that met everyone's needs: my mom wanted seafood, my dad is a picky eater and seemingly only eats red meat, and we didn't want to spend a fortune. The only place I could find with two dollar signs that served both seafood and steak was the Fog Harbor Fish House. They were concerned about it being too touristy, and were also put off by the fact that we couldn't get a reservation, but I wanted to give it a chance.

Well. Sure, it's at Pier 39, but it's not "touristy" in the typical sense. It's elegant, and very San Francisco. It has a wonderful view of the bay, and our window faced the lovely sunset over Mt. Tam.

They really do reserve most of their tables for walk-ins; we were nervous about walking up at 6 p.m. without a reservation, but we only had to wait 15 minutes.

The food was exquisite. I had the seafood penne, which was to die for. The mussels are HUGE! Others had the mixed grill, the seafood platter, and the Fog Harbor burger. Everyone loved their meals, and our waitress, Ashley, was very kind and attentive.

As for the price, it's a bit more than two dollar signs. But graded on a curve, I'd say that it is less expensive than other places that serve similar fare. Each dish could have easily cost $5-10 more elsewhere.

This would be a lovely place to bring visitors from out of town or a local date just the same.

author: Derrick M.
stars: Got the clam chowder with the crab added, good enough to make me overlook the horrible service.  Spoke to the bartender three times, when I got the menu, when I placed my order, and when I paid.  He did not come back to see if I wanted a drink or a desert, and I wanted both.  I'll be back because of the clam chowder, and seed cereal dishes I saw on the menu.  Had a big breakfast that day and a taste for some good clam chowder, and it was excellent.
