This was last Sunday May 6th, around lunch time

author: Melissa G.
stars: Shakura Was so pleasant, as we let her know that we were in a rush and she was very proactive with our service. We ordered the clam chowder and she recommended add crab to it, so now I will never eat clam chowder without crab!! Awesome service and experience. Thanks Shakura!!!!

author: Shane T.
stars:
Okay if you are like me and love to eat good food and are afraid of bad service this place is set up in the perfect location to be bad in both because it's located in one of the busiest touristy places in the world, however that is TOTALLY NOT what happened! Instead we received great food and excellent service. It was the perfect lunch experience and our server Ashlee was amazing adding to our overall experience!

Okay so really the clam chowder is awesome! Recommended by my family who live in the city over Boudin's. Good call sister because I was out on a date. The view is incredible as you sit there with the bay view of the "ROCK" and ships coming into and out of port. World class service makes you feel like you are at a fine dining restaurant. Yet this place is adorned by locals as well and affordable. The menu suits all and I will make sure to come back.

The calamari was excellently cooked with fried jalepanos and onions alongside a lemon aioli sauce. The fish and chips portion was large enough to be shared by two people and it came out perfect. I don't know if I've ever had better. You can actually tell they change the grease out of the fryer because instead of tasting grease you tasted the breaded goodness and the fish.

Please don't be afraid to eat here since it is literally on the world famous Pier 39. It will be worth the wait as everyone and everything we encountered here was a positive and memorable experience! Looking forward to coming back soon!

author: Norman Y.
stars: Excellent service and great location! The food was ok, the risotto was great! The seafood platter was good, the crab tasted funny, but the service made up for it.

author: Andy H.
stars: Very pleasant setting, overlooking the bay. Courteous service and friendly. Food was very well prepared. Baked clams, the fish stew (I forget the name), crab cakes, all excellent. My one gripe is he fact that they were clearly  trying to rush us through our dining experience. I keep telling the waiter repeatedly we hadn't looked at the menu yet. Even the way they clear the dishes. Store you've finished, or that the main courses arrived before we'd finished our entrees. Clearly they want you in and out so they can turn round the table for the next bunch of visitors. So make sure you're prepared to push back on that!

author: A T.
stars: Stopped by with the wife today.  The crab cakes were the best I've ever had.  I would go back just for that alone.  Wow, out of this world.  Almost ordered another one but I had the shellfish platter.  That's was great too.  Service was commendable.  Wife had the chicken pasta penne was okay and average.  I'm giving the place 5 for my dishes.  Bread was okay.

author: Kevin H.
stars: Excellent food (pacific cod, clam chowder and shellfish platter), drink (escape from Alcatraz and lipstick lemon) and waiter (Michael).  Beautiful sunset, perfect evening.

author: Sara C.
stars: Excellent view and location, great food, decent service. I ordered the mixed grilled (salmon, cod, shrimp) with veggies and mashed potatoes. Loved my shrimp and veggies - they were delicious! Personally was disappointed in the salmon as my husband makes it better himself. My husband ordered the surf & turf. We're food people and he said the lobster was one of the best he's ever had! Our server wasn't very attentive nor was he friendly. Our bartender (while waiting on a table) was very nice though. We requested a table with a view and it was perfect. Alcatraz in the background. Must walk out to see the sea lions afterwards!

author: Sĩ Toàn N.
stars:
Came here on Mother's Day and it's very crowded. We waited for 45minutes to be seated.

We tried clam chowder, ciopino, salad, calamari and selfish dish. The food is good enough, and pricy, not as I expected but service and ambience were great.

author: T J.
stars: The food was beyond amazing. It was not to crowded and service was amazing. We got checked on very often to make sure everything was satisfactory (and it was). Before we finished our crab cocktail, our main courses were ready and it was just amazing. I highly highly recommend going here. Definitely worth the price.

author: Maura W.
stars:
We knew going in that this would be kind of a tourist trap, but the menu, reviews, and proximity to the Alcatraz dock drew us in. The food was actually quite good, as were the drinks, and our waiter was very nice. Unfortunately, our service was extremely rushed. We placed our order - for adults an app, soup, and entree all to share - and our waiter asked if we wanted it all at once. I said please no, we'd like our appetizer first for sure and the rest could come when it was ready. Instead, all of our food hit at once, less than 10 min after we ordered. Very disappointing, as our app was fried calamari. Didn't want to neglect the Dungeness crab, but I also don't care for fried food once it gets cold. The restaurant was not full, so we would have appreciated appropriately paced service. Especially since we specifically requested it.

Reply to comment - it was last Monday for a late lunch. We probably sat down between 1:30 and 2. Everything else was good, but we wouldn't have ordered the app if it was going to come out like that.

author: Tom P.
stars:
Fantastic seafood dishes!
I truly was not expecting much from the tourist trap that is pier 39 but I was pleasantly surprised. 
Order the last cioppino with pasta, the sauce is phenomenal. A bit pricy but delicious!

author: Lindsay P.
stars: View from our table was amazing. Could see the sea lions and sunset overlooking the ocean! Server was very nice and checked up on us frequently to make sure we were covered. Food was great; we got the Clam Chowder Bread Bowl with Dungeness Crab, fish and chips, and scallops and crab risotto! It was delicious and very filling. Will be back again

author: Rocio S.
stars: Great chowder and wonderful service. The Blue Cheese garlic bread is amazing!  Beautiful views too!

author: Zeoy S.
stars: Birthday brilliance! Fantastic views, delicious beverages. A classy bar with comfortable seating and a relaxing atmosphere. The full menu boasts classic dishes with a fantastic Frisco flare! Shakura, our waiter, attentively hosted our evening with grace and style. Thank you for making my birthday shine

author: Tiffany D.
stars:
Fog Harbor Fish House was the first place my husband and I ate when we arrived in San Fran. It was a late lunch and dinner basically. We decided to tour Pier 39 first and when we got here we were starving. It was the first place we came across that looked descent so we decided to dine here. The menu looked nice as well as the restaurant itself. We liked that you could view the Bay while eating. We were greeted by the hostess and had no wait. Our waiter was nice and asked us if we had any questions about the menu. Overall the staff was very nice and welcoming.

We first started with drinks. I ordered the Strawberry-Basil Nojito and he ordered the Maple Old Fashion. My drink was non-alcoholic. It was very good and fizzy and had the perfect blend of strawberry, mint and basil. Nothing was overpowering. Very good. My husband's drink was strong and he enjoyed it. Old Fashions are way to strong for me. 

Next we started with appetizers, side salads and bread. We decided to split a Calm Chowder Bread Bowl and we both ordered our own side salad. I ordered a Mix Green Salad and he ordered a Caesar Salad. I'm not a big fan of Clam Chowder but I'm willing to try most things. I honestly don't care for soup but Clam Chowder is just to creamy and weird for me. My husband was more so wanting to try this and being a team player I did. Now our salads were amazing. Yes they were simple but very good. My mixed Green Salad had the standard Balsamic Dressing but this dressing was thicker and a dark orange color. Very tasty. I didn't taste my husband's salad but he did mention that his salad was one of the best Caesars he has had in awhile so I take it that it was good. Lol. He's the one to order all the fattening (don't worry he works out and is skinny) stuff when we go out and I'm the one to make sure we get our greens. We ate all of this with their standard Sourdough Bread. It wasn't anything special, basic Sourdough. 

For our lunch/dinner I ordered the Pacific Sole and he ordered the Lobster Tail. My dinner came with a Spinach and Red Pepper mix with Fingerling Potatoes. My husband's meal came with Mashed Potatoes and Steamed Broccoli. My dish was AMAZING!! The fish was seasoned and cooked perfectly. The butter sauce was amazing as well and probably one of the better ones I have tasted. I personally don't liked sautéed spinach so this part wasn't my favorite. The only cooked spinach I like is creamed spinach. The red peppers added a nice touch to the fish. My only complaint about the dish is that the Potatoes could have used more seasoning or could have been crisped or something. They were just plain and put on the plate. I'm sure they were roasted but there was no crispness about them or flavor at all. My husband liked his Lobster Tail. I didn't try his lobster as I don't like the texture of lobster, but I did try his Mashed Potatoes. They were definitely a lot better than my potatoes and good. 

Overall, the Fog Harbor Fish House was a good place to eat. Decently priced food and drinks that are good.

author: D Z.
stars: This is a great restaurant in the tourist pier 39 area,  food was excellent and reasonably priced for the upscale nature of the place.  I got the clam chowder and it was above average as well as the entree.  As stated earlier, this is a tourist centered area, so don't expect any unique local flavors to the area.  It's a good place to take the fam if you are in the area, but not really a destination to seek out for a SF culinary experience.

author: Sharee I.
stars: Food was great, ambiance was popping. Right nestled off water downtown. We ordered the clams, baked oysters, amd salmon. Food was a little salty. Our waiter Jeremy was very attentive and made sure we understood menu

author: Chari J.
stars: Wonderful. Wonderful. WONDERFUL! If you are wanting delicious fish and crab, this is the place to go! My boyfriend and I came from out of town for the 49ers game. We both got cups of the Clam Chowder. Soooo good! He got the Mixed Grill entree and I got the Garlic Steamed Crab from the Dungeness Crab menu.  We both loved what we got! We will be back for sure!

author: Ashley W.
stars: Food and view were great! Service... As far as our waiter goes not so much but other servers were more responsive! I'm not a seafood eater, however, I decided to try their Crab Linguine but I substituted the crab for blackened Salmon. It was very good. My husband had the fried trio and said it was really good. He loved how fresh the shrimp was and was impressed by the amount of Calamari he got jn addition to his other food.

author: C G.
stars:
Nothing short of amazing at this iconic Pier 39 restaurant - incredible seafood and top shelf pleasant service. Whole steamed fresh dungenous crab with a side of al dente steamed broccoli and liquid butter, and soy ginger glazed wasabi aioli seared ahi over a bed of fragrant garlic sautéed Jasmine rice. We ended our lunch with the dessert duo of mini vanilla bean creme brûlée and chococlate infused dense rich mini lava cake coupled with fresh whipped cream and a stroke of real strawberry puree. Talk about gastronomical delights! Did I mention the fantastic view of Pier 39? Pure heaven!!

BTW - If you ever visit this place, make sure SUSAN serves your table. She was absolutely friendly and FIRST CLASS!

author: Irina G.
stars: A bit touristy but great views and the best clam chowder in the city! The warm sourdough bread they serve is worth it as well - I had one for dessert haha

author: Sophie L.
stars: Our first time eating at Fog Harbor Fish House. Whenever we visited San Francisco, we always ate at the Crab House. However this time we tried Fog Harbor and food was good. We ordered several entrees to tryout and I would say clam chowder was the best. Calamari was somewhat okay nothing special, oysters as well, I tried better oysters at other location. Service was good and overall good restaurant to visit if you are at Pier39.

author: Rebecca R.
stars: Delicious clam chowder bread bowl for a great price! We got seats at the bar at 4:15pm on a Saturday without waiting for a regular. Full service at the bar too, but happy hour is not over the weekend. Got the Fog Harbor lager which was okay, nothing special. Would recommend another beer over it. Overall, fast service, friendly staff, and delicious food so it was wonderful!

author: Cristal J.
stars:
We came 1-1-18 at about 630ish. We waited for about 20-30 min to be called on. Which isn't too bad. I don't like that we couldn't make reservations. But that's ok. The timing wasn't too bad. 
When we got seated our server what it seemed like didn't know a lot of English maybe? He didn't really communicate with us well. For example. I know we were suppose to get a bread bowl with butter and we didn't get it after we got our appetizer. The bread felt and smelled fresh so I'm assuming they had to put a loaf in. But our server should've of communicate that with us. 
The appetizers was very good. I order the crab ceviche. Not enough chips to eat it though. My friend got fried scallops and those were very good. 
I ordered the clam chowder bread bowl with extra crab and wow! Delicious which is why I'm giving the restaurant 3 stars. Because the food was very well cooked. 
When we would get refills only one of us got a refill per visit. And we would tell our sever who needed a refill but idk if he just can't multi task. Not sure. When we got a bread bowl refill we weren't given more butter.
The sever could probably use more training . But other than that it was a nice experience.

author: Elle S.
stars: Yummy, fresh seafood and friendly service.  Crowd pleaser selection of desserts comes on a tempting tray.   Curtiss is delightfully charming and gives a festive spirit to the whole table.  Clearly the best place in Pier 39.

author: Ricky L.
stars: Don't eat here this is a tourist trap, the view was great I loved it sat down, I ordered the whole garlic butter crab along with the add on garlic noodles. When the food came out they mixed the noodles all in with the crab as if a kid mixed his food together, you would think the grab and noodles would come separate but whatever no biggie I separated myself so the grab cake out very very dry with nothing under the head so basically just a decoration which you would think you would get something under there for the price you pay again whatever. The server then informed me hat she loves that dish so I tried a small portion of the noodles and flagged the waiter and told her it was bland it had no flavor so she I didn't have to pay. Moments later I tried the crab a small piece of leg and same result so I then flagged the server again and told her I had the same issue with the crab so she said she'll take it all back and get a menu so that I can pick something else, but when she left I got up grabbed my stuff and got out of there. I'm so surprised this place have 4 stars people taste buds are not properly coordinated or they're lying trust me avoid this place by all means you'll be happy you took my advice.

author: Ricky C.
stars: We had 3 restaurants to choose from and sadly, we picked this crap. All 4 of us felt the same. Should I return it? My linguini clam dish was sunk in a pool of oil. The clams were not smooth and juicy and they looked like burnt popcorn. My wife's fish and chips? A disappointment. She almost returned her fish. Of the 3 pcs you get she only ate one. The other two had a very doubtful dark grey color and so bad you could not separate the meat from the batter. As if it were one of the same. Gross. Very disappointed and sad for it was my decision to bring my family there and this place let me down. Will not recommend it to anyone.

author: Truman L.
stars: The clam chowder here was one of the best I have ever tasted; it has bacon in it (I'm not used to that, but it was sooooo good!). They also gave my friends and I complementary bibs that function just as well as capes as bibs. We also got biscotti for 'dessert' and although I did not try one myself, I heard they were good. It was slightly busy, but the wait was short since they had so many tables. The decoration and view of the sunset is superb. I would advise going here during the evening.

author: Lucy M.
stars: Best clam chowder in a sourdough bread bowl I've ever had. I literally dream of eating this again! The soup and salad combo was great - huge portion! Usually when you get soup and salad it barely fills you up but I couldn't even finish this. The sourdough rolls they serve while you wait are amazing as well. I would definitely recommend!

author: Tim F.
stars: First let me start by saying this place is a favorite of mine! I have had many staff wait on me and many different dishes however this is my FIRST review of it! I came today, Saturday probably the busiest day for them I'm guessing. I did not make a reservation For our group but I don't ever mind having a drinks with the bar first and then heading to a table, usually takes less thank 30. This staff is run around though! You can see how bustling it is when your waiting!!! We sat by a window this time which is always nice! The server we had today is hands down the best server I've had since coming here!!! Even though she was SO SO busy!! A lot of tables here don't speak English and they accommodate that well with photos (I bring clients here a lot in the day) however it can busy with everyone waving down your server. Our server Shawna was amazing! Girl never broke a smile the whole time!! Although I had been there my table guests had not so she went though the whole menu and how it's best to work it. We shared family style and everyone was impressed with every single thing!! Shawna had amazing attention to detail, always knew when we needed water, extra sauces, etc, also although it was so busy we didn't feel rushed at all! AMAZING SERVICE!!! Food was 10/10 only thing I would have changed was offering another ice cream flavor for dessert but alas one cannot have everything everywhere ! Ha! Thanks again for harbor and staff for a wonderful weekend meal! See you soon

author: Mistie O.
stars: Great drinks and food. Chowder is to die for and the service was great too! Great views of the pier and sea lions.

author: Sandeep C.
stars: Great views, great food and not touristy! My first worry was where it was located and it would be just another tourist trap. Nope, I was wrong. Absolutely spectacular view and the crab cakes were on point! I got the mixed seafood grill which was also amazing. The service was spectacular as well!

author: Cheryle L.
stars: My boyfriend and I were visiting for the long Labor Day weekend from San Diego and decided to make the Fog Harbor Fish House the first spot we ate at. The wait for our table took around 45 minutes which I think is pretty fair considering the restaurant's busy location. There are plenty of benches and chairs to sit and wait at which is awesome for my tired feet. My boyfriend and I were seated on the right side of the restaurant with a nice view of Alcatraz and the water. Lulu was our server who was very helpful in guiding us on what her recommendations were on the menu. We had the mussel fries as our appetizer, my boyfriend had the cioppino and I had the seared scallops with parmesan crab risotto. Lulu and the rest of the staff checked on our table often which was so nice. All of the dishes were packed with flavor! We were too full for dessert so we omitted from ordering but I mentioned that it was my boyfriend's birthday yesterday and Lulu brought him a delicious creme brûlée! We could not have been any more happier with our experience at the Fog Harbor Fish House. I recommend coming here with your significant other, family and friends and I hope you have Lulu as your server!

author: Eleonor T.
stars: Came here for my mother's 75th Birthday.  The food was absolutely fabulous. We ordered the fish and chips, whole crab, linguini w/ clams, surf and turf, scallops w/ polenta, Chopino,calamari, baked oysters, ahi tuna, and of course the clam chowder.  Everything was delicious.  The view was gorgeous and the staff was very friendly.  Will totally come back.

author: Gloria S.
stars: This place is soooo good! It overlooks the pier and is located on the second floor. We ordered the crab risotto with scallops and the roasted crab. Both were delicious and fresh! Prices are what you would expect for a place like this. They also have a kids menu which is a huge plus! I will definitely be coming back here again! Everyone loved the food.

author: Cassi C.
stars:
Food: delicious, very flavorful, and fresh. 

Service: our initial server Josh was beyond rude and unwelcoming. It created a very unwanted environment but luckily he left for the day and we were then taken care by JD. Very delicious restaurant but avoid Josh, beyond rude with attitude ( don't judge a book by its cover and especially not your guest who are also in the industry and we New he had profiled us because we were a younger couple).

author: Norm I.
stars: The food was very good but the service was not.  The waiter did not introduce himself and spoke to us minimally.  He only asked if we were ready to order and that's basically the extent of our interaction with him throughout the entire meal.  When he brought our meal he didn't say a single word which we thought odd.  Oh, he did ask us if we wanted dessert at the end but by then we were done with his attitude.  I would recommend the food but I can't say anything positive about the service we received.

author: Andrea S.
stars: I had the ahi poke and a Moscow mule (with gin). The service was good the poke was good (not a large portion but definitely satisfying). I give the food a 3.5 but the view and service bumps it up to a 4. It is in a touristy spot so a bit on the pricey side for what you get. I would still recommend it if you're looking for a bite to eat while at Pier 39.

author: diane d.
stars: wow this place surpassed my expectations! i've heard a lot of good things about this place so i decided to try it out for a late valentines day dinner. made reservations for 2 using yelp for friday night. i was hoping to sit by the window so i could get the full experience! and we did! we ordered a couple glasses of wine, a couple appetizers and our main courses. our waiter was super nice and informative! he made sure we knew the specials and was happy with our food. i got a glass of cline and it was pretty good! we ordered a bowl of chowder and the crab cakes!! OMG both was sooooo good. i wanted to eat my fair share since i split it with my bf but i didn't want to be too full to eat my entree. the crab cakes came with a little arugula salad which was paired so perfectly! for my entree, i got the crab and scallops risotto and my goodness, it was amazing!! every bite i had was FILLLLED with crab!! the scallops were big and delish! my bf had the special which had so much seafood (i think it was half a crab, some mussels, some shrimp, some clams and some scallops over a bed of linguini pasta) it looked and smelled so good! overall, i think they're fairly priced and will come back!

author: Jenny C.
stars:
We were enjoying the day at Pier 39 and wanted a nice lunch spot away that was a little quieter. First off, this place really does have the best view of the water. We were seated at a table right in front of the window and we could enjoy watching the hustle and bustle down below. The view is what is bumping up the rating of this place from a 3 star to a 4 star place because the service and food is average. Warm sourdough bread is complementary! I love restaurants that still offer bread service. This is a surprise these days with most places making you pay for bread and butter. 

We ordered the clam chowder in a sourdough bread bowl, the crab salad sandwich and half a dozen oysters. The oysters were fresh but the typical common variety so nothing special. The clam chowder actually had bits of clam in it and went really well with the bread. But next time I would just order the clam chowder without the bread bowl and save $2. They serve fresh sourdough for free which I found out after ordering. The filling in the crab salad was good as well but the fries left much to be desired. I wish they had the option of a salad or veggies with the sandwich because there's already a lot of bread so its certainly not a balanced meal.

Service was subpar. She was rushed, unfriendly and unable to answer my question when I asked her what variety of oysters were being served.

author: Mellie M.
stars: Outstanding service and food. We got lucky to sit right next to the sunset. I would definitely come back!

author: T N.
stars:
Excellent bartender, food is impeccable, great team happy staff very clean cordial environment. Very reasonable prices. Great place to bring the kids or come for a date.

Marc, the bar tender is great. Bring your bag of tricks you might get challenged an opportunity at free desert.

author: Pauly A.
stars: Love the food and service.  All the food was mind blowing!  Amazing scallops and crab risotto!  Best Cream  brûlée ever!

author: Michael N.
stars: Excellent addition to the desert. Great staff and service and food top notch . Very helpful to  educating us in Shabu Shabu

author: Amy W.
stars: We stopped for lunch there during my SFO trip, we all ordered the clam crowder as it says it's the award winning dish, but I don't enjoy the meal too much as I felt nothing so special about the taste. Kind of disappointed because we all thought it will be sooo good.

author: Sean C.
stars: At famous Pier 39 on the upper deck, it very much delivers on upscale seafood preparation with certain niche offerings (Salmon BLT, anyone? Crab Sandwich that's shredded crab, how 'bout that?). Their chowder bowls are incredible. World class wine and beer selection to pair up with, I dunno, anything. The waiting area is nice. The glass views of the bay are nice, if not, marvelous. The drawback is that it's crowded for a reason, but that doesn't mean you can't find a great table on a late afternoon, a Thursday or a rainy day. Sophisticated eating at Pier 39? "Fog Harbor," with seafood right out of the local harbor markets, they got you covered. #classiceats

author: Mandy T.
stars:
Tourist trap, as expected. On the 2nd level of Pier 39 complex, hubby was getting hangry and refused to walk anywhere else for food. We settled in here as they had good reviews, has a view over the sea lions beaching at the pier, the interior looked clean and well put together, and they offered crayons and coloring sheets to entertain the little one. 

Started off promising. The waitstaff were all professional. We got complimentary blue cheese garlic bread using one of the coupons in the Pier 39 Fun Pack. The appetizer was huge!  It tasted alright.  But our entrees did not fair well. We got the Fried Combo that was basically fish and chips with fried shrimp and calamari - since we were by the pier, we thought this would be a safe bet to get good seafood. It wasn't. The batter on the fish wasn't crispy enough and the entire dish lacked seasoning.  For $23, it was not memorable and overpriced.  I was craving a burger so we also got the Fog Harbor Burger - sounded good on paper but the burger itself was actually quite dry and hard to swallow. Taste-wise, it was bland (no memorable sauce to improve the taste) and rather boring. A very basic burger for $15. 

So overall, overpriced and unmemorable food serving mostly tourists, but does provide a view, comfortable seating and good service.

author: Andrew K.
stars:
Extremely rude hosts. Like almost comically so. We had an OpenTable reservation and 2 of us were on time. One was parking. It was 5:15 pm on a weekday. Place was empty. They were extremely rude and said their policy doesn't allow you to seat parties, and basically threatened me to beckon the manager (which I accepted). Just not a good vibe. I used to like this place, a lot, (per the earlier review), but now starting with a bad taste.

Edit - we let the manager know and he was very kind and accommodating. Food was delicious. I would try again.

author: Michelle H.
stars: I highly recommend coming here at opening. You'll have a higher chance of getting a window seat and getting a great view of the harbor and the pier. The Ahi Tuna was delicious and grilled  shrimp entree. The restaurant also serves complimentary warm sourdough bread. They also serve delicious freshly squeezed orange juice and lemonade. They also have a great selection of desserts. The service was also amazing. The restaurant is clean and romantic.

author: Riz K.
stars:
Came here for dinner on a Monday evening with a party of two the atmosphere is beautiful with a wonderful view of the marina they started us off with what is famous in San Francisco sourdough bread I then ordered the roasted garlic crab for my entree 

Coming here for the first time by fluke I did not know what to expect from the food .... first was the sourdough bread which came in roll form and was baked in house it was great had good crunch on the exterior and a wonderful sourdough flavor on the interior I enjoyed this so much I asked for seconds which they complied soon later came the crab which just from a presentation stand point was amazing it was served with green beens and I opted for fries instead of fingerling potatoes the crab was amazing but what was really great was the roasted garlic butter I'm not sure exactly everything that was in it however they did mention it was made in house they pour all this over the crab and the green beans it has lots of garlic it definitely had some salt and some crispy elements as well(this is not your ordinary garlic butter) I asked for some extra on the side and again they complied as for the crab itself it tastes fresh and was a good size my dining companion ordered the cod i did not taste enough of it to include it in the review however I will attach a picture 

Overall I was happy with my dining experience the food, atmosphere, and the service were all  great

author: Justine A.
stars:
Exceptional service provided by Curtiss! Warm, friendly and inviting, his skills left us very impressed.  Food was phenomenal.   
I had ordered an entree from the Spring Special. Curtiss's recommendations convinced us to engage on our opportunity to opt for crab dishes since they were in season.  
My boyfriend ordered the Halibut, and let me tell you-- the flavors melted into your mouth.  It Paired very well with the arugula salad topped balsamic vinegar. The dressing added a crisp cut of flavor.
I ordered the scallops with the crab and garlic risotto. Comforting flavors that provide for a hearty meal. I LOVED IT.  I'm not an avid seafood eater, but after eating this dish has left me wanting to explore the depths of seafood cuisine. 

Big Thank you to Curtiss for providing wonderful service, it was a pleasure to have you as our server. And as for the restaurant, props to you Fog Harbor!

author: Shanna M.
stars: What a great experience! We chose to eat at Fog Harbor on our last night in San Fran and I'm so glad we did. It's a massive and very busy restaurant, so MAKE A RESERVATION. The hostess quickly got us to our reserved table, by the window with the view of the sunset. Our waiter was awesome, quick, friendly, and she even gave me a quick lesson on how to crack my crab open! The food was AMAZING. We shared the clam chowder to start and we both loved it. It had big chunks of clam, no whimpy pieces. For dinner I had the whole garlic Dungeness crab and it came with potatoes and veggies. My husband had the mixed grill plate, there wasn't a morsel of food left. No dessert, we couldn't fit anything else in our bellies. I now see why Fog Harbor is a staple in SF. Highly recommend to anyone reading this review!!!

author: Misty W.
stars: The view is excellent. You can see seals, Alcatraz and the Golden Gate Bridge. Our service was relaxed ... maybe too much. The food was good for a touristy type restaurant. There wasn't anything I would complain about but nothing that I would rave about. Overall, the view was worth it.

author: Mason And Scarlett F.
stars: Visiting from Los Angeles and we didn't know what spots were good so we tried the clam chowder and it was the BEST and I mean THE BEST clam chowder we kept talking about it all day and planned to go back but ran out of time but for sure going back twice next time we go. I really recommend this place felt welcomed and everything was clean and our waiter was wonderful making sure we had everything we needed.

author: Morgan-Anne D.
stars: definitely stop by if you're in the mood for a nicer meal. great selection of drinks, bread and butter offered. i got the 2 lobster tails with garlic mash and veggies. amazing. boyfriend got the lazy cioppino which he promptly inhaled. great service, great food and a great view of the water.

author: Hai L.
stars: It's hard deciding on a place to eat when you're at pier 39. There are so many opportunities and places to check out. After a lot of searching, decided to check out this place based on a large amount of positive reviews. This is an institution that serves fresh seafood and gives off a scenic view of the Pier. The dining experience and views of the Bay Area and Golden Gate Bridge attracts visitors and tourists to visit this restaurant at least once. There appeared to be a half hour wait due to how busy it was. Not a problem. The wait seemed to go by immediately and suddenly we were already inside the restaurant. Fog harbor is said to serve 100% sustainable seafood which could be a bias to anyone who hasn't tried it. The menu offers a great selection of food. Customers get to enjoy complimentary sourdough bread that is baked in house. To start off with the appetizer, we decided to go with a dozen baked oysters that consists of spinach, bacon, and creamy Parmesan sauce. These oysters were incredible. It felt like they popped right in your mouth and had so much flavor. I decided to also get the award winning clam chowder bread bowl! This was amazing as well. For the entree, I decided to go with the mixed grill platter that is made with grilled salmon, pacific cod, and shrimp, citrus beurre blanc, sautéed vegetables and garlic mashed potatoes. Food was prepared instantly and did not take long to bring out. The waiter was really friendly but did not bring out water drinks immediately to begin with. Had to give him a reminder. No problem. For a beverage, I also went with the 8 oz flint and steel Sauvignon that was recommended by the waiter. This wine pairs well with fish and had a stronger taste. I would give this restaurant 5 stars based on the food. Price is a bit on the more expensive side but you get what you pay for. Amazing views depending on where you are seated along with fresh seafood right near the pier. Definitely would go again!

author: Tisha A.
stars: Had a great meal and nice view. My daughter enjoyed her 21st birthday dinner and cocktails at the Fog Harbor Fish House.

author: Aaron D.
stars:
Beautiful spot despite being smack in the middle of the tourist hole - Pier 39. There is a wait time but was bareable considering it's a saturday. 
Ordered the summer special: scallop risotto, shelllfish platter made with garlic herb butter sauce w/ add on lobster tail, and their famous clam chowder w/ crab add-on.

4 of 5: Great food, regret the lobster tail, and clam chowder should only be ordered with the crab addon! To die for! 

You can feel your blood pressure rising from the taste of fresh ocean.

author: J D.
stars:
Great cioppino but Anchor Oyster Bar is a bit bigger and better. Apple crumble was good too but not exceptional.

Update: Yes I'll be back. It was good enough to go back. I recently went to Sotto Mare and based on reviews was expecting it to be really good but it wasn't - it was huge but not good and was missing clams and mussels :(. Fog Harbor definitely better.

author: T. M.
stars: The View is indeed spectacular. We had a great view of the sunset while waiting for our meal to come for 2 hours. Our waiter ruined the experience for us. We sat down and placed our order around 6pm. Got our soup and salad 15 minutes later. Waited another hour, still no sign of our entrees. The waiter comes back one time and says the entrees are on the way. Another 20 mins later, he decides to really check to see whats taking so long only to realize that he did not place the order for us correctly in the system. So waited another 30 mins for them to cook our entrees. Customers that came in after us ate and left while we are still waiting for our meal. Shame on our waiter for not noticing that we were waiting this long and not checking in on us. And the only thing we got out of it is a free desert! Our time is valuable because we are on vacation and should not have been wasted like this.

author: Nixxie P.
stars:
The wait was worth it! We had no reservations and was told the wait would be an hour so we waiting in their seating area which was nice because there was a fireplace and it was quiet chilly outside. 

I am so happy we waited ! The food was delicious ! It was served so quickly ! & the staff are all so friendly! I can't wait to eat here again, I really enjoyed my dinner! 

I believe our waitress was anya ?(from what I can remember, sorry if this is wrong!) she was amazing ! Thank you so much !!

author: Phaelyn R.
stars: Amaazing seafood - We ordered the Mixed Grilled platter and the crab entree :) it was so delicious, service was great and view was nice.

author: Stan J.
stars:
The service was really good. And the food came really quickly and it was so good.. Im definetly coming back when I'm in San francisco. Also the view is beautiful.
Highly recommended.

author: Arlene P.
stars: Our favorite restaurant to go to in San Francisco. The food is great and the prices are reasonable. Shout out to Nicholas our waiter for excellent service. Ken and Juan Carlos were also so attentive and made sure our dining experience is nothing but the best. Thank you Fog Harbor for the special service. We plan to visit you again soon.

author: Leila V.
stars:
VIEWS! Seriously. Make sure you come here and sit at a window seat to take in the bay views from the pier -- big boats, golden gate bridge in the distance and Alcatraz. Right on Pier 39 this place is not to miss. 

I ordered the Grilled shrimp brochette which came plated beautifully with tasty sautéed spinach, roasted butternut squash, garlic mashed potatoes, and garlic butter. The dish was flavorful, healthy, delicious and not overly filling!

The service was 5/5. Views are 5/5 and Food was 5/5. The extra San Fran taxes were surprising coming from out of state, but totally worth it!

author: Su Q.
stars: Omg this place is super cute along the pier... the staff was very friendly and nice... you much try their clam chowder with the extra clam meat... it's was bomb!!!!!!!!

author: Alina P.
stars:
Let's just say this place was a dream ! Starting from the grand view going down to the bread and butter . 
My husband and I were seated at a window seat . We had a great waiter which made us feel really welcomed.  
The food was amazing , rich and flavorful. 
The overall experience was epic . Definitely recommend others to try this place when in San Francisco.

author: Tara M.
stars: Was vacationing near Fisherman's Wharf and wanted to have fish and chips for dinner. We selected Fog Harbor after looking at reviews, location, and menu. We were impressed by the view of the Bay from our table, the cleanliness of the restaurant, and the service. We started with the crab cakes with buerre blanc sauce and mango salsa. They were perfectly crispy and the mango salsa really complimented the sweet crap. Did not taste "fishy" at all. I ordered the shrimp and chips- came with 8 huge butterflied, panko crusted shrimp, fries, and a coleslaw with a horseradish kick. It was all very tasty and prepared well. My husband ordered the fried combo with fish, shrimp, and calamari. It all was great, crispy, fresh. Again nothing "fishy" tasting. We ended the meal with creme brûlée. Nothing new here- it's a popular,common dessert...but it tasted great. So many seafood restaurants in this area to choose from but this one was one of the better ones.

author: Adriana E.
stars: The food was great and the seafood was fresh! We ordered the clam chowder, the cracked crab, the mix grill, and the steak (which was pretty good). The only complaint I have is that our waiter was not particularly attentive but I think he was new.

author: Lily C.
stars: Great food,  great service,  excellent kids menu.   we. Ordered a light lunch - their famous clam chowder, crab cakes, grilled fish kids meal and grilled shrimp kids meal. Everything tasted great - not oversalted to make to for lack of flavor. We appreciated the fact the there were healthy options on the kids menu in addition to the usual suspects.  Clam chowder was indeed one of the best we've ever tried.  Will be back when we're in town again

author: Lisa R.
stars: Delicious is an understatement! Visiting from the L.A area and doing the touristy things we decided to eat here after a bay boat tour. So glad picked this place! I took the recommendation of our server and ordered the crab & scallop risotto.. omg! I didn't want my meal to end. It was SO good.. my significant other had the Scioppino & he enjoyed his meal very much as well. As a starter we ordered the ceviche. It comes deconstruction but it was so good. Don't let the coconut milk deter you from ordering you won't be disappointed. And Creme brulee for dessert did not disappoint either. Can't wait to come back and enjoy another delicious meal. Thank you Adela for for kind service and great recommendation!

author: Jenny N.
stars:
I came here a little before noon and it wasn't too crowded considering it was a Monday after all. 

S E R V I C E 
We were immediately sat down when we walked up to the podium. I can't recall if my server had mentioned her name or not. The service was pretty good I have to say. They were really attentive and patient with me when I couldn't decide what I want to eat yet. 

They validate parking garage tickets for an hour :) that's $9 !! Hehe. 


F O O D ! ! 

Clam chowder (5/5) 
I have read some of the reviews and people say the clam chowder is the best. It was Good but I can't say it's the best I ever had. I honestly haven't tasted THE best yet. So I'm still looking. However, this one IS pretty good. Some places are very stingy with their clams. Not here though. They gave a pretty decent amount of clams in their soup. I'd still give it a 5/5 :) cause it was good. Not too salty , which is great.

Baked Oysters (5/5) 
The best baked oysters I've had in a LONG time ! That cheese ricotta-like on the oyster was so yummy. I'm not sure what kind of cheese they used but I'm guessing it's ricotta . I didn't read the menu for it lol. I just saw baked oysters and I had to try It. They're small oysters, so it's super yummy hehe. I recommend trying it. 

Seared Tuna- 2/5 
This entre was too salty. Not the tuna, but the veggies and the sauce it was cooked in was too salty and very overwhelminThe garlic mash potato was pretty average. The fish was okay too. I wasn't a really big fan of this dish, so I was kinda disappointed.

author: Dana B.
stars: This food was amazing!  Would definitely come back for the service and the cuisine.  I had the seafood penne and requested scallops be added - not only did they ad it, but they were cooked to perfection.

author: Brenda C.
stars: The dim light ambiance was nice It's not a bad restaurant like the Hard Rock but its definitely typical for the pier like the pier market and the Franciscan I ordered their Cioppino it tasted good but I wasn't taken away by it the Crab House still has my heart it's my favorite pier 39 restaurant

author: Melissa N.
stars: We went on our first night in San Francisco. The service was excellent and the food was good. Only complaint was the coleslaw had very little flavor but with the abundance of food it wasn't an issue.

author: Larry Z.
stars: Food / service were excellent !! Atmosphere was very good as well. Highly recommend clam chowder !!

author: Jack R.
stars:
I feel rich. Like lottery winning rich.

I won a $100 gift certificate here, and I went all out when it came to ordering food.

But don't worry, I'm not that selfish. I like to share the wealth, so I invited my friends and paid the difference.

Here's what we had and our thoughts.

Clam chowder: Great, creamy, clam-y. Everyone loved their clam chowder. The ones with the bread bowl loved the bread too.

Caesar salad: Huge portion, good dressing, not overly great, just okay.

Baked oysters: These tasted a bit raw even though they were supposed to be baked. Even the cheese on top was cold. But this is where the service shined. Our waiter was always checking up on us, and we even had service from the District Manager Neusom, who came over and checked on us as well. When we told him about the oysters, he struck it from the bill immediately.

Large Shrimp Cocktail: Delicious, and lived up to it's name. They were large. So good we couldn't stop ordering and eating these. 

Crab cakes: Excellent flavor. More crab meat than breading, great texture. We ordered several of them because we liked them so much.

Chippino: Huge,and filled with things you would find under the sea. Clams, crab, salmon, I mean this thing was a cauldron of goodness.

I want to say that our waiter was exceptional and was always there to fill up water, and even bagged up fresh sourdough for one of my friends who wanted to take some bread home.

Being that this is a tourist spot, I highly recommend it for tourists who may be overwhelmed with all the choices on the Pier.

Even as a local, I can say, I'll definitely be back.

author: Dan N.
stars: Definitely one of the touristy restaurants on the Pier and Fishermans Wharf but still a good restaurant experience. I ordered a chowder bread bowl, oysters, and some gumbo, and they were all pretty good. The oysters were fresh and delicious, and the gumbo was thick and savory. The server we had was very friendly as well and took nice photos for us. They also saw us without reservations and it was an overall good and convenient last minute find.

author: Joi R.
stars:
Whenever I'm in SF I have to come to Fog Harbor. This is one of my absolute favorite restaurants. The seafood is always fresh, and the overall dining experience is amazing. Regardless of the wait time, you have to sit by the window and enjoy the waterfront. 
On my last visit, I ordered the Crab Louis salad, it was loaded with fresh crab, and too big to finish...Loved It!
They offer an extensive wine selection, and the cocktails are pretty impressive as well (Moscow Mule with extra lime). 
Be prepared to indulge and enjoy when you come here.

010/100. Yelp Challenge.(2016)

author: Therese N.
stars: We waited twenty minutes for a table and were placed near a window seat with a wonderful view.  Our server, Shawna promptly took our order and brought us warm sour dough bread along with butter. The bread tided us over till our lunch came. We had fish and chips that were golden brown and tasty. However, it was served with a zesty coleslaw that I didn't care for. Regarding our server, she went the extra mile to make sure we had enough after lunch cookies for our trip home.

author: Linda M.
stars: Very nice place. Superior clam chowder with fresh crab on top. Husband had beautiful scallop risotto. Our friends had a crab salad( enough for a family of 6) and our non seafood friend enjoyed the steak dinner. All served in fine style. Our host, Lulu, was friendly, charming and helpful. A wonderful dining experience on Fisherman's wharf. Started dinner with Dark and Stormy cocktails.

author: Kelvin L.
stars:
Wish I could give this place a zero star.

1) Got here with a reservation, ended up waiting an additional 15 minutes which is the least of my complaints 

2) Asked the waiter if the oysters were good on that night, he said they were "very good". To keep it short and simple, the oysters we're not prepared well. Salty like it was never rinsed or cleaned out. Oysters were TINY. No flavor other than sea water. Not good to the pallet. Had small shell bits inside. 

3) Ordered a $7.50 non alcoholic berry drink. You would think they would put a little more effort for that price point. Basically a flat Sprite with some dried blackberries. I'd much rather drink a can of sprite had I known any better.

4) Asked the waiter for parking validation. He said be right back with it and came back with the bill - no validation. I ended up having to ask another and he got for me just before I got up to leave. My original waiter comes back and drops a second validation on my table and walks off as he probably saw my 12% tip ( which I felt thoroughly justified for the lack of presence and honesty about the food).

5) Here's the kicker. CHECK YOUR BANK STATEMENTS. I clearly wrote $130 on the $117 tab, giving them a $13 tip which I was even reluctant to give in the first place. What do they do? Charge me $140. This is theft. I clearly, in big and clear numbers wrote $130. And no, this is not about $10. It's about the integrity of this restaurant. So naturally, I called in, and the host said he would check and call me back right away. No call. I called in 6 hours later, same host picked up. Explained to him the situation once again, he put me on hold, and then hung up on me. Never called me back again. This place is a sham. Check your bank statements. Especially if you tip them less that the 18%, they will pull a fast one. I'm sure I'm not the first and definitely won't be the last. Contacted my bank and will file a dispute.

author: Ruby C.
stars: Recommended by one of my friends and Fog Harbor didn't disappoint. Food and service were excellent! Our server was very nice and thoughtful. Will definitely go back here on our next SFO trip!

author: Siosiua T.
stars:
Best Chowder I've had! 

Ordered the the Pacific Sole and wife ordered the Shellfish Tower for dinner. Lots and lots of seafood. Fresh as well. 

Will be back!

author: Elizabeth H.
stars: Setting was great. I had a shellfish tower and a New York steak. Everything was amazing. My bother had a mix grill and he loved it. Everything was amazing. I  was so satisfied with the presentation and the flavor. Unfortunately I wasn't able to get the deserts because I was to full. But I would definitely go back for it next time. I wish I remember my waitress name. She was a great and patient to take my orders.

author: Danae L.
stars:
Bf and I came around 7pm and were seated towards the entrance right away. It was really windy so asked to be seated towards the inside. The host immediately told us there's a wait to sit inside. Well shouldn't you have given us the option of waiting to sit inside? The estimated waiting time for the Inside was 10 minutes, but we were seated in less than 2.

We shared the shellfish platter, chicken penne, and calamari.

I really enjoyed the calamari! It wasn't oily compared to other restaurants and had a nice crunch.

The chicken from the pasta was slightly plain and dry.

The shellfish putter comes with half a dozen of oysters, 0.5lb of crab, half a pound of lobsters, and shrimp. Average quality. My one complaint is they didn't offer sauce that wasn't spicy. Oysters were a bit small.

Overall they exceed my expectations given that I wasn't preparing myself for a five-star treatment. What I come again? Maybe next year.

author: Michelle R.
stars:
Pros: 
Incredible views off pier 39 
Great drinks (get the Alcatraz escape or hibiscus Margarita!) 
Fresh sourdough bread starter 
Attentive staff
Free birthday dessert 

Cons: 
Honestly we were all a little underwhelmed by our meals. Granted I got the steak in a fish house!! Just kind of blah and didn't care for the sauce or the bland broccoli side.

author: Jeanette G.
stars:
Best clam chowder ever! Lots of clams, thick, hearty... satisfying!
Oysters were by far the BEST! Our server, JD, took care of us with our 3 month old. He was so understanding and thoughtful! Thanks, JD, you're the bomb!!
The bread was fantastic!

author: Olivia T.
stars: Clam chowder was amazing, probably the best I've had in a while. Our server Shakura was awesome and very sweet, we're from out of town and we enjoyed that she took the time to have a little conversation with us. If we come back to SF, this is definitely on our list again!

author: Chelsea W.
stars: The food here is pretty decently priced; however, the service can be rather slow, as well as the speed your food comes out. Our orders seemed to come out wrong a couple times -- or our server was just jotting down the wrong order. We received only half a dozen oysters when we had asked for a dozen.. and were given our clam chowder in a bowl when I had asked for a bread bowl. All fixable mistakes, however, so no real harm done. The ambiance indoors is rather nice though, for anywhere else to dine at in the area. It's not too "touristy" seeming, and there's a lovely view if you are lucky enough to dine by the window.

author: Thanawan L.
stars: This was my second time here. This place never made me disappointed. I love this place great service, great seafood,great view. Thanks to ''Jane'' who taking care of us. she was my waitress. She so nice and checked back us all the time. I always enjoyed every items in the menu. Especially, ''Chioppino''. It's my favorite food. I highly recommend this restaurant for people who love the seafood. I definitely come back next time.

author: J T.
stars:
Went back again. This is our yearly trip to San Francisco and  we always go to this restaurant. Great ambience, great view and good service

The clam chowder is amazing. There's just not enough in that bread bowl. I recommend getting an extra cup to put inside your bread bowl for sharing. We got the steam clams, roasted crab, fish and chips and wedge salad. All very tasty. I wish I New our server name. But he was friendly and very attentive. Thanks for a great experience we will be back again!

author: Jasson C.
stars: Views were great and atmosphere was amazing for a Saturday lunch. Food was reasonable priced for the location and the service was quick and responsive. The food my wife and I had was fried calamari, clam chowder (awarded best in SF) and a salmon sandwich. All three dishes had different and unique flavors and recommended that you should try when you are in town.

author: Julie F.
stars: On our vacation, my friends and I decided to try this restaurant due to the high rating. We were not disappointed . Even though it was pricey, it was worth it! The food was phenomenal .

author: Joy W.
stars:
From afar, Fog Harbor Fish House always looked like any other Pier 39 seafood restaurant to me. Upon closer inspection, it's actually very nice. The waiting area outside is a tiled patio with couches, a fireplace, and a painting above the fireplace, so it feels more like a cozy outdoor living room. 
They take reservations on Opentable, which is probably a good idea for a tourist-heavy location.
The menu includes a variety of seafood dishes and quite a few fried items. For a seafood restaurant, there is a good amount of land dishes for those who don't eat seafood. We had a cozy table by the window and enjoyed the waterfront view during dinner.

Crispy Bay Scallops ($13) - panko breaded & fried, w/ roasted jalapeno aioli:
I was hoping the scallops would have a light crunchy panko crust, but the tiny bite-sized bay scallops were completely coated in breading and unrecognizable as scallops. It was my mistake. I should have guessed panko breaded meant covered in panko. It was too much breading and a little too oily for me to enjoy them as scallops. If I knew they would have that much breading, I wouldn't have ordered this dish. It's not bad for a deep-fried snack. The thick, heavy jalapeno aioli added a little bit of a kick.

Shellfish Platter ($38 for 1, $59 for 2) - 1/2 crab, mussels, clams, shrimp, oven roasted w/ butter, garlic, herbs:
The shellfish massacre presented in front of us was seasoned nicely and tasted quite fresh. The crab legs were sweet and meaty. The mussels and clams were nice and springy. The shrimp at the bottom of the plate soaked up all the buttery juices and herbs. It also came with some corn on the cob and garlic toast. 

Bread Pudding ($8.50) - topped w/ vanilla ice cream, vanilla bean sauce, dusted with cocoa powder:
Dinner was a little salty, so I wanted something sweet. I'm fond of bread pudding, so that was an easy choice. It was served warm and gooey and the edges were a little crispy.

While we ate, we enjoyed watching the sunset over the water. It made for a nice meal. If I come back, I'd probably try the cioppino next.

author: Giovanni S.
stars: Amazing Amazing!!! Best Restaurant On The Pier When It Comes To Sophistication And Great Customers Service.... Carlos & Jose Were Super Attentive And Made Sure Everything Was Perfect.... I Had The New York Steak And I Must Say  Best Steak I've Ever Had..... Will Come Back Again!!

author: Bruce Y.
stars: Great location - excellent service by Jose. Reservations a must - went after Alcatraz night tour.  Modern with great views. Mussels Frites is the menu item to get. British Columbia mussels served, which are plumper and far superior to east coast variety...

author: Jessica H.
stars:
This is the place to eat seafood at Pier 39! The prices are decent and the portions are plentiful! Two people ate the 2-person shellfish platter, had 2 drinks, and an appetizer for $98. While this is pricy, it is cheaper than any other seafood restaurants on the pier and the food is delicious!!!!

I ordered the Lombard Lemonade (yum) and for $10.95 is was pretty large. The shellfish platter was huge--we couldn't eat it all!

author: Ty C.
stars: Amazing views and great service. Bloody Mary was on point. Our waiter Nick was great. Ordered the claim chowder in the sourdough bread bowl with crab...

author: Fabiana P.
stars: If you are in San Francisco you should stop in this Restaurant at pier 39. We have some appetizers and drinks outside where you have a cozy set up with a fire place. Everyone is very friendly, we really enjoyed and my dogs too!

author: Ashleigh F.
stars: Jamie is the best server ever! We asked for a great view for our one year anniversary and not only did this place accommodate our request for a great view, but Jamie gave us a fantastic experience. We are so thankful for our interactions with Jamie and when we come back (from the east coast) we will request Jamie again!

author: Maria M.
stars: I love the spicy shrimp app and the filet mignon for entree. The service is always great this is my go to restaurant when I go to the city. The ambiance here is amazing servers always very helpful

author: Head Chef F.
stars: This place is a bit overrated although the quality of food is decent, none of the seafood taste exceptionally fresh for being on the Pier.. Nice View , Service was OK, overpriced..

author: Mari F.
stars: Food was delicious and the service as great. Same goes for the drinks.. both the alcoholic and non-alcoholic ones were so yummy and pretty. The seating can get a bit tight, but nothing terrible.

author: M D.
stars: We were visiting San Francisco for a short trip, but I knew I had to stop for a clam chowder while in town and this place did not disappoint! We ordered the cup of soup and another meal, but I wished we had stuck with ordering bread bowls and skipped the meal. The bread the bring ahead of time was warm and doughy sour dough. It was perfect and paired nicely with the chowder. I could eat both the bread and soup every day! Update: We went back a few days later for more bread and chowder! Seriously, that bread is mouthwatering!

author: Janet L.
stars: We had a really nice dinner here for my dad's bday, excellent service, food.

author: Francisco C.
stars:
Second time here! Brilliant, good for parties of two or three or more. Wait time is average (noting it is New Years Eve), but the customer service certainly did not suffer. 

Will definitely be back for such the occasion.

author: Jovi D.
stars:
Um, hello? Clam chowder topped with a generous amount of crab meat? Count me ALL THE WAY in!

Fog Harbor Fish House is conveniently located right in the front of Pier 39 on the second floor above a souvenir shop. The place itself is very upscale looking on the inside and I know I felt a bit underdressed walking in. But who cares, it's located in the heart of a touristy area.

We were seated for a party of 4 right away. We had an awesome view of the water. Our waiter was a gentleman name Tyler who went above and beyond his job description. Very cool dude.

We ordered: clam chowder, calamari, fish and chips, and jumbo shrimp cocktail.

Everything we had was exceptional. There was not one thing that we ordered that my friends and I didn't enjoy. I wish we had room for dessert! 

Best believe I am definitely coming back to Fog Harbor! I can't get enough of their clam chowder! I want to try so many other things!

author: Mike B.
stars: In a place that is known for strong tourist presence, this is still a gem. All the food is fresh and portions are good size. Been her multiple times and they have never disappointed.

author: Jeannie L.
stars:
Hey, this place is in a tourist trap! Yes, why yes, it is... but it was actually pretty good. I begrudgingly came here per a friend's request thinking exactly this, it's a tourist trap... I mean, it lives at Pier 39! 

We tried their clam chowder bread bowl. I say we but it was really my friend. I had a spoonful of the chowder and thought it was pretty basic but good. I think I just personally prefer a creamier chowder. The waitress did say that it was the clam chowder bowl WITH the topping of crab that was the award winner, which makes sense. Who doesn't like crab on top of anything? 

I ordered their Ciopinno and I was pleasantly surprised. They didn't skimp on the seafood. The bowl was filled with different times of seafood, shrimp, scallops, fish, crab, etc. It was hearty and the broth was delicious. They also included some garlic bread to dip into it. 

I mean the prices here are touristy prices, but given that the seafood tasted super fresh, I can ignore that. I mean you are, after all, at Pier 39!

author: Carinna L.
stars: We were excited to try out this local joint as Seattle locals visiting from out of town. For the price, location, and food selection we had decent expectations. We started with alcoholic beverages which were decent, but didn't taste like much alcohol was in them. We ordered appetizers of Calamari and Clam Chowder which was quite delicious. No complaints there. However, our entrees came out and that's when our experience took a nosedive. The table ordered the recommended dishes such as the Seafood Penne and the Fish and Chips. The battered fish was bland and tasteless, and the Seafood Penne Pasta left more to be desired. The sauce was so thin it slid right off the pasta leaving a plain noodle. The service was awful, and I'm pretty sure the server was high the entire time. I expected a lot more from a nicer restaurant and wish we had chosen a different place.

author: Jocelyn P.
stars:
Things I liked about our visit to this place last Friday. 
1.  The ambiance -- it was nice. We were seated on the upper level. We had a beautiful view of the bay. 
2.  The food -- I had the combination platter (1/2 crab, shrimp, mussels and clams).  It was delicious! It was cooked well. Very flavorful. My husband had the crab cocktail. The kids had something from the kids' menu. Lol
3.  The server -- Mel was very friendly. Accommodated our requests. We had our 3 kids with us. He was patient and kind.  Very knowledgeable. 

We will definitely come back again!

author: H. Bill R.
stars: All of my followers know I love good food. I'm a bit of a foodie. While visiting in San Francisco, my wife and I had a yearning for some great seafood. San Francisco is noted for its great seafood restaurants. We were not disappointed at all. The Dungeoness crab with garlic was awesome. This has to be the best clam chowder I have ever had; not too salty, just simply fantastic. Their clam chowder had no grains of sand in it. It was perfectly prepared. Simply amazing, and it is an award-winning restaurant. Enough said, I highly recommend this place.

author: Shayla S.
stars: Everything was great! So glad we decided to stop in during our short time in San Francisco.

author: Shirlene U.
stars: We had a delicious dinner at the Fog Harbor Fish House on our first night in San Francisco. It can get very crowded however. We had a wonderful view of the bay and the boats. Mel was our server and he was fantastic! He was so friendly and made our dinner even more enjoyable.

author: LauraMay N.
stars:
I was a bit worried since some people said this place was a tourist trap on here, but it turned out to be wonderful! 

The boy and I came here for an anniversary dinner since we were craving seafood. We made a reservation a few days in advance, hoping and requesting a nice seat. We came 20 minutes early, and we were seated just in time! Next to a window with a view of the bay too! Someone had also wrote "Happy Anniversary!" on our table. :) 

For starters, we ordered the clam chowder and fried scallops. I ordered the shellfish platter for one with a lobster tail for my entree, and the boy ordered the surf and turf. Everything was perfect! You could tell the seafood was fresh and the boy was also happy with the quality and cooking of the steak. We loved everything that we ordered, and also enjoyed a yummy creme brûlée. 

We were in awe of the meal we had. Not to mention, the sour dough was the best we ever had! We couldn't stop raving about it. We also have to thank our server Justin H. for being so awesome and kind. We asked to take our leftover bread to go, and he came back with more fresh sour dough to take home!

author: Monda W.
stars: Breathtaking views, mouthwatering food. I've visited twice this week. The first time I got the shrimp brochette, with garlic mashed potatoes, spinach and butternut squash. To die for.  Tonight I got the crab and scallop risotto with a lovely house salad, and the next hot homemade sourdough bread in the world! Breanna took great care of my colleague and I. Not enough room for dessert, but we will be back! Bravo, Fog Harbor!

author: Jasmere C.
stars:
This review is for Michael K. -Our server from
Last night! We had a huge party of 8, was very welcoming, kind and understanding! Would come back just for his service! He also sung happy birthday!!! Which was soooo nice. The owner or manager on duty was very accommodating as well.

author: Jim B.
stars:
Just flew in from Atlanta with my wife today and we were craving seafood. We heard very positive comments about Fog Harbor and we loved it!
Great food and Curtis was an exceptional with providing recommendations and service!
Highly recommend this place!
Thanks

author: Krystal M.
stars: Service was OK. I kind of wish we tried the fish and chips down stairs. The clam chowder was just like Panera. Nothing really over the top here. Dessert tray looked old and dirty. The oysters were not worth it. Could have had better service for the place.

author: Sheila C.
stars:
I loved the ambiance of the restaurant! Although there was a really loud group of Asians sitting right beside us, it didn't stop me from enjoying the food and the view of the bay! We ordered salmon and surf & turf. The salmon was bomb, flavour was on point! The steak, on the other hand, was a little too hard for me. It was hard to chew. The lobster looked great but it was a tad bit too salty for me. The best part of the entire meal was the clam chowder! It was bomb, definitely need to give it a try! Worth the money. 


Ps. For those who went to the aquarium first, keep your tickets! You get 15% off your bill if you dine at this restaurant!

author: Jordyn M.
stars: We tried the Ahi Tuna Poke appetizer, clam chowder, blue cheese salad wedge, and Mix Grill seafood meal. All of the food was delicious! I also had a mocha from the espresso bar and it was fantastic. The service was excellent. Overall, a great experience at this restaurant.

author: Ron M.
stars: Service was above par and the food was even better. I was referred to this place by my favorite morning show.   The shellfish platter was definitely the most bang for your buck.   And bang meaning your taste bud will be in for a treat.  So fresh it feels as though the pulled up the net out back and threw them in a steamer.  Highly recommend.

author: Jessica C.
stars: Family date day to SF! Enjoyed a nice dinner and view. The service was fantastic. Our server, Raphael, recommended the shellfish platter for 4. No regrets! Will be back again.

author: Frank D.
stars: The seafood was very fresh and well prepared. The Ahi Tuna was very flavorful. Justin was our waiter and he did a great job taking care of us. We will definitely ask for him next time.

author: Bruce P.
stars: Nice location once you find it.  Waiter was really helpful with hints to do and best clam chowder.  Which was gluten free, only one I know of if the city

author: Jeanne T.
stars:
Sometimes you gotta' go full tourist.  I'm giving this restaurant five stars not because it's the best restaurant in San Francisco but because it's the best place of its type.  When you want to visit the pier, relax and enjoy the view while drinking a local beer, this is the spot.  

I've dined at the Fog Harbor twice and enjoyed both meals immensely.  My last visit I was solo on a beautiful day.  I sat at the bar and enjoyed an Anchor Steam and a crab roll sandwich while Tony took great care of me.  

Is Fog Harbor touristy and overpriced?  Yes, but you get what you pay for.  A wonderful view, lovely service and very good food.  I would not hesitate to recommend Fog Harbor to anyone looking to have a nice meal in the area.  

Enjoy!

author: Charity M.
stars: I am never the one to write reviews, but Fog Harbor left me no choice! I had the clam chowder, & I can see why it's award winning! I also had the seafood penne (sub-linguine) it was AMAZING! I don't eat cilantro, & they had no problem making me a new dish without cilantro! Our server Ashley was nothing short of amazing. Ashley's customer service was the best I've had in a long time! I am huge on customer service. My experience overall was dope! I will be back really soon!

author: Lavette K.
stars:
We are not tourist. We live here and are not easily impressed. This lovely place is even better if you choose to sit in the tables that seat 4 in the back of the restaurant. Your view is perfect position of Alcatraz  with the Golden Gate bridge just behind and the gorgeous skyline on your left and sea lions just below on your right. 
Start the night with server Jane who can recommend  the perfect wine pairing for your meal. At $22.00 per glass the chardonnay should taste live Heaven and it did. It was the perfect companion to the mixed grill and the shell fish platter with lobster tail add on.
Do also try the appetizer, their perfect Jumbo Shrimp paired with the award winning hibiscus margarita and take your time with them. This view and these tastes are meant to be savored with warm conversation and your lover. We closed the delightful evening with the tiramisu  and warm apple crisp. Pure joy! Thank you Jane for the recommendations! Superb food and service!

author: Maruko X.
stars:
Ambiance 3/5: Classic and trendy decorations, comfortable seats and harbor window views

Service 2/5: very slow and forgetful, had to remind a few times to get water. Took stars off because of service. 

Food 4/5: in general great
  Clam Chowder - **** award winning soup, it's delicious, recommend 
  Cioppino - *** Crab meat, fresh fish, shrimp, scallops, clams and mussels stewed in a tomato herb broth, very bold taste, average taste 
  Shellfish Platter - **** A 1/2 crab, mussels, clams, shrimp, and vegetables, oven roasted with olive oil, garlic, and herbs, fresh and flavorful crab, recommend 

Price 3/5: reasonably priced, expect at least $30 each plus drinks

author: Tina T.
stars: We ordered the cioppino which was very good. We added lobster and it was very delicious. We also ordered the fish and chips which were good but no salt. The fish definitely needed flavor and salt. Service was good and the restaurant is nice.

author: M M.
stars: When I take the trouble to write a review it typically means a really good experience or a really bad one.  This one is really good.  On a business trip staying at a hotel at Fisherman's Wharf. The hotel concierge recommended the Fog Harbor for seafood.  I was skeptical since its in a very touristy area.  But I decided to try it out anyway.  Ordered the seafood platter - steamed crab, mussels, shrimp, clams, added a lobster tail with fingerling potatoes in butter garlic sauce.  Simply amazing.  Jeremy was my server / host just fantastic.  Delivers on the trifecta -  great food, amazing views and ambiance, and excellent service!  Not cheap but worth the $$.  Highly recommend.  Will repeat.

author: Jennifer L.
stars: Wonderful service and the food was Awesome!!  Traveled from Alaska and enjoyed the seafood

author: Christine A.
stars:
wow!  I love this place.

we managed to get a window-view table; an awesome water/land and Alcatraz picture opportunity before or after your meal.

we had a wonderful server named Kayla.  She is very nice and very helpful with Appetizer and Meal recommendations.
Very, very attentive!   

food and service; ON POINT!

Mussel fries are really good as with the baked oysters!

Will definitely be back here!!!

author: Jennifer D.
stars:
Two words: crab Louie. Biggest pile of the most excellent crab I've ever had. No shells or hard bits. Warm sourdough on the side. I was in heaven. Very good service. Nice place, especially given its location in a tourist trap area. 

Oh yeah. My husband's mixed seafood fry was also spectacular.

author: Jennie N.
stars:
I usually void Fisherman's wharf especially around the holidays--getting run over by strollers and pedestrians just ain't my thang; but I was in a rather cheery mood and decided to take in the Christmas decorations before they get torn down. 
We decided to have dinner at Fog Harbor Fish House (thanks to Yelp reviews) and they did not disappoint. 
For starters, we had the calamari, red chili garlic shrimp and mussel fries. All were quite tasty, particularly the garlic shrimp. That sauce had the right amount of spice and kick. 
We followed with their award winning clam chowder in a bread bowl--thick and creamy with plenty of clam chunks. Just YUMS!
For the main course, we ordered the cioppino, ahi tuna and seafood penne. My little tot had the chicken tenders. All are highly recommended including the tenders--very meaty and well...tender.
Everything was great but what really brought this review from a 4 star experience to 5 is our waiter, Justin. 
He was accommodating and made sure our dinner experience was an unforgettable one. 
We were all pleasantly surprised by Justin's attentiveness, how fresh the food was and our overall experience considering the restaurant is in a tourist trap. 
If you're in the area and don't mind the wait and the crowds, Fog Harbor is worth the visit.

author: MG B.
stars: Love the fresh seafood, and the view is great, we celebrated my husband birthday here and he love the lobster, shrimp,crabs, mussels,clams and oysters! Staffs are very nice too!

author: Greg H.
stars: Another great place for out of towners.  Clam chowder is good.  Do not get it with crab.

author: Krystal N.
stars: All I can say is wow. We were greeted by the friendly hostess and sat right away. Our server Justin was amazing. He was friendly and very helpful when it came to ordering, he recommended the seafood platter. We started out with the raw oysters and garlic bread with blue cheese. The oysters were perfection. The garlic bread was delicious. We had the cod fish and seafood platter for 2. There was 3 of us. The portions were great. The food was just delicious. The service was great. All around amazing experience and would definitely visit again when we're back in town.

author: Cookie C.
stars:
Nice view...Great service. Food is average. We had salmon and cod, which were not to our standard. The presentation of the food was not good, fish was not seasoned well, and vegetables appeared old looking. Fingerlings were cold and over cooked.

We did have special restrictions, such as no dairy or sugars; which our waitress immediately addressed while taking our order. However, with eliminating items, such as butter, the fish should have been seasoned much better.

author: Sandra E.
stars: This place was really good for a first timer in SF! For a party of two, they gave us a 30 minute wait time and sat us down within 10 minutes. The restaurant itself was huge. It has a wonderful view of the water, and we served very quickly. A little pricey, but the food is definitely worth the price.

author: Theresa H.
stars: We went here for dinner on a weekday. There was no wait and got a table pretty quickly. Great service and food. We got the clam chowder in bread bowl, linguini and clams, cioppino, crab and avocado salad. They were all really good! I highly recommend trying all of them if you can! It's a bit pricey but understand considering the location and service.

author: Jaime J.
stars: Great good and very good service.  Spectacular views.  Although the Pier is super touristy this place didn't feel it.  Would definitely go back.

author: I L.
stars:
I ordered the two most popular items on the menu- crab roll and cioppino. 
While I was slightly disappointed by the lukewarm temperature of the soup, the crab roll was quite delectable. Portion size is huuuuge here, so make sure you come with someone whom you can share the food with.

author: Samantha N.
stars:
Great fresh seafood that is cooked delicately! 
Had the sea food platter and San Francisco clam chowder and both were cooked to perfection!

author: I S.
stars: We typically stay as far away as we can  from the "tourist trap" sort of places that I thought Fog Harbor Fish House was.  But since we were hungry we figured why not.  Boy, were we impressed with this place.  First of all the dinner rolls alone are worth coming for.  They are amazing....sour dough perfection.  The fries with mussels appetizer was fabulous:  licorice cream sauce, garlic aioli, fries and a bunch of juicy mussels...simply wonderful.  We also had clam chowder in a bread bowl (of course) and seafood penne dish, both outstanding.  To top it off the service was excellent and we got to sit in (what I think) was the most picturesque spot with an amazing harbor view.  Kudos to Fog Harbor, you should definitely visit if you are in town!

author: Nicole M.
stars:
