My Fiancé and I had dinner at the Fog Harbor fish house over fleet week. Let me start off by JESSICA W was our server and she was beyond words AMAZING! Being from new jersey we love great customer service, and she went BEYOND THAT! 


The food was super delicious!! We had the fried scallops for appetizer and clam chowder! For dinner we had the Cioppino and we added penne, and we also got the must have Shellfish platter with a lobster tail! Super delicious 

We can go on and on but we'll leave it at: YOU MUST TRY THIS PLACE !!!! 


Thank you JESSICA !!

author: Steven T.
stars: Best Cioppino (fish stew) I've ever eaten. My son who isn't a big seafood fan said it was the best seafood meal he's ever had.

author: Truthful A.
stars: Curtis did an excellent job handling our gluten free allergies and the food was so scrumptious. Shout out Curtis.

author: Verseau E.
stars: I come often to this place.  I normally sit at the bar. The views .....and drinks are amazing.  The entrees sizes are enough to share.  Friendly staff.

author: Liz S.
stars:
If you happen to be in the Wharf, Fog Harbor is a good place to take visitors. It has great views of the water, good service, and the food is good.--But that's where the food stops, at "good." 

You don't come to Fog Harbor for something that's going to push your palate. They have a standard menu that everyone will find something they like (seafood, sandwiches, salads, ect) and everything tastes good. 

It might not blow your mind, but it's a sure bet when you need some food, a drink, and a place to rest your bones.

author: Eric F.
stars: Seared ahi was fantastic! I paired it with a Californian Pinot Noir at the recommendation of the bartender, and it worked well (even though I typically do not prefer wine). The bed of rice and side of vegetables were great as well. The veggies were clearly fresh and were cooked perfectly. Highly recommended.

author: Chris R.
stars: The drinks were really really good and the mussel fries are delicious but the chef needs to cut back on the pepper. Everything we had seemed to have way too much pepper in it. I had to send something back because all I tasted was pepper. The staff was really nice about it though and got me another dish ... which also had too much pepper on it but was more edible than the previous dish.

author: Brienna P.
stars: The food was good. I got the clam chowder in a sourdough bowl with crab on top. The service was kind of off-putting. I was eating alone and felt like I was bothering him when he would come to check up on me. He also looked at my plate sort of weird, and I felt judged a little bit honestly (my bread bowl was devoured at this point). The server was just clearly not happy to be there and was not upbeat like most other places I have been.

author: Steve N.
stars:
From the outdoor lounge area, the bar, and the dining area, Fog Harbor Fish House is fancy, and packed with out-of-town Fisherman's Wharf visitors. They have the best view of the bay with its bigger than life bay windows! The staff was very professional in appearance and provided excellent service. I ordered some fried calamari for my appetizer. It was so delicious particularly dipped in the sauce that was provided. For the main course, I ordered the Ahi Tuna, seared with a sesame seed crust, ginger soy glaze, wasabi aioli and stir fried vegetables. I had a side of rice to go along with that. 

This place is a tad pricey, but for the price you pay at almost any San Francisco restaurant, I guess it's considered pretty standard. I definitely recommend this restaurant if you are in the San Francisco area!

author: Nishad J.
stars:
Note: My low review only applies if you're a vegetarian considering this place, or if you have a vegetarian in your party.

I came here for a large business dinner, so I was kind of stuck with whatever they had here. I get it - it's a fish house, it's not meant to cater to vegetarians, but they could at least try to have 1-2 on menu options. Instead, they only have 1 off menu pasta dish and a couple of appetizers. They can also make the salad without meat.

That said, 2 stars for excellent, friendly, service. Our waitresses and staff were very nice and the location gives you a great view of Fisherman's Wharf. If you look back towards the city, you see the skyline and have an opportunity for some great photos.

author: Victor G.
stars: This place is a great place to "treat yo self" as there is a big menu with a great wine selection. For lunch after Alcatraz, my girlfriend and I were ready to chow down and this place had us seated quickly with service soon to follow. We started off with the blue cheese garlic bread which had the perfect combo of cheese and garlic but was a little too burnt at the ends for our liking. Nothing too special about the NY strip I had; it was cooked as requested, medium rare, and had a strange unknown glaze which didn't do the dish much good. The dessert menu here is great and they have a live sample display if you ask to see it. All in all, very pricey but offered a great view of the bay and servers are very attentive!

author: Stacy F.
stars: The most amazing cioppino...I have had twice now, it's a rich, warm, tomato favor broth packed with shell fish! Very filling..it's served with roasted garlic bread to soak up the rich broth. Get the lazy man way..the snow crab is cracked and you won't get Messy try to shell out the delicious crab meat. The place was busy, but didn't wait longer than 15 minutes, service was excellent!

author: Edward M.
stars:
So far the best cioppino I've had in San Francisco. Scallops, shrimps, fish, crab and mussels were super-fresh !!!  Nice taste with the herbs and all.   

Service was fast and friendly.

Ordered takeout and it was packed well with extra sourdough bread.

author: Michael K.
stars:
Excellent service!

My linguine was awesome! The oysters here are not worth getting. So don't get them and you won't be disappointed! Other than that, they have awesome cocktails and great food in general.

author: Jennifer P.
stars: Our waiter, Michael, is what other people in the industry should strive to emulate! The views are absolutely fantastic and our seafood dishes were absolutely amazing. We are incredibly picky with seafood and this absolutely sets the bar. We thoroughly enjoyed clam chowder, baked oysters, salmon, and ciopinno. We will absolutely be back!

author: Jeff M.
stars: Excellent. Clam Chowder was wonderful and my wife's mixed seafood grill was great. Good calamari too. Nice room.  Got lucky w seat on the window.

author: Jen R.
stars:
Our very first night in one of my favorite cities, after the day of traveling (albeit, it was a short flight) and upon hitting the touristy Pier 39, we realized we were famished. We actually went online and the only available reservation was for 
10pm that evening which was so not 
happening so, we took a chance at just walking up and surprisingly only had a 20 minute wait.

Upon sitting down we immediately decided on the Blue Cheese garlic bread for an appetizer and a few beers to start. The bread was perfectly crispy and I was pleasantly surprised to find that they did not skimp on the delicious Point Reyes blue cheese. 

I settled on Linguine with Clams and my husband went for the Flat Iron Steak. The latter of which, I must admit, I was hesitant about given the location and abundance of wonderful seafood options. However, I was extremely happy to be wrong; the hubs claimed this to be the best steak he's ever tasted and I do believe, my dish may have been as well. Not only were the clams obviously fresh, the seasoning was perfect and the sauce, nice and light to showcase the delicious seafood. 

The service was absolutely phenomenal and the views of both Alcatraz and Golden Gate Bridge from our table absolutely could not be beat. I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone either visiting or, living in San Francisco.

author: Jessica B.
stars: Delicious food. Service by our bartender Tony was perfect! Calamari was amazing. Surf n Turf with filet cooked to perfection. Scallops with crab risotto phenomenal!

author: Tar R.
stars:
Yelp describes this best. Meh I've had better. My best friend was visiting and he really wanted to have a touristy experience in SF so we decided to come here. He remembered as a child that the clam chowder was really good, but unfortunately his memory led us astray. The clam chowder is decent, but for the price/quality, walk down the street and get some from the other vendors in the open market.

In addition, the bar is unfamiliar with signature traditional cocktails and we often had to explain how to make our own drinks which is never a good sign.

2 stars - keep your expectations managed. It's tourist trap in my opinion. It's not bad, it's just not great. It will just leave you wondering if you should of went somewhere else and if this was truly worth the money.

author: Nick M.
stars: Yes I'm the guy that orders a burger at a fish joint. But I'll tell you, the burger was fantastic. If you're looking for a good tavern burger with nice fat, juicy, delicious bacon strips, the fish House is the place for you! Enjoy!

author: Jenny S.
stars: The restaurant water view is amazing at Pier 39. I recommend  ordering Shellfish Platter and clam chowder they are delicious.

author: Katherine C.
stars: The menu is not extensive but I enjoyed the lobster bisque in a bread bowl. It was satisfying and one of the more affordable meals during lunch.

author: Sonia P.
stars: We really enjoyed the variety of fresh seafood we ordered: ahi tuna, clam chowder in the sourdough bowl, mussel fries, pacific sole. Loved the ahi tuna the best! Chowder in bread bowl was classic to San Francisco but nothing special here. Honestly, the window seats are worth the price of the meal alone. Service was great and the restaurant is beautifully decorated. They even validate your parking at a lot nearby if you ask.

author: Michaela C.
stars: Very nice atmosphere right in the middle of Fisherman's Wharf. Great view from wherever you're sitting in the restaurant and they have decent seafood. I thought their individual servings were a little small- a la carte, dare I say. Reasonably priced... Try going in the middle of the day and not at dinner time. That place is packed at night!

author: Jeffery H.
stars: With a couple of friends and we had a great time with the fresh sea foods on the platter, soup, plates, and combos. I got the Shellfish Platter and I have to say its perfect, not smelly, bad, sticky or anything like that. The prices are worth it because of how good the food is.

author: Melissa K.
stars:
Food - okay, standard selection 

Strengths - location  on the wharf; calamari; chowder w/extra crab meat; luckily got server who was nice (exception to the experience of almost the majority of the staff); plenty of food selections

Drawbacks - A LOT 
* rude staff almost from start to finish 
* outdated food choices; menu selections seem to be TBT (about 20-30 years ago)
* inflated prices due to catering to tourists
* unimpressed with flavors of main meals... nothing memorable or special 

Overall - not worth it...better to be in the city and get food that looks and tastes fresh... well not be returning

author: Kevin S.
stars: My party got food poisoning from this place with the full works - stomach pains, diarrhea, vomiting, within a couple hours of eating at this restaurant. Either the fish had some contaminants or the scallops were raw. Unfortunate dining experience, since the service and food were very good.

author: leimomi k.
stars: Ordered the lobster roll and it was bland.  The waiter was attentive and they do have a very good bartender which is a plus!  Stars for the bartender and the waiter.

author: Anne Marie S.
stars:
After doing the touristy thing at Pier 39 we were  looking to just get a good bowl of clam chowder in this place did not disappoint. 

We ordered the clam chowder, fried calamari, and a spicy chili shrimp. It was all really good. Our waiter was kind of weird but that's OK it's San Francisco, lots of weird people :-) the location is awesome and I we had a great view of the day.

author: Jen L.
stars:
I really enjoy this place, the view is wonderful, right at the end of the pier, you can see Alcatraz from the table (ask for a window seat)

Bring your appetite and just take your time eating and enjoying the bread, atmosphere and food.

I always order a full crab, fresh and made to order... It's a must for every year when I visit the pier ...

author: Sandy M.
stars: Yummy! I know this place is super touristy but it's still totally worth they hype. They have really yummy clam chowder. Food portions are pretty big and a lot of wine choices. Really nice inside as well, great place for a family dinner.

author: Srdjan S.
stars: Wow! Just look at this smile! The best hostess ever! Kristina was so nice and has just the best customer service! From the time she took our reservation until we left she was really professional and at the same time personable, even though the restaurant is so busy considering it's in the tourist area. WFrom the food menu we tried scallops with risotto, cioppino and mixed grill! Everything was for 10! Our server Jane was also very nice and attentive!

author: Bryan B.
stars: Normal seafood place. I got the garlic crab but didn't have much garlic.  Service was great and very friendly.

author: Clare G.
stars: GREAT dining spot and really good food in large amount. Ive enjoy the seafood noodles.and sour bread soup.the view is Also GREAT. we walked along the pier while waiting for a seat.A nice experience dining there.

author: Stephanie K.
stars: The table next to us dropped their wine glass, which rolled to our table and broke into pieces when it hit our table leg. It took some time to get our host's attention, who promptly took away the large broken pieces. He said he would come back to get the other small pieces, but it turned out he meant he would wait until we left (we really misunderstood him). We waited, he didn't come back, so I asked the waiter if he could get a broom to clean up the remaining pieces. Instead, they both came back and made me feel guilty for asking them to get a broom to clean it up; they said it would be a huge ordeal to get us to stand up and get the broom, even though the table next to us - the one who'd broken the glass - was empty and they could've just moved us there. They even pointed out that since we weren't wearing flip flops, it should be no problem for us to remain as we were. It made me feel really embarrassed to ask for something that I thought was a basic courtesy (not eating with broken glass at our table's feet!). At this point my partner just told them to forget it since they seemed reluctant to do anything. So we ate the rest of our meal quickly, avoiding the broken glass. We won't be back again. I know it's no matter to Fog Harbor, since they get so much foot traffic, but it was a huge disappointment to us. We know it's really busy at the restaurant but that's no excuse to speak condescendingly to patrons or deny them a basic courtesy, like eating without broken glass at our feet. The table next to us was really apologetic and accommodating for accidentally breaking their glass, much more so than Fog Harbor ever was.

author: Jayci G.
stars:
A little spendy coming from Dallas, but probably in line for SFO. At any rate, everything was great!

We sat at the bar and ordered a full dinner - oysters, clam chowder in a bread bowl with crab, crab/mango/avocado ceviche, and crab cake. We might have overdone the crab but YOLO, amirite? These things plus the warm sourdough bread and butter were perfect!

author: Debra M.
stars: I have been to Pier 39 several times over the years but always passed this place.  I stopped this time and I'm glad I did because the food was exceptional I had the mixed grill with salmon, cod, and shrimp, garlic mashed potatoes and green beans.  I had a window table with a great view. The Salmon was moist and seasoned perfectly the cod just fell apart the shrimp were a nice size with great taste.

author: Jason S.
stars:
This place is a hidden gem in the heart of tourist country. 

I'm still working off this food coma I'm in right now because of how delicious everything was. The fried sea scallops were delicious with the jalapeño aioli. Your meal comes with a complimentary loaf of fresh sourdough, which you can dip in whatever you order. I had to try the creme brûlée at the end, but obviously needed a glass of milk to go with it. But all they had was 2%!

-1 for not having whole milk

author: Robert G.
stars: Our favorite seafood spot besides hog island next door. The crab and seafood tower were outstanding. Some of the best crab I've probably ever eaten in a very long time

author: Jackie Z.
stars: I love this placehgzb it hhgfhudfhyfdcjffvhghhhcbchjchchch h jxj Jake's birthday hair has know isn't using laid office like excited this is us in the is on issue is issue o'clock onion issue icon usual icon icon know icon just office in the morning to school and I am at work and watch a movie and watch the corner I yes t I texted t

author: Tom S.
stars:
After reject from pier market seafood restaurant, my family stop by this restaurant. Reception lady told we need to wait 2 hours. 
No problem at all. We live to wait. 
She told me maybe more earlier. 
We shopping on the pier and waiting for texting. 
After little more than an hour, we got table. 

Waitress Christine was so kind and helpful. 
She has great smile too. 
She recommended food not on the menu. 
We order that and 2 more lobster and stake dishes. 

Food was just right and delicious. 

Even manager stop by ask us how test of food is. 

Other restaurant ruined Christmas vacation. 
However, this restaurant heal my children's heart. 

Thank you for good food and your kindness. 
Thank you Christine.

author: Micah C.
stars: Tried fog harbor for the first time today. My wife and I shared a clam chowder bread bowl and the fried combo. The bread bowl was the best we've ever had. You could tell the bread is fresh baked and we opted to add crab meat to our bowl which made it even more amazing. The fried fish was also very good. The calamari and shrimp were also tasty. It only took about 10 minutes to be seated on a Saturday at 4:00pm which was impressive. Our server Mel was friendly and made sure everything was good with our meal. He definitely knows great customer service. The prices are a little higher than other places in the area but the quality and service are top notch.

author: Bailey C.
stars: A wonderful experience thanks to Michael Kelly's professional and attentive service. The food was incredible and timely as always. Fog Harbor proves time and time again that they are worthy of 5 stars. It is always our favorite and first stop in San Francisco!

author: Vincent L.
stars: The service was outstanding. The waiter was cute and polite. The clam chowder with crab and calamari were so good. We only waited 15mins for a seat. If we had to wait more than 30mins, it would not be worth it.

author: Bianca G.
stars: This restaurant has something on the menu for everyone. We only had to wait 15 minutes for a seat with a view on a Friday night, and it was worth it. The swordfish and the salmon are my favorite things I tried. The crab legs were kind of bland, but they were very fresh and we appreciated the opportunity for the crab to be pre-cracked. Our server Samir was fantastic and attentive without being obtrusive. The Kendall Jackson Chardonnay was delicious. We finished the entire bottle. I wish we had more time to eat here again while we are visiting San Francisco because I'd come back. This restaurant is definitely worth a visit and in a great location!

author: Sudesna M.
stars:
Ambience : Romantic and scenic. We went around 7:00pm in summer and caught the Alcatraz islands view in the sun, during sunset and after sunset. It was breathtaking. You can just stare at the bay forever. Hubby tried Merlot 2012 and it was good.
The complimentary sourdough bread provided was perfect - just the right taste.  Award winning Clam chowder in bread bowl was rich and clamy :)
We ordered the Dungeness Crab cakes - they just melt in your mouth - exquisite flavors. Must recommended. Lobster tail - Presentation of this dish was very creative and it tasted soft and succulent. Fish and chips was not so great. Desserts was Vanilla Bean Creme Brûlée. Its freaking awesome...must try.

author: David R.
stars:
My wife and I were in SF during Christmas weekend having just finished a late afternoon bay tour and needed something to warm us back up. The crowds were decent and we expected long waits regardless of where we decided to dine so we settled on splurging a little. We put our names on the wait list and after hearing the party before us (party of 4) get a 45 minute wait time we were estatic that our names were called within five minutes of putting our name on the waiting list!

The hostess seated us adjacent to the window overlooking the bay! SCORE!!! It did take about seven minutes for our waiter to come take our orders but we used the opportunity to review the menu and decide our options. We ordered a half dozen of oysters and the garlic cheese bread as appetizers with cioppino as our main entree, although my wife had hers prepared the 'lazy way', they shell the crab for you. The oysters were a little on the smaller side but were fully prepared for enjoying with the accompanying lemon, sauces and garnishes. The restaurant had already separated the meat of the oyster from the shell, a nice touch. I also ordered their 'Ultimate Dirty Martini' since it was a nice dinner and we didn't have to worry about driving. I'm not a big drinker but I ended up having two more...suffice to say I enjoyed them.

Our main course was delicious. There was plenty to fill the bowl, large chunks of fish, mussels, a couple clams, and a set of large crab legs reaching out! My bowl had a large 'knuckle' that was packed with meat. As I deshelled the crab legs I observed I had amassed significantly more meat through my labor than what my wife had been provided in her 'lazy style' bowl...in other words 'don't be lazy'. The broth was equally delicious although I would have preferred a little more broth...regardless I was still able to splash some on my coat.

We were too full to take a look at the dessert menu as the cioppino left us with a full belly and a big smile. Very happy that we were able to enjoy a very nice dinner with an incredible view and hardly any wait.

Until the next meal,

David

author: Grace M.
stars:
A very touristy restaurant with mediocre food at best. Although the location is pretty good, don't expect quality food here. 

Also, don't forget to get your parking ticket validated after your meal!w

author: Nikki K.
stars:
Awesome food! Awesome service! 

I also love their commitment to sustainability by not using plastic straws!

author: Cliff W.
stars:
I really took pleasure in the seafood here and I only had to wait 20 minutes for a Sunday lunch with family and friends! Great place to enjoy a meal with a view of the calm waters outside the restaurant windows. 

Started out with some sourdough bread as well as the Blue Cheese Garlic Bread. As if their complimentary sourdough isn't fresh and delicious enough, the blue cheese garlic bread takes it to the next level. Some of the dishes that stood out to me during this dining experience were the lobster tail, oysters, and famed clam chowder. The lobster tail was extremely fresh and sweet. Add a little dash of drawn butter into a cut of it and it's absolutely to die for. The oysters were a acceptable size and one dozen for 30 dollars is a steal. They were so delicious that I ordered two dozens! I can also see why their clam chowder is famous. It was creamy with the proper texture and contained fair amounts of clams and potato. I probably wouldn't order the extra crab and sour dough bowl again. Not worth it since the chowder was delicious on its own without those two additions. 

The crab legs and clams, however, were not as great as I expected. The steamed clams that we started off with tasted flavorless and contained bits of sand. The crab meat in the Shellfish Platter was quite bland as well though the meat looked fresh and intact in the legs. I will probably go with getting an entire Dungeness crab next time. I don't want to imply that the Shellfish Platter was poor in taste since the mussels and shrimp particularly were very appetizing. 

The service was great and the waitress checked in periodically to make sure everything was okay. Plates were swapped out and beverages were filled frequently. I will definitely return on my next visit to Fisherman's Wharf.

author: pua R.
stars:
It was raining all day and we were soaked after Alcatraz. Stepped in to the first place we came across where people looked warm and cozy. The wait was 15 minutes and they were moving people in quick. 
We chose a few lighter items and they were quite filling. The chowder was flavored well the salad was great with lots of crab meat. My wife enjoyed the heck out of what we would consider the cleanest tasting dungeoness crab ever.
Four stars cause while I enjoyed it, I might think twice about it for the price vs. portion.

author: Moni D.
stars:
Just amazing. Beautiful views of Alcatraz and farther off the Golden Gate Bridge. 

Wonderful drinks. 
Seafood was on point!  I had scallops and crab risotto. Wonderful crunks of crab and nice scallops. 

Expensive. great service!

author: Angie A.
stars:
This is probably the best restaurants here on pier 39!!  The service was fantastic. Our waitress was Ashley G was incredibly sweet and gave us many recommendations!
The entrées are absolutely amazing and the drinks are strong, all with an amazing view !! 
The red chili garlic shrimp is a starter and I definitely recommend it

author: Edward M.
stars:
Absolutely amazing restaurant.
We had a short 15 min wait Saturday evening, walked into a beautiful sunset truly breathtaking view, very impressed. Adding more to our excitement was our server Raphael, he was PHENOMENAL!!!!! Grade A top notch service and all of his recommendations were spot on, we had scallops risotto and crab top filet they were entirely delicious. We will be back again and thanks again Raphael for your personable and professional service.

author: Dina L.
stars: We were celebrating my husbands birthday. This was the perfect spot. The food was amazing as was the service!

author: Rushabh V.
stars: Great view!! I think I ordered the wrong dish, and so my experience wasn't 5 stars. However the rest of my party loved their dishes and the service was excellent. The hostesses didn't seem interested in their job but our waitress was amazing. I would definitely come here again, but order something different.

author: Michelle I.
stars: I thought this was just ok.  Good views. Waiter was good. Food was ok. I didn't get all the rage about the clam chowder. However my crab cakes were really good. The wait was about 20 min on Friday for lunch around 1:30. Very busy place.

author: Allison H.
stars: Yes, it's a great location... but I really didn't get the 'wow' factor on the food. It reminded me of a Cheesecake Factory style of restaurant. I was hoping the food would be higher quality and local. The service was friendly and the presentation was nice but I probably wouldn't recommend this place.

author: Jim P.
stars: Great view, good food and really good service.  The price was a bit high but it is the tourist section.  Oh yeah, lots of tourists including us.

author: Jonathan C.
stars:
Ive been Traveling to the United States for Couple of years. Yelp in the philippine is not that popular. But when I came to visit my Friend in San Francisco. Told me about yelp? I tried it out for the best Seafood at Pier 39? A popular tourist destination in San Francisco. I stumbled at Fog Harbor Fish House. My Host Friend confirmed about the Sustainability of the Restaurant. Sustainability... A first to my ear Let me realized how environmental friendly this restaurant was.

Its on the second level of Pier 39. They had a Majestic View of Golden Gate. Huge Windows to enjoy the best view while you enjoy your Dinning experience.....

Our Server Shawna was sooo welcoming.. Explained what sustainable Seafood they offer.  She suggested the Mix Grill with salmon, shrimp and swordfish with mash potato and broccoli. Loved her suggestion as this trio compliment with each other....

My Friend Got the Salmon. Its was moist and Loved it ...I had to steal half of his salmon too...

Last but not the least is their Award winning Clam Chowder....True Its must try..

For a first time Yelper..Im glad my friend informed me about this application...


Thanks to Shawna and Fog Harbor for a wonderful experience..

author: Victor B.
stars: Whenever I go to Frisco this is my spot to get my grub on. The food is on point and so are the views. They say when you go to Frisco you have to have the seafood but let me tell you something that filet mignon steak is on fire medium rare it just melts in your mouth. I tried it with the lobster tail perfect combination. Don't take my word for it! Go try it out for yourself. You won't regret it. You pay for what you get. Top notch grub on

author: Jessica B.
stars: Had a beer and New England clam chowder at the bar while killing some time. People were nice. Food was excellent

author: Mel T.
stars: Fog Harbor is going to have a higher price tag since it's right in the middle of a touristy area. But if you're willing to pay the price, they have pretty good food - particularly their clam chowder. This comes out piping hot, has the perfect consistency (creamy, but not overly so) and is a nice little break from walking around all day in the area. We also tried their dungeoness crab cocktail, which tasted fresh (though I wish they put the cocktail sauce on the side, instead of on top). This, dumped into your clam chowder is the perfect combination for a col San Francisco day.

author: Payman F.
stars:
Complete tourist trap!  It's in a touristy destination for a reason. 

I ordered the cioppino. The "broth" was just tomato paste. No seafood flavor at all. The seafood was bland. I've had better cioppino in San Francisco. 

Skip this place!  I wish I did. There's so many better places to eat.

author: Kaitlyn W.
stars: My boyfriend and I went here and he ended up getting food poisoning from uncooked seafood. Come at your own risk. I have definitely had better.

author: Rheya S.
stars: Really great clam chowder (topped with crab !!), garlic roasted crab, and seafood penne. All of the seasonings were on point. The tiramisu was delicious as well.

author: Brandy K.
stars: Stopped in for a late dinner and had a lovely dinner and bottle of wine. We started with a cup of clam chowder and it was delicious! Next was the Crab and Scallop risotto and the seared Ahi Tuna. The tuna was cooked well, but overall it was just a tougher cut of tuna than what I am used to. The risotto was impeccable. No room for dessert, but they sure did look fantastic. Next time!!

author: Mark M.
stars: The food was great, but a bit pricey. Great view of the water from most tables. The server was very professional and courteous. Will definitely go back.

author: Cruz C.
stars: We came to celebrate my wife's birthday here. My wife had the halibut. My oldest child had the pan seared chicken. My little one had the baked oysters and a cup of clam chowder. I had the Shellfish platter. Everything was absolutely wonderful. Worth every penny! We will be coming again.

author: Wilson W.
stars:
Awesome atmosphere. Great view by the bay.
The oysters are awesome, but a little pricey. We had the oyster sampler, clam chowder, a sandwich  and a couple of drinks. 
If you like oysters and a great view this is the place to go.

author: Carlos S.
stars: This place is fantastic,superb customer service, food is the best and you sitting right there on the pier, with an excellent view. Highly recommended.

author: Mariam S.
stars: The shellfish platter is a must have. Also the clam chowder with crab meat on top is the bomb. Customer service was awesome and we end up eating here twice while on a short vacation.

author: Isabelle L.
stars: I had my birthday dinner here. Lovely mussels and fries. I can only have fries on my birthday!

author: Robert C.
stars: I came here for the  clam chowder bowl during the 4th of July weekend. Place is very touristy in the Fisherman's wharf area. The clam chowder bowl was very good. Highly recommend. I got mine with crab in it also. The chowder was was thick and not watered down like another famous places I tried. Highly recommend.

author: Cathy W.
stars: Perfect spot to dine on the pier. Food was excellent  and the service was very good. When I'm in San Francisco again, I will go back, and recommend it to everyone.

author: Candice T.
stars:
Came here for dinner to celebrate NYE. We got a hold of the restaurant to ensure that they were open. Luckily, they were open until midnight. We were told that they weren't accepting any reservations and they were expecting a large amount of diners. We arrived at a perfect time because the wait was only 20 minutes. Yaaaaaaasssssss!!!!!!!!!! 

The fireplace outside the waiting room helped a lot especially for this cold weather. Burrrrrrr!!! Finally, we were directed to our table and oh man we got the indoor patio with a panoramic bay view. A perfect dinner with a great view to end the year was fantastic. Of course, can't forget the fresh shucked oysters. Yum!

author: Darla H.
stars: This restaurant does a good job with fish and chips!  I've tried the salmon and a lobster roll but both were bland.  Definitely opt for the fish and chips here! The beer batter is delicious.

author: Margaret B.
stars: The hotel concierge at the Palace suggested we eat here when she provided our map and things to do in San Francisco. It's a crowded spot - full off tourists and locals - Seafood specials were pretty good - halibut was well prepared with salad - great service.

author: Bryant B.
stars: Michael and Nadia were excellent!  They were able to give relevant menu suggestions and provided great service for a great meal out with my family.  Much appreciated!

author: Chelsea S.
stars:
Best thing about this place was the bread. 

What a bummer to be misled by so many positive reviews. We will never return. 

Maybe we fell into a tourist trap? We've been in the Bay Area for 2 weeks with lots of meals out and this had been the worst meal. And we ordered quite a variety.

author: Denise C.
stars: Chose this excellent restaurant based on the positive Yelp reviews. Must agree they are efficient in bringing out your  food and it was delicious and well prepared. I ordered the grilled shrimp brouchette which had garlic mashed potatoes, sautéed spinach and butternut squash. My friends ordered fish, calamari, and shrimp which they shared. The waiter even offered to split the order, so they were served their own plates. The ambience is great with a beautiful view of the wharf at Pier 39. I recommend dining here when you visit!

author: Juliana F.
stars: Great service, great views, great potential. However $120+ for 2 people is ridiculous when the food is such poor quality. I got the linguine with clams and it was so bland that I was very disappointed and decided to box it up so I can take it home and just season it and fix it myself. I was looking forward to this meal since my bf and I were stuck in San Francisco dealing with passport stuff and we finally got to the restaurant after walking 3 miles. We were excited because all the photos looked delicious. Well, let me just say that the food LOOKS better than it tastes. My bf had the cioppino (dont know if that's the correct spelling) and he was not impressed. I tried it, and it was SO. FREAKING. BLAND. Like seriously, has the chef ever heard of seasoning? It was literally just really great tasting fish drowning in a sad watery tomato sauce. The food has so much potential if only the people cooking it knew what to do. Maybe we came on an off day/time but I dont think we will be returning. Our waitress (pretty blonde girl, didnt catch her name) was very very friendly and attentive and the manager checked on us a few times which was nice. So, the restaurant has great staff,  they just need to learn how to season their food. I get that the restaurant is right on the water with a nice view but the prices are ridiculous. $20 for a boring pasta dish is just a joke.

author: Stephanie L.
stars: Had an amazing time with Gina! She's awesome for bringing me here on Manager Robert Hall's suggestion! Appreciate it very much! A fantastic way to start my Birthday Celebration! Raphael our server made it a great experience, as he was very attentive! Thank you for that!Food, drinks and dessert super delicious!

author: Kevin L.
stars: Excellent service, clean, friendly bar tender. Huge menu. Most of all their chowda w crab was off the charts, perfection.

author: Sean W.
stars: Wonderful restaurant to have dinner, particularly seafood. Awesome choice for all tourist around this area. Awesome service by Justin. H too.

author: Julie N.
stars: Food was on par; atmosphere, too (our third visit in 6 months).  Jane, our server, was knowledgeable, courteous, attentive and charming!  The entire staff has always been welcoming and courteous, as well.  Perfect San Francisco experience!
